Name: Hûd
Verse: Alif lām rā’: [This is] a Book whose verses have been set out clearly, and then detailed from One Wise, Informed,

Name: Hûd
Verse: And [bidding you]: 'Ask forgiveness of your Lord, then repent to Him, and He will give you fair enjoyment until a time appointed, and He will give every person of merit, [the due for] his merit. But if you turn away, I fear for you the chastisement of an awful day.

Name: Hûd
Verse: Unto God is your return, and He has power over all things'.

Name: Hûd
Verse: Lo! they fold up their breasts that they may hide from Him; lo! the moment they cover themselves with their garments, He knows what they keep hidden and what they proclaim. Truly He knows what is in the breasts [of men].

Name: Hûd
Verse: And there is not a creature in the earth but the sustenance thereof rests on God. And He knows its habitation and its repository. All is in a manifest Book.

Name: Hûd
Verse: And He it is Who created the heavens and the earth in six days - and His Throne was upon the water - that He might try you, which of you is best in conduct. And if you were to say, 'Truly you shall be raised again after death', those who disbelieve will say, 'This is nothing but manifest sorcery'.

Name: Hûd
Verse: And if we postpone the chastisement for them until a reckoned time, they will surely say, 'What is detaining it?' Verily on the day when it comes to them, it cannot be averted from them, and that which they derided shall surround them.

Name: Hûd
Verse: And if We cause man to taste some mercy from Us, and then wrest it from him, lo! he is despairing, ungrateful.

Name: Hûd
Verse: But if We cause him to taste prosperity after some misery that had befallen him, assuredly he will say, 'The ills have gone from me'; lo! he is exultant, boastful;

Name: Hûd
Verse: save those who endure [patiently] and perform righteous deeds; theirs will be forgiveness and a great reward.

Name: Hûd
Verse: Perhaps, you might [think to] leave out some of what is revealed to you, and that your breast should be straitened by it, because they say, 'Why has a treasure not been sent down for him, or an angel not come with him?' You are but a warner, and God is Guardian over all things.

Name: Hûd
Verse: Or do they say, ‘He has invented it?’ Say: ‘Then bring ten sūras the like thereof, invented, and call upon whom you can beside God if you are truthful’.

Name: Hûd
Verse: Then, if they do not answer you, know that it has been revealed only in God's knowledge, and that there is no god save Him. Will you then submit?

Name: Hûd
Verse: He who desires the life of this world and its adornment - We shall repay them their deeds in it, and therein they shall not be defrauded.

Name: Hûd
Verse: Those are they for whom there is nothing in the Hereafter but the Fire; what they contrive will have failed therein, and useless is that which they used to do.

Name: Hûd
Verse: Is he who relies on a clear proof from his Lord - [a clear proof] which is followed by a witness from Him, and before it was the Book of Moses as an example and a mercy? Those they believe in it; but he who disbelieves in it of the partisans, the Fire shall be his appointed place. So do not be in doubt concerning it. Truly it is the Truth from your Lord, but most of mankind do not believe.

Name: Hûd
Verse: And who does greater wrong than he who invents a lie concerning God? Those, they shall be brought before their Lord and the witnesses will say: 'These are they who lied concerning their Lord'. Surely the curse of God is upon the wrong-doers;

Name: Hûd
Verse: they who bar [people] from God's way, desiring [to have] it crooked; and in the Hereafter they are disbelievers.

Name: Hûd
Verse: Such will not escape in the earth and, beside God they [can] have no allies. For them the chastisement will be double. They could not hear, nor did they use to see.

Name: Hûd
Verse: Such are they who have lost their souls, and that which they used to invent, has failed them.

Name: Hûd
Verse: Without doubt they will be the greatest losers in the Hereafter.

Name: Hûd
Verse: Truly those who believe and perform righteous deeds and humble themselves before their Lord: such will be the inhabitants of Paradise, abiding therein.

Name: Hûd
Verse: The likeness of the two parties is as the blind and the deaf and the one who sees and the one who hears are they equal in likeness? Will you not then remember?

Name: Hûd
Verse: And verily We sent Noah to his people [and he said]: 'I am for you a clear warner.

Name: Hûd
Verse: Worship none but God. Lo! I fear for you the chastisement of a painful day’.

Name: Hûd
Verse: The council of his people who disbelieved, said: 'We see you but a mortal like us, and we see not that any follow you save the vilest among us, [through] rash opinion. We do not see that you have any merit over us; nay, we deem you liars'.

Name: Hûd
Verse: He said, 'O my people, have you considered if I am [acting] upon a clear proof from my Lord and He has given me mercy from Him, and it has been obscured from you, can we compel you to it, while you are averse to it?

Name: Hûd
Verse: And O my people, I do not ask of you any wealth for this. My wage falls only upon God and I will not drive away those who believe; they shall surely meet their Lord. But I see you are a people who are ignorant.

Name: Hûd
Verse: And O my people, who would help me against God if I drive them away? Will you not then remember?

Name: Hûd
Verse: And I do not say to you, “I possess the treasure houses of God” nor, “I have knowledge of the Unseen”; nor do I say, “I am an angel”. Nor do I say to those whom your eyes scorn that God will not give them any good — God knows best what is in their souls. Lo! then indeed I would be of the evildoers’.

Name: Hûd
Verse: They said, 'O Noah, you have disputed with us and disputed with us at length, so bring upon us that wherewith you are threatening us if you are of the truthful'.

Name: Hûd
Verse: He said, 'Only God will bring it upon you, if He wills; and you cannot escape Him.

Name: Hûd
Verse: And my counsel will not benefit you if I desire to counsel you when God desires to keep you astray. He is your Lord and to Him you will be brought back'.

Name: Hûd
Verse: Or do they say, 'He has invented it'? Say: 'If I have invented it, then my crime will be upon me; and I am innocent of what you commit'.

Name: Hûd
Verse: And it was revealed to Noah that: 'None of your people will believe except he who has already believed. Do not be distressed because of what they do.

Name: Hûd
Verse: Build the Ark under Our eyes and by Our inspiration, and do not address Me concerning those who have done evil; lo! they shall be drowned'.

Name: Hûd
Verse: And he was building the Ark and whenever a council of his people passed him, they scoffed at him. He said, 'Though you scoff at us, yet we scoff at you, even as you scoff;

Name: Hûd
Verse: and you shall know to whom will come a chastisement degrading him, and upon whom an enduring chastisement will fall'.

Name: Hûd
Verse: Such that when Our command came and the oven gushed forth, We said, 'Load therein of every kind two, and your family save those against whom the Word has already gone forth, and those who believe'. And none but a few believed with him.

Name: Hûd
Verse: And he said, 'Embark therein! In the Name of God be its course and its mooring. Truly my Lord is Forgiving, Merciful'.

Name: Hûd
Verse: And it sailed with them amid waves like mountains, and Noah called out to his son, who was standing away, 'O my son, embark with us and do not be with the disbelievers!'

Name: Hûd
Verse: He said, 'I shall take refuge in a mountain that will protect me from the water.' Said he, 'This day there is none that can protect from God's command, except him on whom He has mercy'. And the waves came between them, so he was among the drowned.

Name: Hûd
Verse: And it was said, ‘O earth, swallow your waters, and O heaven, abate!’ And the waters subsided. And the affair was accomplished and it settled upon al-Jūdī; and it was said: ‘Away with the evildoing folk!’

Name: Hûd
Verse: And Noah called out to his Lord and said, 'My Lord, lo! my son is of my family, and truly Your promise is the Truth, and You are the Most Just of Judges'.

Name: Hûd
Verse: He said: 'O Noah, lo! he is not of your family; lo! it is not a righteous deed. So do not ask of Me that whereof you have no knowledge. I admonish you lest you be among the ignorant'.

Name: Hûd
Verse: He said, 'My Lord, I seek refuge in You that I should ask of You that whereof I have no knowledge. Unless You forgive me and have mercy on me I shall be among the losers'.

Name: Hûd
Verse: It was said, 'O Noah, go down in peace from Us and blessings upon you and upon some communities [that will spring] from those with you. And [there will be other] communities to whom We shall give enjoyment, and then a painful chastisement will befall them'.

Name: Hûd
Verse: Those are of the tidings of the Unseen, which We inspire in you. You yourself did not know it, nor did your people [know it] before this. So be patient. Truly the sequel is for those who are God-fearing.

Name: Hûd
Verse: And to ‘ād their brother Hūd. He said, ‘O my people, worship God! You have no god other than He. You do but invent.

Name: Hûd
Verse: O my people, I do not ask of you any wage for it. Lo! my wage falls only upon Him Who originated me. Will you not understand?

Name: Hûd
Verse: And, O my people, ask forgiveness of your Lord, then turn to Him repentant; He will release the sky upon you in abundance, and He will add to you strength to your strength. Do not turn away as sinners'.

Name: Hûd
Verse: They said, ‘O Hūd, you have not brought us any clear proof, and we are not going to forsake our gods on [the basis of] your saying, and we are not believers in you.

Name: Hûd
Verse: We say nothing, save that one of our gods has possessed you in some evil way'. He said, 'Lo! I call God to bear witness, and you, bear witness also, that I am innocent of what you associate,

Name: Hûd
Verse: beside Him; so plot against me all together, then give me no respite.

Name: Hûd
Verse: Truly I have put my trust in God, my Lord and your Lord; there is no creature, but He takes it by the forelock. Surely my Lord is on a straight path.

Name: Hûd
Verse: And if you turn away, still I have conveyed to you that wherewith I was sent to you, and my Lord will set in place of you a folk other than you. You cannot injure Him in any way. Truly My Lord is Preserver over all things'.

Name: Hûd
Verse: And when Our command came to pass We delivered Hūd and those who believed with him by a mercy from Us, and We delivered them from a harsh chastisement.

Name: Hûd
Verse: And that was ‘ād: they knowingly denied the signs of their Lord and disobeyed His messengers; and they followed the command of every rebellious tyrant.

Name: Hûd
Verse: And a curse was made to follow them in this world and on the Day of Resurrection. ‘Lo! ‘ād disbelieved in their Lord. Lo! away with ‘ād, the folk of Hūd!’

Name: Hûd
Verse: And to Thamūd, their brother Sālih. He said, ‘O my people, worship God! You have no god other than He. He it is Who produced you from the earth, and has given you to live therein; so ask forgiveness of Him, then turn to Him repentant. Truly my Lord is Near, Responsive’.

Name: Hûd
Verse: They said, ‘O Sālih, you had been one of promise among us before this. Do you forbid us to worship what our fathers worshipped? Truly we are in grave doubt concerning that to which you are calling us’.

Name: Hûd
Verse: He said, 'O my people, have you considered: if I am [acting] upon a clear proof from my Lord, and He has given me from Him mercy, who will help me against God if I disobey Him? You would only be adding to my loss.

Name: Hûd
Verse: And, O my people, this is the she-camel of God, a sign for you. Leave her to eat in God's earth and do not cause her any harm, lest you be seized by a near chastisement'.

Name: Hûd
Verse: But they hamstrung her, and he said, 'Enjoy [yourselves] in your dwellings for three days. That is a promise that will not be belied'.

Name: Hûd
Verse: So, when Our command came, We delivered Sālih and those who believed with him by a mercy from Us, and from the ignominy of that day. Truly your Lord is the Strong, the Mighty.

Name: Hûd
Verse: And those who did evil were seized by the Cry, so that they ended up lying lifeless prostrate in their habitations,

Name: Hûd
Verse: as if they had not dwelt there: ‘Lo! Thamūd disbelieved in their Lord, lo! away with Thamūd!’

Name: Hûd
Verse: And verily Our messengers came to Abraham with good tidings. They said, 'Peace!' He said, 'Peace!', did not delay to bring a roasted calf.

Name: Hûd
Verse: And when he saw their hands not reaching to it, he was suspicious of them and conceived a fear of them. They said, 'Fear not. Lo! we have been sent to the people of Lot'.

Name: Hûd
Verse: And his wife, standing by, laughed; and so We gave her the good tiding of Isaac, and, after Isaac, of Jacob.

Name: Hûd
Verse: She said, 'Woe to me! Shall I bear a child when I am an old woman, and this my husband is an old man? Truly this is a strange thing'.

Name: Hûd
Verse: They said, 'Are you astonished by God's command? The mercy of God and His blessings be upon you, people of the House! Truly He is Praised, Glorious!'

Name: Hûd
Verse: And when the awe departed from Abraham and the good tiding came to him, he began to plead with Us concerning the people of Lot.

Name: Hûd
Verse: Assuredly Abraham was forbearing, imploring, penitent.

Name: Hûd
Verse: 'O Abraham, desist from this. Truly your Lord's command has gone forth, and truly there will come upon them a chastisement which cannot be repelled'.

Name: Hûd
Verse: And when Our messengers came to Lot, he was distressed, and felt constrained in his power to protect them, and he said, 'This is a distressful day'.

Name: Hûd
Verse: And his people came to him, running towards him - and previously they had been committing abominations. He said, 'O my people! Here are my daughters; they are purer for you. So fear God, and do not degrade me before my guests. Is there not among you any upright man?'

Name: Hûd
Verse: They said, 'You know full well that we have no right to your daughters, and you know well what we desire'.

Name: Hûd
Verse: He said, 'Would that I had strength to resist you or could resort to some strong support!'

Name: Hûd
Verse: They said, 'O Lot, truly we are messengers of your Lord. They shall not reach you, so travel with your family during a part of the night, and let not one of you turn round, except for your wife: lo! she shall be smitten by that which smites them. Truly their tryst is [for] the morning: is the morning not nigh [enough]?'

Name: Hûd
Verse: So when Our command came to pass, We made their uppermost the nethermost, and We rained upon them stones of baked clay, one after another,

Name: Hûd
Verse: marked with your Lord, and they are not far from the evildoers.

Name: Hûd
Verse: And to Midian their brother Shu‘ayb. He said, ‘O my people, worship God! You have no god other than He. And diminish not the measure or the weight. I see you in prosperity; and I fear for you the chastisement of a besetting day.

Name: Hûd
Verse: O my people, give full measure and weight in justice, and do not defraud people in respect of their goods, and do not be degenerate in the land, working corruption.

Name: Hûd
Verse: The remainder [which is] from God is better for you if you are believers; and I am not a guardian over you'.

Name: Hûd
Verse: They said: ‘O Shu‘ayb, does your [way of] prayer command you that we should leave what our fathers [used to] worship, or to do as we will with our goods? You are indeed the forbearing, the right-guided’.

Name: Hûd
Verse: He said, 'O my people, have you considered that I might be [acting] upon a clear proof from my Lord and that He has provided me with fair sustenance from Him? And I do not desire to be inconsistent in what I forbid you. I desire only to set things right so far as I am able. My success is only with God. In Him I trust and to Him I turn [repentant].

Name: Hûd
Verse: And, O my people, let not the breach with me make you deserve that there befall you the like of what befell the people of Noah, or the people of Hūd, or the people of Sālih, and the people of Lot are not far away from you.

Name: Hûd
Verse: And ask forgiveness of your Lord, then repent to Him. Truly my Lord is Merciful, Affectionate'.

Name: Hûd
Verse: They said: ‘O Shu‘ayb, we do not understand much of what you say. Truly we see you are weak among us, and were it not for your clan, we would have stoned you; for you are not powerful for us’.

Name: Hûd
Verse: He said, 'O my people, is my clan more venerable in your sight than God? And do you put Him behind you, neglected? Truly my Lord encompasses what you do.

Name: Hûd
Verse: And, O my people, act according to your ability, lo! I [too] am acting. You will soon know upon whom will come the chastisement that will abase him, and who is a liar. And sit in watch: I too will be with you watching'.

Name: Hûd
Verse: And when Our command came, We delivered Shu‘ayb and those who believed with him by a mercy from Us; and the Cry seized those who were evildoers and they ended up lying lifeless prostrate in their habitations,

Name: Hûd
Verse: as if they had never dwelt there: ‘Lo! Away with Midian, just as Thamūd was done away with!’

Name: Hûd
Verse: And verily We sent Moses with Our signs and a clear warrant,

Name: Hûd
Verse: to Pharaoh and his council; but they followed Pharaoh's command, and Pharaoh's command was not right-guided.

Name: Hûd
Verse: He will go before his people on the Day of Resurrection, and he will lead them to the Fire - an evil place for those entering it!

Name: Hûd
Verse: And a curse was made to follow them in this [world], as well as on the Day of Resurrection - evil is the assistance offered!

Name: Hûd
Verse: That is [something] of the tidings of the towns, which We relate to you. Some of them are standing, and some have been cut down.

Name: Hûd
Verse: And We did not wrong them, but they wronged themselves. Their gods did not avail them in any way, those [gods] upon whom they called besides God, when the command of your Lord came; and they [their gods] did not increase them in anything but ruin.

Name: Hûd
Verse: Such is the seizing of your Lord when He seizes the towns while they are doing wrong. Truly His seizing is painful, severe.

Name: Hûd
Verse: There is indeed in that a sign for him who fears the chastisement of the Hereafter: that is a day to which mankind will be gathered, and that is a day witnessed.

Name: Hûd
Verse: And We do not defer it but to a term [already] reckoned.

Name: Hûd
Verse: The day it comes, no soul shall speak except by His permission. Some of them will be wretched, and [some] joyous.

Name: Hûd
Verse: As for those who are damned, they will be in the Fire; their lot therein will be wailing and sighing;

Name: Hûd
Verse: abiding therein for as long as the heavens and the earth endure, except what your Lord may will. Truly your Lord is Doer of what He desires.

Name: Hûd
Verse: And as for those who are fortunate they shall be in Paradise, abiding therein for as long as the heavens and the earth endure except what your Lord may will, an endless bounty.

Name: Hûd
Verse: So do not be in doubt concerning what these [folk] worship. They worship only as their fathers worshipped before, and We shall surely pay them their whole due, undiminished.

Name: Hûd
Verse: And We verily gave Moses the Scripture, but differences arose concerning it; and were it not for a word that went forth from your Lord, the case would have been decided between them; and truly they are in grave doubt concerning it.

Name: Hûd
Verse: And assuredly to each, verily your Lord will pay for his works in full. Truly He is Aware of what they do.

Name: Hûd
Verse: So remain upright as you have been commanded, and he who repents with you; and do not transgress. Truly He sees what you do.

Name: Hûd
Verse: And do not incline toward the evildoers, lest the Fire touch you, and you have, besides God, no protectors; and then you will not be helped.

Name: Hûd
Verse: And establish prayer at the two ends of the day, and in some watches of the night. Indeed good deeds annul misdeeds. That is a remembrance for the mindful.

Name: Hûd
Verse: And be patient, for indeed God does not waste the wage of those who are virtuous.

Name: Hûd
Verse: If only there had been among the generations before you men possessing a remnant [of good sense], forbidding corruption in the earth, except a few of those whom We delivered from among them. But those who did wrong followed that by which they were made profligate, and were sinners.

Name: Hûd
Verse: Yet your Lord would never destroy the towns through injustice, while their inhabitants were righteous.

Name: Hûd
Verse: Had your Lord willed, He would have made mankind one community, but they continue to differ,

Name: Hûd
Verse: except those on whom your Lord has mercy; and that is why He created them. And the Word of your Lord has been fulfilled: ’I will surely fill Hell with jinn and mankind together’.

Name: Hûd
Verse: And all that We relate to you of the accounts of the messengers, that with which We might strengthen your heart. And in these, there has come to you the Truth and an admonition and a reminder to the believers.

Name: Hûd
Verse: And say to those who do not believe: ’Act according to your ability, we are acting.

Name: Hûd
Verse: And wait, we are also waiting’.

Name: Hûd
Verse: And to God belongs the Unseen of the heavens and the earth, and to Him all matters are returned. So worship Him, and rely on Him, and your Lord is not heedless of what they do.

Name: Joseph
Verse: Alif lām rā’. Those are the verses of the Book that makes plain.

Name: Joseph
Verse: We have revealed it as an Arabic Qur’ān, so that you might understand.

Name: Joseph
Verse: We will relate to you the best of narratives in what We have revealed to you this Qur’ān, though prior to it you were of the heedless.

Name: Joseph
Verse: When Joseph said to his father: ‘O my father I saw eleven planets and the sun and the moon, I saw them prostrating themselves before me’.

Name: Joseph
Verse: He said, ‘O my son, do not relate your vision to your brothers, lest they plot against you some plot. Truly Satan is to man a manifest foe.

Name: Joseph
Verse: Thus, will your Lord prefer you, and teach you the interpretation of events, and perfect His grace upon you and upon the House of Jacob as He perfected it formerly on your fathers Abraham and Isaac. Truly your Lord is Knower, Wise’.

Name: Joseph
Verse: Verily in Joseph and his brethren are signs for those who inquire.

Name: Joseph
Verse: When they said: ‘Surely Joseph and his brother are dearer to our father than we are, though we be a [hardy] band. Lo! our father is in plain aberration.

Name: Joseph
Verse: Kill Joseph or cast him away into some land so that your father might be solely concerned with you, and that thereafter you might be a righteous folk’.

Name: Joseph
Verse: One of them said, ‘Do not kill Joseph, but cast him into the bottom of a well so that some caravan might pick him up, if you are to do anything’.

Name: Joseph
Verse: They said, ‘O father, what is wrong with you that you do not trust us with Joseph? We are indeed his well-wishers.

Name: Joseph
Verse: Send him forth with us tomorrow to frolic and play. Surely we shall take good care of him’.

Name: Joseph
Verse: He said, ‘Lo! It grieves me that you should go with him, and I fear lest the wolf devour him, while you are heedless of him’.

Name: Joseph
Verse: They said, ‘Truly if the wolf were to devour him, when we are [so hardy] a band then we indeed are losers!’

Name: Joseph
Verse: So when they went off with him, and agreed to put him into the bottom of the well. And We revealed to him: ‘Truly you shall inform them of this affair of theirs when they are unaware’.

Name: Joseph
Verse: And they came to their father in the evening, weeping.

Name: Joseph
Verse: They said, ‘O father, we went competing, and left Joseph by our things, and the wolf ate him. But you would never believe us, even though we speak the truth’.

Name: Joseph
Verse: And they came with false blood on his shirt. He said: ‘Nay, but your souls have beguiled you into something. Yet comely patience! And God is the One Whose succour is sought in that [predicament] which you describe’.

Name: Joseph
Verse: And there came a caravan, and they sent their water-drawer, and he let down his bucket. He said, ‘Good news!’ This is a young boy’, and they hid him, as [a piece of] merchandise. But God knew well what they were doing.

Name: Joseph
Verse: Then they sold him for a very low price, a handful of dirhams; for they set small store by him.

Name: Joseph
Verse: And he of Egypt who purchased him said to his wife, ‘Give him an honourable place. Maybe he will be useful to us, or we may adopt him as a son’. Thus, We established Joseph in the land that We might teach him the interpretation of events. God’s way [always] prevails, but most people do not know.

Name: Joseph
Verse: And when he reached his prime We gave him [power of] judgement and knowledge. Thus, We reward those who are virtuous.

Name: Joseph
Verse: And she, in whose house he was attempted to seduce him, and she closed the doors. And she said: ‘Come!’ ‘God forbid!’ he said. ‘Truly he is my lord, who has given me an honourable place. Truly, evildoers never prosper’.

Name: Joseph
Verse: And she certainly desired him, and he would have desired her [too], had it not been that he saw the proof of his Lord. So it was that We might ward off from him evil and lewdness. Truly he was of Our devoted servants.

Name: Joseph
Verse: And they raced to the door, and she tore his shirt from behind, whereupon they encountered her master at the door. She said, ‘What is to be the requital of him who intends evil against your folk, but that he should be imprisoned, or [suffer] a painful chastisement?’

Name: Joseph
Verse: He said: ‘It was she who attempted to seduce me’. And a witness of her own folk testified: ‘If his shirt has been torn from the front, then she speaks the truth, and he is of the liars;

Name: Joseph
Verse: but if his shirt has been torn from behind, then she has lied, and he is of the truthful’.

Name: Joseph
Verse: So when he saw that his shirt was torn from behind, he said: ‘Indeed this is of the guile of you women. Verily your guile is great.

Name: Joseph
Verse: O Joseph, ignore this; and you [O woman], ask forgiveness for your sin: surely you have been of the erring’.

Name: Joseph
Verse: And some of the women in the city said, ‘The Court Officer’s wife has been seducing her boy. Indeed he has smitten her heart with love. Lo! we see her to be in plain aberration’.

Name: Joseph
Verse: And when she heard of their machinations, she sent for them and prepared for them a repast. She then gave each one of them a knife and said: ‘Come out before them!’ And when they saw him, they were in awe of him and cut their hands, and they exclaimed: ‘God preserve us! This is no human being: this is but a noble angel!’

Name: Joseph
Verse: She said, ‘This is he on whose account you blamed me. Indeed I did attempt to seduce him, but he withheld himself. Yet if he does not do what I bid him, he verily shall be imprisoned, and verily shall be of those brought low’.

Name: Joseph
Verse: He said, ‘My Lord, prison is dearer to me than that to which they are urging me. And if You do not fend off their wiles from me, then I shall tend towards them and become of the ignorant.

Name: Joseph
Verse: So his Lord answered him, and He fended off their wiles from him. Truly He is the Hearer, the Knower.

Name: Joseph
Verse: Then it seemed [good] to them, after they had seen the signs that they should imprison him for a while.

Name: Joseph
Verse: And there entered the prison with him two youths. One of them said: ‘I dreamed that I was pressing wine’. The other said: ‘I dreamed that I was carrying on my head bread whereof the birds were eating. Tell us its interpretation, for indeed we see you as being among the virtuous’.

Name: Joseph
Verse: He said: ‘The food, with which you are provided, shall not come to you, but I shall tell you the interpretation thereof before it comes to you. This is from that which my Lord has taught me. Lo! I have forsaken the creed of a folk who do not believe in God and who moreover are disbelievers in the Hereafter.

Name: Joseph
Verse: And I follow the creed of my fathers, Abraham and Isaac and Jacob. It never was for us to associate anything with God. That is from God’s bounty to us and to mankind; but most people do not give thanks.

Name: Joseph
Verse: O my two fellow-prisoners!: Are several lords better, or God, the One, the Almighty?

Name: Joseph
Verse: You do not worship, apart from Him anything but [mere] names that you have named, you and your fathers. God has not revealed any warrant regarding them. Judgement belongs only to God. He has commanded that you worship none but Him. That is the upright religion, but most people do not know.

Name: Joseph
Verse: O fellow-prisoners! As for one of you, he shall serve his lord wine to drink; and as for the other, he will be crucified so that the birds will eat from his head: decided is the matter regarding which you sought opinion’.

Name: Joseph
Verse: Then he said to the one whom he deemed would be saved of the two: ‘Mention me to your lord’. But Satan caused him to forget the mention before his master, so that he stayed in prison for some years.

Name: Joseph
Verse: And the king said, ‘I saw in [a dream] seven fat kine being devoured by seven lean ones, and seven green ears of corn and others, dry. O courtiers! Give me [your] opinion about my vision if you can interpret visions’.

Name: Joseph
Verse: They said, ‘A jumble of dreams! And we are not knowledgeable in the interpretation of dreams’.

Name: Joseph
Verse: And he of the two who was released, remembering after a time, said, ‘I will inform you of its interpretation; so send me forth’.

Name: Joseph
Verse: ‘O Joseph, O truthful one, give us your opinion concerning seven fat kine that are devoured by seven lean ones, and [concerning] seven green ears of corn and [seven] others dry, that I may return to the people, so that they might know’.

Name: Joseph
Verse: He said, ‘You shall sow seven years consecutively but that which you reap, leave it in the ear, except for a little which you eat.

Name: Joseph
Verse: Then after that, there shall come seven hard years which shall devour what you set aside for them, all except a little which you have preserved.

Name: Joseph
Verse: Then after that there shall come a year in which the people will be granted relief, and in which they will press [fruit].

Name: Joseph
Verse: And the king said: ‘Bring him to me!’ And when the messenger came to him, he said, ‘Return to your lord and ask him: “What of the women who cut their hands?” Surely my lord has knowledge of their guile’.

Name: Joseph
Verse: He said, ‘What was your business, women, when you solicited Joseph?’ ‘God preserve us!’ they said. ‘We know of no evil in him’. The Court Officer’s wife said, ‘Now the truth is out; it was I who attempted to seduce him and he is indeed of the truthful’.

Name: Joseph
Verse: ‘That is so that he may know I did not betray him in his absence, and that truly God does not guide [to success] the guile of the treacherous.

Name: Joseph
Verse: Yet I do not exculpate my own soul; verily the soul is ever inciting to evil, except that whereon my Lord has mercy. Truly my Lord is Forgiving, Merciful’.

Name: Joseph
Verse: And the king said, ‘Bring him to me, that I may use him for myself’. And when he had spoken with him, he said: ‘Indeed you are on this day in our presence established and trustworthy’.

Name: Joseph
Verse: He said, ‘Place me in charge of the storehouses of the land. I am indeed a skilled custodian’.

Name: Joseph
Verse: Thus, We established Joseph in the land that he may settle in it wherever he wished. We confer Our mercy on whomever We will and We do not waste the wage of the virtuous.

Name: Joseph
Verse: Yet the wage of the Hereafter is better, for those who believe and are God-fearing.

Name: Joseph
Verse: And Joseph’s brothers came; and they entered to him, and he recognised them, but they did not recognise him.

Name: Joseph
Verse: And when he had equipped them with their provision, he said, ‘Bring me a brother of yours from your father. Do you not see that I give the full measure and that I am the best of hosts?

Name: Joseph
Verse: But if you do not bring him to me, there will be no measure for you with me; and do not come near [me]’.

Name: Joseph
Verse: They said, ‘We will try to tempt his father away from him. That we will surely do’.

Name: Joseph
Verse: And he said to his young men: ‘Place their merchandise in their saddlebags so that they may recognise it when they return to their folk, and so come back’.

Name: Joseph
Verse: So when they went back to their father, they said, ‘O father, the measure will be denied us; so send forth our brother with us, that we may obtain the measure. Surely we will guard him well’.

Name: Joseph
Verse: He said, ‘Should I trust you with him like I trusted you with his brother before? Yet God is best at guarding, and He is the Most Merciful of merciful ones’.

Name: Joseph
Verse: And when they opened their belongings, they found that their merchandise had been restored to them. They said, ‘O father, what [more] should we desire? Here is our merchandise restored to us. And we shall get provisions for our family, and guard our brother, and we shall receive an extra camel’s load; that will be an easy measure’.

Name: Joseph
Verse: He said, ‘I will not send him with you until you give me a [solemn] pledge in the name of God that assuredly you will bring him back to me, unless you are besieged’. And when they gave him their [solemn] pledge, he said, ‘God shall be Guardian over what we say’.

Name: Joseph
Verse: And he said, ‘O my sons, do not enter by one gate, but enter by separate gates. Yet I cannot avail you against God anything. Judgement belongs to God. On Him I rely, and on Him let all the trusting rely’.

Name: Joseph
Verse: And when they entered in the manner which their father had bidden them, it did not avail them anything against God; it was but a need in Jacob’s soul which he [thus] satisfied. And verily he was possessed of knowledge, because We had taught him; but most of mankind do not know.

Name: Joseph
Verse: And when they entered to Joseph, he took his brother into his arms, saying [to him]: ‘Truly it is me, your brother, therefore do not despair at what they did’.

Name: Joseph
Verse: And when he had equipped them with their provision, he put the drinking-cup into the saddlebag of his brother. Then a crier shouted: ‘O cameleers, you are surely thieves!’

Name: Joseph
Verse: They said, coming towards them, ‘What is it that you are missing?’

Name: Joseph
Verse: They said, ‘We are missing the king’s goblet. And he who brings it shall have a camel’s load, and I will guarantee that’.

Name: Joseph
Verse: They said, ‘By God, You know very well that we did not come to work corruption in the land, and we are certainly not thieves’.

Name: Joseph
Verse: They said, ‘So, what shall be his requital if you prove to have been liars?’

Name: Joseph
Verse: They said, ‘His requital shall be [the requital of] him in whose saddlebag it is found: He shall be the requital for it. Thus, do we requite those who do evil’.

Name: Joseph
Verse: And so he began with their sacks before his brother’s sack, then he pulled it out of his brother’s sack. Thus, did We contrive for Joseph; he could not have taken his brother according to the king’s law, unless God willed. We raise by degrees whom We will; and above every man of knowledge is one who knows better.

Name: Joseph
Verse: They said, ‘If he is stealing, a brother of his stole before’. But Joseph kept it secret in his soul and did not disclose it to them; he said: ‘You are a worse case. And God knows very well what you are describing’.

Name: Joseph
Verse: They said, ‘O Court officer, lo! he has a father, an aged man, so take one of us in his place: indeed we see that you are among the virtuous’.

Name: Joseph
Verse: He said, ‘God forbid that we should take anyone save him with whom we found our property; for then truly we would be evildoers’.

Name: Joseph
Verse: So when they despaired of [moving] him, they withdrew to confer privately [together]. The most senior of them said: ‘Are you not aware that your father has taken a solemn pledge from you by God, and formerly you failed regarding Joseph? So I will never leave this land until my father permits me, or God judges for me; and He is the best of judges.

Name: Joseph
Verse: Go back to your father and say: “O our father, your son has indeed stolen and we testified only regarding what we knew; we could not have guarded against the Unseen.

Name: Joseph
Verse: And ask the city in which we were and the caravan with which we approached. Surely we speak the truth” ’.

Name: Joseph
Verse: ‘Nay,’ he said, ‘but your souls have beguiled you into something. Yet comely patience! It may be that God will bring them all [back] to me. Indeed He is the Knower, the Wise’.

Name: Joseph
Verse: And he turned away from them and said, ‘Alas, my grief for Joseph!’ And his eyes turned white with grief, such that he was [filled] with suppressed agony.

Name: Joseph
Verse: They said, ‘By God, you will never cease remembering Joseph until you are consumed, or you are of those who perish’.

Name: Joseph
Verse: He said: ‘I complain of my anguish and grief only to God, and I know from God what you do not know.

Name: Joseph
Verse: O my sons, go and enquire about Joseph and his brother, and do not despair of God’s [gracious] Spirit. Indeed none despairs of the [gracious] Spirit of God save the disbelieving folk’.

Name: Joseph
Verse: And so when they entered to him, they said, ‘O Court officer, misfortune has befallen us and our family; and we have come with reject merchandise, so fill up for us the measure and be charitable to us; truly God requites the charitable’.

Name: Joseph
Verse: He said: ‘Do you realise what you did to Joseph and his brother, while you were ignorant?’

Name: Joseph
Verse: They said: ‘Is it really you, Joseph?’ He said, ‘I am [indeed] Joseph, and this is my brother. God has truly shown favour to us. Verily if one fears and endures, God does not waste the wage of those who are virtuous’.

Name: Joseph
Verse: They said, ‘By God, truly God has preferred you over us, and indeed we have been erring’.

Name: Joseph
Verse: He said, ‘There shall be no reproach on you this day. God will forgive you, and He is the Most Merciful of the merciful.

Name: Joseph
Verse: Go with this shirt of mine and lay it on my father’s face, and he will recover his sight; and bring me all your folk’.

Name: Joseph
Verse: And as the caravan set forth, their father said, ‘Truly I sense the scent of Joseph; if only you did not think me doting’.

Name: Joseph
Verse: They said: ‘By God, you are certainly in your misguidance of old’.

Name: Joseph
Verse: Then, when the bearer of good tidings came, he laid it on his face and he regained his sight. He said, ‘Did I not say to you, “Indeed I know from God what you do not know?” ’

Name: Joseph
Verse: They said, ‘O our father, ask forgiveness for us of our sins; truly we have been sinful’.

Name: Joseph
Verse: He said, ‘Assuredly I shall ask forgiveness for you of my Lord. Lo! He is the Forgiving, the Merciful’.

Name: Joseph
Verse: And when they entered to Joseph, he took his parents into his arms, and said: ‘Enter into Egypt, if God will, in safety’.

Name: Joseph
Verse: And he raised his parents upon the throne, and they fell down, prostrating before him. Then he said, ‘O father, this is the interpretation of my vision of old. Indeed my Lord has made it true. And indeed He has been gracious to me, since He brought me out of the prison and has brought you from the desert after Satan had incited ill feeling between me and my brethren. Truly my Lord is Subtle in [bringing about] what He will. Truly He is the Knower, the Wise.

Name: Joseph
Verse: My Lord, indeed You have given me [something] of sovereignty and You have taught me the interpretation of events. Originator of the heavens and the earth! You are my Protector in this world and the Hereafter. Take me [in death] to You in submission [to You] and join me to the righteous’.

Name: Joseph
Verse: That is of the tidings of the Unseen which We reveal to you; for you were not with them when they agreed upon their plan and schemed.

Name: Joseph
Verse: Yet, most people however eager you might be, will not believe.

Name: Joseph
Verse: Nor do you ask them any wage for it — it is but a reminder to all the worlds.

Name: Joseph
Verse: And how many a sign is there in the heavens and the earth which they pass by but disregard!

Name: Joseph
Verse: And most of them do not believe in God without ascribing partners [to Him].

Name: Joseph
Verse: Do they deem themselves secure from the coming upon them of a pall of God’s chastisement, or the coming of the Hour upon them suddenly, while they are unaware?

Name: Joseph
Verse: Say: ‘This is my way: I call to God, being upon sure knowledge, I and whoever follows me. So Glory be to God! and I am not of the idolaters’.

Name: Joseph
Verse: And We did not send before you [any messengers] save men inspired by revelation from among the people of the towns. Have they not travelled in the land and seen the nature of the consequence for those who were before them? And verily the abode of the Hereafter is better for those who are wary. Will they not understand?

Name: Joseph
Verse: Until when the messengers despaired and thought that they were denied, Our help came to them and whomever We willed We delivered. And Our wrath cannot be averted from the sinning folk.

Name: Joseph
Verse: Verily there is in their stories a lesson for people of pith. It is not a fabricated discourse but a confirmation of what was [revealed] before it, and a detailing of everything, and a guidance, and a mercy for a folk who believe.

Name: The Thunder
Verse: Alif lām mīm rā’. Those are the verses of the Book,) and that which has been revealed to you from your Lord is the Truth, but most people do not believe.

Name: The Thunder
Verse: God is He Who raised up the heavens without visible supports then presided upon the Throne and disposed the sun and the moon, each one moving, until [the conclusion of] an appointed time. He directs the command. He details the signs so that you might be certain of the encounter with your Lord.

Name: The Thunder
Verse: And He it is Who spread out the earth and set therein firm mountains and rivers, and of every fruit He has made in it two kinds. He covers the night with the day. Surely in that are signs for a people who reflect.

Name: The Thunder
Verse: And on the earth are tracts neighbouring each other, and gardens, of vines and sown fields, and date-palms sharing one root, and date-palms otherwise, watered by the same [source of] water; and We make some of them to excel others in flavour. Surely in that are signs for a people who understand.

Name: The Thunder
Verse: And if you wonder, then surely wondrous is their saying: ‘When we have become dust, shall we indeed then be [raised] in a new creation?’ Those are the ones who disbelieve in their Lord; those — fetters shall be around their necks; and those, they shall be the inhabitants of the Fire, abiding therein.

Name: The Thunder
Verse: And they would have you hasten on the evil, rather than the good, when there have indeed occurred before them exemplary punishments. Truly your Lord is forgiving to mankind despite their evil-doing; and truly your Lord is severe in retribution.

Name: The Thunder
Verse: And those who disbelieve say, ‘Why has not some sign been sent down upon him from his Lord!’ You are only a warner, and for every folk there is a guide.

Name: The Thunder
Verse: God knows what every female bears, and what the wombs reduce, and what they increase. And everything with Him is according to a [precise] measure;

Name: The Thunder
Verse: For him are attendants, to his front and to his rear, guarding him through God’s command. Indeed God does not alter the state of a people unless they have altered the state of their souls. And if God wills misfortune for a people there is none that can repel it; and they have no protector apart from Him.

Name: The Thunder
Verse: He it is Who shows you the lightning, [inspiring] fear and hope; and He produces the clouds that are heavy.

Name: The Thunder
Verse: And the thunder proclaims His praise, and so too the angels in awe of Him. He unleashes the thunderbolts and smites with them whom He will; yet they dispute about God, though He is great in might.

Name: The Thunder
Verse: His is the call of truth; and those upon whom they call, apart from Him, do not answer them anything; save as one who stretches forth his hands towards water, that it may reach his mouth, but it would never reach it; and the call of the disbelievers goes only astray.

Name: The Thunder
Verse: And to God prostrate whoever is in the heavens and the earth, willingly or unwillingly, and also their shadows in the mornings and the evenings.

Name: The Thunder
Verse: Say: ‘Who is the Lord of the heavens and the earth?’ Say: ‘God’. Say: ‘Then have you taken beside Him protectors, who have no power to benefit or harm themselves?’ Say: ‘Are the blind one and the seer equal? Or are darkness and the light equal? Or have they set up for God associates who have created the like of His creation, so that creation seems alike to them?’ Say: ‘God is the Creator of all things; and He is the One, the Subjugator’.

Name: The Thunder
Verse: He sends down water from the sky, whereat the valleys flow according to their measure, and the flood carries a scum that swells, and from that which they smelt in the fire, desiring ornaments or ware; [there rises] a scum the like of it. Thus, God points out truth and falsehood. As for the scum, it passes away as dross, while that which is of use to mankind, lingers in the earth. Thus, God strikes similitudes.

Name: The Thunder
Verse: For those who respond to their Lord, there shall be the goodly reward, and those who do not respond to Him, if they possessed all that is in the earth, and therewith the like of it, they would offer it to redeem themselves therewith. For such there shall be an awful reckoning and their abode shall be Hell, an evil resting place.

Name: The Thunder
Verse: Is he who knows that what is revealed to you from your Lord is the truth, like him who is blind? But only people of pith remember;

Name: The Thunder
Verse: such as fulfil God’s covenant, and do not break the pact;

Name: The Thunder
Verse: and such as cement what God has commanded should be cemented, and fear their Lord, and dread an awful reckoning;

Name: The Thunder
Verse: such as are patient, desiring their Lord’s countenance; and maintain the prayer and expend of that which We have provided them, secretly and openly, and repel evil with good; those, theirs shall be the sequel of the [heavenly] Abode:

Name: The Thunder
Verse: Gardens of Eden, which they shall enter along with those who were righteous from among their fathers and their spouses and their descendants; and the angels shall enter to them from every gate.

Name: The Thunder
Verse: ‘Peace be upon you for your patience’. How excellent is the sequel of the [heavenly] Abode!

Name: The Thunder
Verse: And those who break God’s covenant after pledging it, and sever what God has commanded should be cemented, and work corruption in the earth, theirs shall be the curse, and theirs shall be the awful abode.

Name: The Thunder
Verse: God expands provision for whom He will, and straitens for whomever He will; and they rejoice in the life of this world, yet the life of this world in the Hereafter, is but [a brief] enjoyment.

Name: The Thunder
Verse: And those who disbelieve say, ‘Why has not some sign been sent down upon him from his Lord?’ Say: ‘Indeed God sends astray whomever He will, and He guides to Him those who turn in repentance’;

Name: The Thunder
Verse: those who believe and whose hearts are reassured by God’s remembrance. Verily by God’s remembrance are hearts reassured;

Name: The Thunder
Verse: those who believe and perform righteous deeds: theirs shall be blessedness and a fair resort.

Name: The Thunder
Verse: Thus, We have sent you to a community before whom other communities have passed away, that you may recite to them that which We have revealed to you; yet they disbelieve in the Compassionate One. Say: ‘He is my Lord; there is no god save Him. In Him I trust and to Him is my recourse’.

Name: The Thunder
Verse: Even if it were a Qur’ān whereby the mountains were set in motion, or the earth were cleft, or the dead were spoken to. Nay, but the affair belongs entirely to God. Have they not realised, those who believe, that had God willed, He could have guided all mankind? And the disbelievers continue to be struck by devastation because of what they wrought; or you alight near their home until God’s promise comes to pass; truly God does not break His promise.

Name: The Thunder
Verse: Messengers were certainly mocked before you, but I gave respite to those who disbelieved; then I seized them, and how was My retribution?

Name: The Thunder
Verse: Is He Who stands over every soul what it has earned? Yet they ascribe to God associates. Say: ‘Name them! Or will you inform Him of something which He does not know in the earth? Or is it merely [a manner of] speaking?’ Nay, but their scheming has been adorned for those who disbelieve and they have been barred from the way; and whomever God sends astray, for him there is no guide.

Name: The Thunder
Verse: For them there is chastisement in the life of this world; and verily the chastisement of the Hereafter is more grievous; and they have no defender from God.

Name: The Thunder
Verse: The likeness of Paradise, which has been promised to the God-fearing: beneath it rivers flow, its food is everlasting, and its shade. That is the reward of those who were wary, and the requital of the disbelievers is the Fire!

Name: The Thunder
Verse: And those to whom We have given the Scripture, rejoice in that which has been revealed to you; and among the factions are those who reject some of it. Say: ‘I have been commanded only to worship God, and not to associate [anything] with Him. To Him I call and to Him shall be my return’.

Name: The Thunder
Verse: And so We have revealed it as a [decisive] judgement in Arabic. And if you should follow their whims after what has come to you of knowledge, you shall have no protector against God and no defender.

Name: The Thunder
Verse: And indeed We sent messengers before you, and We assigned to them wives and seed; and it was not for any Messenger that he should bring a sign, save by God’s leave. For every term there is a Book.

Name: The Thunder
Verse: God effaces whatever He will and He fixes [whatever he will of the Book], and with Him is the Mother of the Book.

Name: The Thunder
Verse: And whether We show you a part of that which We promise them, or We take you [to Us], it is for you only to convey [the Message], and it is for Us to do the reckoning.

Name: The Thunder
Verse: Or is it that they have not seen how We visit the land, diminishing it at its outlying regions? And God judges; there is none that can repel His judgement and He is swift at reckoning.

Name: The Thunder
Verse: And indeed those that were before them plotted, but to God belongs all plotting. He knows what every soul earns. The disbeliever shall assuredly know for whom shall be the sequel of the [heavenly] Abode.

Name: The Thunder
Verse: And those who disbelieve say: ‘You have not been sent [by God]!’ Say: ‘God suffices as a witness between me and you, and he who possesses knowledge of the Book’.

Name: Abraham
Verse: Alif lām rā’. A Book We have revealed to you that you may bring forth mankind from darkness into light by the leave of their Lord to the path of the Mighty, the Praised.

Name: Abraham
Verse: God to Whom belongs all that is in the heavens and all that is in the earth. And woe to the disbelievers from a terrible chastisement,

Name: Abraham
Verse: those who prefer the life of this world over the Hereafter, and bar [men] from God’s way, and seek to make it crooked — those, they are far astray.

Name: Abraham
Verse: And We have not sent any Messenger except with the tongue of his people, that he might make [the Message] clear to them; God then sends astray whomever He will and He guides whomever He will; and He is the Mighty, the Wise.

Name: Abraham
Verse: And verily We sent Moses with Our signs. ‘Bring forth your people out of darkness into light, and remind them of the Days of God’. Surely in that are signs for every man enduring, thankful.

Name: Abraham
Verse: And when Moses said to his people, ‘Remember God’s grace to you when He delivered you from the folk of Pharaoh, who were inflicting upon you a dreadful chastisement, and were slaughtering your sons, and sparing your women; and in that was a tremendous trial from your Lord.

Name: Abraham
Verse: And when your Lord proclaimed: “If you are thankful, then assuredly I shall give you more; but if you are thankless, My chastisement is indeed severe” ’.

Name: Abraham
Verse: And Moses said: ‘If you are thankless, you and all who are on earth, lo! assuredly God is Independent, Praised’.

Name: Abraham
Verse: Has there not come to you the tidings, of those who were before you — the people of Noah, and ‘ād and Thamūd, and those after them? None knows them save God. Their messengers brought them clear signs; but they thrust their hands into their mouths and said, ‘Lo! we disbelieve in that wherewith you have been sent, and lo! we are in grave doubt concerning that to which you call us’.

Name: Abraham
Verse: Their messengers said, ‘Can there be doubt concerning God, the Originator of the heavens and the earth? He calls you so that He might forgive you your sins and defer you to an appointed term’. They said, ‘You are but mortals like us, desiring to bar us from that which our fathers used to worship. So bring us a clear warrant’.

Name: Abraham
Verse: Their messengers said to them, ‘We are but mortals like you; but God is gracious to whomever He will of His servants. And it is not ours to bring you any warrant save by the leave of God; and in God let believers put their trust.

Name: Abraham
Verse: And why should we not put our trust in God when He has guided us our ways? And we shall surely endure the hurt you do us. And in God let the trusting put their trust’.

Name: Abraham
Verse: And those who disbelieved said to their messengers, ‘We will assuredly expel you from our land, or you will surely return to our creed’. Then their Lord inspired them [saying]: ‘We shall surely destroy the evildoers,

Name: Abraham
Verse: and We shall surely make you dwell in the land after them that for whoever fears the standing before Me and fears My threat’.

Name: Abraham
Verse: And they sought victory; and every tyrant, rebellious, was brought to nothing;

Name: Abraham
Verse: beyond him is Hell, and he is given to drink of festering fluid

Name: Abraham
Verse: which he sips, but can scarcely swallow; and death comes to him from every side, yet he cannot die; and still beyond him there is a harsh chastisement.

Name: Abraham
Verse: The likeness of those who disbelieve in their Lord: their works are as ashes over which the wind blows hard on a tempestuous day; they have no power over anything that they have earned. That is extreme error.

Name: Abraham
Verse: Have you not seen that God created the heavens and the earth in truth? If He will, He can take you away and bring [about] a new creation.

Name: Abraham
Verse: And that for God is surely no great matter.

Name: Abraham
Verse: And they sally forth to God all together; then the weak say to those who were arrogant: ‘Indeed we were your followers. Will you then avail us against the chastisement of God in any way?’ They say, ‘If God had guided us, we would have guided you. It is the same for us whether we rage [impatiently] or patiently endure; we do not have any asylum’.

Name: Abraham
Verse: And Satan says, when the issue has been decided, ‘Truly God promised you a promise of truth, whereas I promised you, then failed you, for over you I had no warrant, except that I called you and you responded to me. So do not blame me, but blame yourselves. I cannot heed your [distress] call, nor can you heed mine. Lo! I disbelieved in your making me an associate of God formerly’. Truly for the evildoers there shall be a painful chastisement.

Name: Abraham
Verse: And those who believed and performed righteous deeds, they are admitted to gardens underneath which rivers flow, abiding therein by the leave of their Lord, their greeting therein: ‘Peace!’

Name: Abraham
Verse: Have you not seen how God has struck a similitude?: a goodly saying is as a goodly tree, its root set firm and its shoots are in heaven;

Name: Abraham
Verse: it gives its produce every season by the leave of its Lord. And God strikes similitudes for mankind, so that they might remember.

Name: Abraham
Verse: And the similitude of a bad saying is as a bad tree, uprooted from upon the earth, having no stability.

Name: Abraham
Verse: God confirms those who believe by a firm saying in the life of this world and in the Hereafter; and God sends astray the evildoers; and God does what He will.

Name: Abraham
Verse: Have you not seen those who exchanged God’s grace for unthankfulness and who caused their people to take up residence in the Abode of Ruin?

Name: Abraham
Verse: Hell to which they shall be exposed — an evil place to settle!

Name: Abraham
Verse: And they have set up rivals to God, that they might lead [others] astray from His way. Say: ‘Enjoy! For lo! your journey’s end shall be to the Fire!’

Name: Abraham
Verse: Tell My servants who believe that they establish prayers and expend of that which We have provided them, secretly and openly, before a day comes wherein there will be neither bargaining, nor befriending.

Name: Abraham
Verse: God it is Who created the heavens and the earth, and He sends down water from the heaven and with it He brings forth fruits as sustenance for you. And He has disposed for you the ships, that they may run upon the sea at His commandment, and He has disposed for you the rivers.

Name: Abraham
Verse: And He has disposed for you the sun and the moon, constant; and He has disposed for you the night and the day.

Name: Abraham
Verse: And He gives you of all that you ask of Him. And if you were to enumerate God’s grace, you could never number it. Lo! man is verily a wrong-doer and unthankful!

Name: Abraham
Verse: And when Abraham said, ‘My Lord, make this land secure and turn me and my sons away from serving idols.

Name: Abraham
Verse: My Lord, truly they have led many of mankind astray. So whoever follows me, verily belongs with me, and whoever disobeys me, truly You are Forgiving, Merciful.

Name: Abraham
Verse: Our Lord, indeed I have made some of my seed to dwell in a valley where there is no sown land, by Your Sacred House; our Lord, that they may establish prayer. So make some of the hearts of men yearn towards them. And provide them with fruits, that they might be thankful.

Name: Abraham
Verse: Our Lord, You know what we hide and what we proclaim. And nothing is hidden from God in the earth or in the heaven.

Name: Abraham
Verse: Praise be to God Who has given me, despite [my] old age, Ishmael and Isaac. Lo! my Lord is indeed the Hearer of supplication.

Name: Abraham
Verse: My Lord, make me an establisher of prayer, and [also] of my seed Our Lord! And accept my supplication.

Name: Abraham
Verse: Our Lord, forgive me and my parents and [forgive] believers on the day when the reckoning shall come to pass’.

Name: Abraham
Verse: And do not suppose that God is heedless of what the evildoers do. He but gives them respite until a day when eyes shall stare wide-open;

Name: Abraham
Verse: as they come hastening with their heads turned upwards, their gaze returning not to them, and their hearts as air.

Name: Abraham
Verse: And warn mankind of the day when chastisement will come upon them, and those who did evil will say: ‘Our Lord, give us respite for a brief while, that we might respond to Your call and follow the messengers’. But did you not use to swear formerly that for you there would be no passing [away]?

Name: Abraham
Verse: And you dwelt in the dwelling-places of those who wronged themselves, and it became clear to you how We dealt with them and We struck similitudes for you.

Name: Abraham
Verse: And verily they plotted their plot but their plotting is with God, and their plotting was not such whereby mountains should be moved.

Name: Abraham
Verse: So do not suppose that God will fail [to keep] His promise to His messengers. Truly God is Mighty, Lord of Retribution.

Name: Abraham
Verse: The day when the earth will be changed to other than the earth and the heavens, and they (people) shall come forth to God, the One, the Almighty.

Name: Abraham
Verse: And you shall see the sinners on that day coupled in chains,

Name: Abraham
Verse: their shirts [made] of pitch and their faces are engulfed by the Fire,

Name: Abraham
Verse: that God may requite every soul for what it has earned. Truly God is swift at reckoning.

Name: Abraham
Verse: This is a Proclamation for mankind, and so that they may be warned thereby, and that they may know that He is One God, and that people of pith may remember.

Name: Al-Hijr
Verse: Alif lām rāʾ. Those are the verses of the Book and of a manifest Qurʾān.

Name: Al-Hijr
Verse: It may be that those who disbelieve will wish that they had been muslims.

Name: Al-Hijr
Verse: Leave them to eat and to enjoy, and that they be diverted by hope, for they will come to know.

Name: Al-Hijr
Verse: And We did not destroy any town, but that it had a known decree.

Name: Al-Hijr
Verse: No community can outstrip its [predetermined] term nor can they [seek to] delay it.

Name: Al-Hijr
Verse: And they say: ‘O you, to whom the Remembrance has been revealed, lo! you are indeed possessed!

Name: Al-Hijr
Verse: Why do you not bring us the angels, if you are of the truthful?’

Name: Al-Hijr
Verse: The angels do not descend save with the truth; and then, they [the disbelievers] would not be reprieved.

Name: Al-Hijr
Verse: Verily it is We Who have revealed the Remembrance, and assuredly We will preserve it.

Name: Al-Hijr
Verse: And verily We sent before you [messengers] to former factions.

Name: Al-Hijr
Verse: And never did a messenger come to them but that they mocked him.

Name: Al-Hijr
Verse: Thus We cause it to find its way into the hearts of the sinners.

Name: Al-Hijr
Verse: They do not believe in him, even though the example of the men of old has already gone before.

Name: Al-Hijr
Verse: And even if We were to open for them a gate from the heaven, and they were to continue ascending through it,

Name: Al-Hijr
Verse: they would say, ‘It is merely that our eyes have been dazzled. Nay, we are a folk bewitched!’

Name: Al-Hijr
Verse: And verily We have placed in the heaven constellations, and We have adorned it for beholders;

Name: Al-Hijr
Verse: and We have guarded them from every outcast devil;

Name: Al-Hijr
Verse: except the one who listens by stealth — he is pursued by a clear flame.

Name: Al-Hijr
Verse: And the earth We have stretched it out, and cast therein firm mountains, and caused to grow therein every kind of balanced thing.

Name: Al-Hijr
Verse: And We have made for you therein [means of] livelihood, and those for whom you do not provide.

Name: Al-Hijr
Verse: And there is not a thing but that the stores thereof are with Us, and We do not send it down except in a known measure.

Name: Al-Hijr
Verse: And We send the winds as fertilisers, and send down out of the heaven water so that We give it to you to drink, for you are not the storers thereof.

Name: Al-Hijr
Verse: Indeed it is We Who give life and bring death, and We are the heirs.

Name: Al-Hijr
Verse: And verily We know the predecessors among you, and verily We know the successors.

Name: Al-Hijr
Verse: And it is indeed your Lord Who will gather them, lo! He is the Wise, the Knower.

Name: Al-Hijr
Verse: And verily We created man out of a dry [clinking] clay of malleable mud.

Name: Al-Hijr
Verse: And the jānn We created beforehand out of the permeative fire.

Name: Al-Hijr
Verse: And when your Lord said to the angels, ‘Indeed I am going to create a mortal out of a dry clay [drawn] from a malleable mud.

Name: Al-Hijr
Verse: So, when I have proportioned him and breathed of My Spirit in him, fall down in prostration before him!’

Name: Al-Hijr
Verse: And so the angels prostrated, all of them together,

Name: Al-Hijr
Verse: except Iblīs, he refused to be among those prostrating.

Name: Al-Hijr
Verse: He [said]: ‘O Iblīs what is wrong with you that you are not among those prostrating?’

Name: Al-Hijr
Verse: Said he, ‘I was not about to prostrate myself before a mortal whom You have created out of a dry clay [drawn] from malleable mud’.

Name: Al-Hijr
Verse: Said He, ‘Then be gone from hence; for you are indeed accursed.

Name: Al-Hijr
Verse: And indeed the curse shall rest upon you until the Day of Judgement’.

Name: Al-Hijr
Verse: Said he, ‘My Lord! Reprieve me until the day when they shall be resurrected’.

Name: Al-Hijr
Verse: Said He, ‘Then lo! you are of those reprieved,

Name: Al-Hijr
Verse: until the day of the known time’.

Name: Al-Hijr
Verse: Said he, ‘My Lord, because You have lead me astray, I shall adorn for them [evil acts] in the earth and I shall lead them astray, all of them;

Name: Al-Hijr
Verse: except those servants of Yours who are sincerely devoted [to You]’.

Name: Al-Hijr
Verse: He said, ‘This is a straight path [leading] to Me.

Name: Al-Hijr
Verse: Truly over My servants you shall have no warrant, except those who follow you from among the perverse.

Name: Al-Hijr
Verse: And truly Hell shall be their tryst, all of them.

Name: Al-Hijr
Verse: It has seven gates — to each gate belongs an appointed portion of them.

Name: Al-Hijr
Verse: Truly the God-fearing shall be amidst gardens and springs’.

Name: Al-Hijr
Verse: ‘Enter them in peace, secure!’

Name: Al-Hijr
Verse: And We remove whatever rancour may be in their breasts. As brethren, [they shall recline] upon couches, facing one another.

Name: Al-Hijr
Verse: No toil will touch them, nor will they be expelled from thence.

Name: Al-Hijr
Verse: Tell My servants that verily I am the Forgiving, the Merciful,

Name: Al-Hijr
Verse: and that My chastisement is the painful chastisement.

Name: Al-Hijr
Verse: And tell them of the guests of Abraham,

Name: Al-Hijr
Verse: They said, ‘Do not be afraid; lo!, we give you good tidings of a knowledgeable boy’.

Name: Al-Hijr
Verse: He said, ‘Do you give me good tidings when old age has befallen me?’ So, of what do you give me good tidings?’

Name: Al-Hijr
Verse: They said, ‘We give you good tidings in truth; so do not be of the despairing’.

Name: Al-Hijr
Verse: He said, ‘And who despairs of the mercy of his Lord, save those who are astray?’

Name: Al-Hijr
Verse: He said, ‘So what is your business, O you who have been sent [by God]?’

Name: Al-Hijr
Verse: They said, ‘We have been sent to a sinning folk,

Name: Al-Hijr
Verse: except his wife — We have decreed that she indeed should be of those who will remain behind’.

Name: Al-Hijr
Verse: And when those who had been sent [by God] came to the family of Lot,

Name: Al-Hijr
Verse: he said, ‘Indeed you are strangers’.

Name: Al-Hijr
Verse: They said, ‘Rather, we have come to you because of that which they used to doubt.

Name: Al-Hijr
Verse: And we have brought you the Truth and indeed we speak truthfully.

Name: Al-Hijr
Verse: So travel with your family in a portion of the night and follow their rear; and let none of you turn round, and go whither you are commanded’.

Name: Al-Hijr
Verse: And We conveyed to him the matter that these [sinners] was to be eradicated by morning.

Name: Al-Hijr
Verse: And then came the people of the city, rejoicing.

Name: Al-Hijr
Verse: He said, ‘Lo! these are my guests, so do not disgrace me;

Name: Al-Hijr
Verse: and fear God, and do not humiliate me’.

Name: Al-Hijr
Verse: They said, ‘Have we not forbidden you from [entertaining] anyone?’

Name: Al-Hijr
Verse: He said, ‘These here are my daughters, if you must be doing [so]’.

Name: Al-Hijr
Verse: By your life in their drunkenness they were bewildered.

Name: Al-Hijr
Verse: Then the Cry seized them at sunrise.

Name: Al-Hijr
Verse: And We made their topmost part their nethermost, and We rained on them stones of baked clay.

Name: Al-Hijr
Verse: Indeed in that there are signs for those who take note.

Name: Al-Hijr
Verse: And indeed they are on a road that [still] remains.

Name: Al-Hijr
Verse: There is indeed a sign in that for believers.

Name: Al-Hijr
Verse: And certainly the dwellers in the wood were evildoers.

Name: Al-Hijr
Verse: So We exacted retribution from them. And certainly both of them are upon a open road.

Name: Al-Hijr
Verse: And verily the dwellers in al-Hijr denied those who had been sent [by God].

Name: Al-Hijr
Verse: And We brought them Our signs, but they were averse [to them].

Name: Al-Hijr
Verse: And they used to hew out dwellings from the mountains, feeling secure.

Name: Al-Hijr
Verse: But the Cry seized them in the morning.

Name: Al-Hijr
Verse: And so that which they used to count as gain did not avail them.

Name: Al-Hijr
Verse: We did not create the heavens and the earth and all that is between them save with the Truth. And truly the Hour shall come. So be forgiving with gracious forgiveness.

Name: Al-Hijr
Verse: Truly your Lord, He is the Creator, the Knowing.

Name: Al-Hijr
Verse: And verily We have given you seven of the oft-repeated [verses] and the great Qur’ān.

Name: Al-Hijr
Verse: Do not extend your glance toward that which We have given different groups of them to enjoy, and do not grieve for them, and lower your wing for the believers.

Name: Al-Hijr
Verse: And say: ‘Indeed, I am the warner, the clear [warner].

Name: Al-Hijr
Verse: Even as We sent down on those who make division,

Name: Al-Hijr
Verse: those who have reduced the Recitation, to parts.

Name: Al-Hijr
Verse: By your Lord, We shall question them all

Name: Al-Hijr
Verse: about what they used to do.

Name: Al-Hijr
Verse: So proclaim what you have been commanded, and turn away from the idolaters.

Name: Al-Hijr
Verse: Indeed We have sufficed you against the mockers,

Name: Al-Hijr
Verse: those [mockers] who set up besides God another god: soon they will know.

Name: Al-Hijr
Verse: And verily We know that your breast is [at times] oppressed by what they say.

Name: Al-Hijr
Verse: So glorify the praise of your Lord, and be of those who prostrate themselves,

Name: Al-Hijr
Verse: and worship your Lord until Certainty comes to you.

Name: The Bee
Verse: God’s commandment has come, so do not seek to hasten it. Glory be to Him and exalted be He above what they associate.

Name: The Bee
Verse: He sends down the angels with the Spirit of His command to whomever He will of His servants, [saying]: Warn that there is no God save Me: so fear Me.

Name: The Bee
Verse: He created the heavens and the earth with the Truth. Exalted be He above what they associate.

Name: The Bee
Verse: He created man from a drop of fluid, yet behold! he is disputatious, openly.

Name: The Bee
Verse: And the cattle, He created them for you. In them there is warmth, as well as [other] uses, and of them you eat;

Name: The Bee
Verse: and for you there is in them beauty, when you bring them [home] to rest, and when you drive them forth to pasture.

Name: The Bee
Verse: And they bear your burdens to a land which you could not reach, save with great trouble to yourselves. Indeed your Lord is Gentle, Merciful.

Name: The Bee
Verse: And [He created] horses and mules and asses, that you may ride them, and for adornment; and He creates what you do not know.

Name: The Bee
Verse: And God’s is the direction of the way, and some of them are deviant. And had He willed, He would have guided you all.

Name: The Bee
Verse: He it is Who sends down water from the heaven, whence you have drink, and whence are trees, whereat you let your animals graze.

Name: The Bee
Verse: With it He makes the crops grow for you, and olives and date-palms and vines and all kinds of fruit. Surely in that there is a sign for people who reflect.

Name: The Bee
Verse: And He disposed for you the night and the day and the sun and the moon and the stars are disposed by His command. Surely in that there are signs for people who understand.

Name: The Bee
Verse: And whatever He has created for you in the earth, diverse in hue. Surely in that there is a sign for people who remember.

Name: The Bee
Verse: And He it is Who disposed the sea, that you may eat from it fresh meat, and bring forth from it ornaments which you wear. And you see the ships ploughing therein; and that you may seek of His bounty, and that you might be thankful.

Name: The Bee
Verse: And He cast into the earth firm mountains, lest it should shake with you, and rivers and ways so that you might be guided

Name: The Bee
Verse: — and landmarks [as well], and by the star, they are guided.

Name: The Bee
Verse: Is He then Who creates as he who does not create. Will you not then remember?

Name: The Bee
Verse: And if you were to count God’s grace you could never reckon it. Indeed God is Forgiving, Merciful.

Name: The Bee
Verse: And God knows what you keep secret and what you disclose.

Name: The Bee
Verse: And those whom you invoke besides God do not create anything, but are themselves created.

Name: The Bee
Verse: They are dead, not living, and they are not aware when they shall be raised.

Name: The Bee
Verse: Your God is One God. But as for those who do not believe in the Hereafter their hearts are in denial, and they are arrogant.

Name: The Bee
Verse: Without doubt God knows what they keep secret and what they disclose. Indeed He does not love the arrogant.

Name: The Bee
Verse: And when it is said to them, ‘What is it that your Lord has revealed?’, they say, ‘fables of the ancients’.

Name: The Bee
Verse: That they may bear their burdens complete on the Day of Resurrection and also of the burdens of those whom they lead astray without any knowledge. How evil is the burden they bear.

Name: The Bee
Verse: Those before them had indeed plotted; then God came at their edifice from the foundations; and so the roof collapsed upon them from above them, and the chastisement came upon them whence they were not aware.

Name: The Bee
Verse: Then on the Day of Resurrection He will disgrace them and He will say: ‘Where are those associates of Mine concerning whom you used to make breaches?’ Those who were given knowledge will say, ‘Truly disgrace on this day, as well as misfortune, are for the disbelievers —

Name: The Bee
Verse: those whom the angels take [in death] while they are wronging themselves’. Then they will offer submission: ‘We were not doing any evil’. ‘Nay! Surely God is Knower of what you used to do’.

Name: The Bee
Verse: So enter the gates of Hell, to abide therein! Evil indeed is the lodging of the arrogant.

Name: The Bee
Verse: And it is said to those who fear [evil], ‘What has your Lord revealed?’ They will say, ‘Good! For those who were virtuous in this world, there will be a virtuous [reward]; and truly the abode of the Hereafter is better: And truly excellent is the abode of the God-fearing.

Name: The Bee
Verse: Gardens of Eden which they will enter, [Gardens] underneath which rivers flow, wherein they shall have whatever they wish. So God rewards the God-fearing,

Name: The Bee
Verse: those whom the angels take away [in death] while they are goodly, saying: ‘Peace be on you!; Enter Paradise because of what you used to do’.

Name: The Bee
Verse: Do they await anything but that the angels should come to them or that there should come your Lord’s command? So did those before them. And God did not wrong them, but they used to wrong themselves.

Name: The Bee
Verse: So that the evils of what they did smote them, and there besieged them that which they used to mock.

Name: The Bee
Verse: And the idolaters say, ‘Had God willed we would not have worshipped anything besides Him — neither we, nor our fathers — nor would we have deemed anything sacred besides Him’. So did those before them. Yet are messengers charged with anything save plain conveyance [of the Message]?

Name: The Bee
Verse: And verily We sent forth among every community a messenger [to say]: ‘Worship God and shun false deities’. Then among them were some whom God guided, and among them were some who deserved to be in error. So travel in the land and observe the nature of the consequence of those who denied.

Name: The Bee
Verse: If you are eager for them to be guided, for God does not guide he whom He has [already] sent astray, and they will have no helpers.

Name: The Bee
Verse: And they swear by God their most earnest oaths that God will not resurrect the dead. Nay, it is a promise binding upon Him, but most people, do not know.

Name: The Bee
Verse: That He may make clear to them what they differ in, and that the disbelievers may know that they were liars.

Name: The Bee
Verse: All that We say to a thing, when We will it, is to say to it ‘Be’, and it is.

Name: The Bee
Verse: And those who emigrated for God’s cause after they had been wronged, truly We shall lodge them in this world in a goodly lodging, and the reward of the Hereafter is surely greater, did they but know.

Name: The Bee
Verse: Those who endure and put their trust in their Lord.

Name: The Bee
Verse: And We did not send before you anything other than men, to whom We revealed: ‘So ask the followers of the Remembrance if you do not know’.

Name: The Bee
Verse: Do they feel secure, those who have schemed evil that God will not cause the earth to swallow them, or that the chastisement will not come upon them whence they are not aware of?

Name: The Bee
Verse: Or that He will not seize them in their going to and fro, whereupon they will not be able to escape?

Name: The Bee
Verse: Or that He will not seize them amid [growing] fear? Indeed then your Lord is Gentle, Merciful.

Name: The Bee
Verse: Or have they not observed the things which God has created, how their shadows incline to the right and to the left, prostrating to God, and [how] they are subject?

Name: The Bee
Verse: And to God prostrates whatever is in the heavens and whatever is on the earth of living creatures and the angels [also prostrate], and they are not arrogant.

Name: The Bee
Verse: They fear their Lord from above them, and they do what they are commanded.

Name: The Bee
Verse: And God has said: ‘Do not choose two gods. Truly there is only One God. So be in awe of Me [alone]’.

Name: The Bee
Verse: And to Him belongs whatever is in the heavens and the earth. And to Him belongs the religion that endures. Will you then fear any other than God?

Name: The Bee
Verse: Whatever grace you have, it is from God. Then when misfortune befalls you, to Him you cry for help.

Name: The Bee
Verse: Then when He has rid you of the misfortune, behold, a group of you attribute partners to their Lord,
