Name: The Bee
Verse: in order to deny that which We have given them. So enjoy, for soon you shall know.

Name: The Bee
Verse: And they assign, to what they do not know, a portion of that which We have provided them with. By God, you will indeed be questioned about what you used to fabricate.

Name: The Bee
Verse: And they assign to God daughters — Be He glorified! — while they will have what they desire.

Name: The Bee
Verse: And when one of them is given the tidings of a girl, his face becomes darkened, and he chokes inwardly.

Name: The Bee
Verse: He hides from people out of distress at the tidings given to him: shall he retain it in humiliation. Verily wretched is what they judge.

Name: The Bee
Verse: For those who do not believe in the Hereafter, there is an evil description, and the loftiest description belongs to God. And He is the Mighty, the Wise.

Name: The Bee
Verse: And if God were to take mankind to task for their wrongdoing, He would not leave upon it any living being; but He gives them respite until an appointed term; and when their term comes they will not defer by a single hour nor advance.

Name: The Bee
Verse: Still, they assign to God what they dislike. And their tongues relate the lie that theirs will be the best reward. Without any doubt theirs shall be the Fire and they shall be abandoned therein.

Name: The Bee
Verse: By God, We verily sent to communities before you [messengers]. But Satan adorned for them their deeds. So he is their patron today, and for them there will be a painful chastisement.

Name: The Bee
Verse: And We have not revealed to you the Book, except [for the purpose] that you may make clear to them that wherein they differ, and as a guidance and as a mercy for a people who believe.

Name: The Bee
Verse: And God sends down water from the heaven and therewith revives the earth after its death. Surely in that there is a sign for a people who listen.

Name: The Bee
Verse: And truly for you there is in the cattle a lesson. We give you to drink of that which is in their bellies, from between the refuse and the blood, pure milk palatable to drinkers.

Name: The Bee
Verse: And of the fruits of date-palms and vines from which you draw an intoxicant and goodly provision. Surely in that there is a sign for a people who understand.

Name: The Bee
Verse: And your Lord revealed to the bee, [saying]: ‘Choose among the hills habitations and among the trees, and among the trellises which they raise.

Name: The Bee
Verse: Then eat from every [kind of] fruit, and follow the ways of your Lord, [ways] made easily accessible’. There comes forth from their bellies a drink of diverse hues, wherein is a cure for mankind. Surely in that there is a sign for a people who reflect.

Name: The Bee
Verse: And God has created you, then He takes you [in death]; and there are some among you who are relegated to the most abject stage of life, so that he knows nothing after [having possessed] some knowledge. God is Knowing, Powerful.

Name: The Bee
Verse: And God has favoured some of you above others in [respect of] provision. Now those who have been [more] favoured, would not hand over their provision to those [slaves] whom their right hands possess, so that they become equal in respect thereof. Is it then the grace of God that they deny?

Name: The Bee
Verse: And God made for you mates from your own selves, and made for you, from your mates, children and grandchildren, and He provided you with the good things. Is it then in falsehood that they believe and in the grace of God that they disbelieve?

Name: The Bee
Verse: And they worship besides God what has no power to give them any [sort of] provision from the heavens and the earth, nor do they have the capacity.

Name: The Bee
Verse: So do not strike any similitude for God. Truly God knows, and you do not know.

Name: The Bee
Verse: God strikes a similitude [of] a slave who is a chattel, having no power over anything, and one on whom We have bestowed a fair provision from Us, such that he spends thereof secretly and openly. Are they equal? Praise belongs to God. But most of them do not know.

Name: The Bee
Verse: And God strikes a similitude [of] two men, one of whom is dumb [from birth], having no power over anything, and who is a liability to his master: wherever he directs him, he does not bring any good. Is he equal to one who enjoins justice and follows a path that is straight?

Name: The Bee
Verse: And to God belongs the Unseen of the heavens and the earth. And the matter of the Hour is but as the twinkling of an eye, or it is [even] nearer. Truly God has power over all things.

Name: The Bee
Verse: And God brought you forth from the bellies of your mothers while you did not know anything, and He gave you hearing and sight and hearts that perhaps you might give thanks.

Name: The Bee
Verse: Have they not observed the birds [how they are] made subservient in the air of heaven? Nothing holds them except God. Indeed in that there are signs for a people who believe.

Name: The Bee
Verse: And it is God Who has made for you your homes as a place of rest, and He has made for you out of the skins of the cattle homes, which you find light on the day of your migration and on the day of your halting; and of their wool, and their fur, and their hair, [He has made for you] furniture and wares for a while.

Name: The Bee
Verse: And it is God Who has made for you, from what He created, shade; and He has made for you, in the mountains, places of refuge; and He has made for you garments that protect you from the heat, and garments that protect you from your [mutual] violence. So He perfects His favour to you so that you might submit.

Name: The Bee
Verse: But if they turn away, your duty is only to convey [the Message] plainly.

Name: The Bee
Verse: They recognise God’s grace, and then deny it, and most of them are ungrateful.

Name: The Bee
Verse: And the day We shall raise up from every community a witness; then the disbelievers will not be given permission, nor will they be asked to make amends.

Name: The Bee
Verse: And when those who did wrong behold the chastisement, it shall not be lightened for them, nor will they be granted any respite.

Name: The Bee
Verse: And when the idolaters behold their associates, they will say, ‘Our Lord, these are our associates whom we used to invoke besides You’. But they will fling to them the saying: ‘You are indeed liars!’.

Name: The Bee
Verse: And they will offer submission to God on that day, and that which they used to invent will fail them.

Name: The Bee
Verse: Those who disbelieve and bar [men] from the way of God, them, We shall add chastisement to [their] chastisement because of the corruption they used to cause.

Name: The Bee
Verse: And the day We shall raise up from every community a witness against them from among themselves, and We shall bring you as a witness against these. And We have revealed to you the Book as a clarification of all things and as a guidance, and a mercy and good tidings to those who submit.

Name: The Bee
Verse: Indeed God enjoins justice and virtue and giving to kinsfolk, and He forbids lewdness, and abomination, and aggression: He admonishes you so that you might remember.

Name: The Bee
Verse: And fulfil God’s covenant when you made a covenant, and do not break [your] oaths after pledging them and having made God surety over you. Truly God knows what you do.

Name: The Bee
Verse: And do not be like her who undoes her yarn after having made it strong, [breaking it up] into fibres by making your oaths a [means of] deceit, between you, so that one group may become more numerous than [another] group. God only tries you thereby; and certainly He will make clear to you on the Day of Resurrection that wherein you used to differ.

Name: The Bee
Verse: For if God had willed, He could have made you one community, but He leads astray whom He will and guides whom He will, and you will surely be questioned about what you used to do.

Name: The Bee
Verse: And do not make your oaths a [means of] deceit between you lest a foot should slip after being steady, and [lest] you should taste evil, forasmuch as you barred [people] from the way of God, and there be a tremendous chastisement for you.

Name: The Bee
Verse: And do not sell God’s covenant for a small price. For truly what is with God is better for you if you should know.

Name: The Bee
Verse: That which is with you will come to an end, but that which is with God remains. And He shall surely pay those who were patient, their reward according to the best of what they used to do.

Name: The Bee
Verse: Whoever acts righteously, whether male or female, and is a believer, him verily We shall revive with a goodly life. And We shall surely pay them their reward according to the best of what they used to do.

Name: The Bee
Verse: And when you recite the Qur’ān, seek refuge in God from Satan the outcast.

Name: The Bee
Verse: Indeed he has no power over those who believe and put their trust in their Lord.

Name: The Bee
Verse: His [Satan’s] power is only over those who choose him as [their] patron,

Name: The Bee
Verse: And when We exchange a verse in place of a [different] verse and God knows best what He reveals — they say: ‘You are just a fabricator’. Nay, most of them do not know.

Name: The Bee
Verse: Say: ‘The Holy Spirit has revealed it from your Lord with truth to confirm [the faith of] those who believe, and as guidance and good tidings for those who have submitted [to God]’.

Name: The Bee
Verse: And verily We know that they say, ‘It is only a human that is teaching him: The tongue of him to whom they refer is foreign’; while this is [in] a clear Arabic tongue.

Name: The Bee
Verse: Indeed those who do not believe in God’s signs — God shall not guide them and there is a painful chastisement for them.

Name: The Bee
Verse: Only those invent falsehood who do not believe in God’s signs, and it is they who are the liars.

Name: The Bee
Verse: Whoever disbelieves in God after [having affirmed] his faith — except for him who is compelled, while his heart is at rest in faith — but he who opens up his breast to unbelief, upon such shall be wrath from God, and there is a great chastisement for them.

Name: The Bee
Verse: That is because they have preferred the life of this world to the Hereafter, and because God does not guide the disbelieving folk.

Name: The Bee
Verse: They are the ones on whose hearts God has set a seal, and on their hearing and their sight [as well], and it is they who are heedless.

Name: The Bee
Verse: Without a doubt in the Hereafter they are the ones who will be the losers.

Name: The Bee
Verse: Then indeed your Lord — as for those who emigrated after they were persecuted, and then struggled and were patient, indeed your Lord after that is Forgiving, Merciful.

Name: The Bee
Verse: The day when every soul will come pleading for itself, and every soul will be repaid what it has done and they will not be wronged.

Name: The Bee
Verse: And God strikes a similitude : a town, peaceful, its provision coming to it plenteously from every place. But it rejected God’s graces, so God made it taste the garb of hunger and fear, [all] because of what they used to do.

Name: The Bee
Verse: And verily there came to them a messenger from among them, but they denied him, and so the chastisement seized them while they were evildoers.

Name: The Bee
Verse: So eat of the lawful and good food which God has provided you, and be thankful for God’s grace, if it is Him that you worship.

Name: The Bee
Verse: He has forbidden you only carrion, blood, the flesh of swine, and that which has been hallowed to other than God. Yet whoever is compelled, neither craving nor transgressing, then truly God is Forgiving, Merciful.

Name: The Bee
Verse: And do not say, concerning that which your own tongues qualify, falsehood [such as] ‘This is lawful, and this is unlawful’, in order to invent lies against God. Truly those who invent lies against God will not prosper.

Name: The Bee
Verse: A brief enjoyment, and for them there will be a painful chastisement.

Name: The Bee
Verse: And to those of Jewry, We forbade that which We have related to you already; and We did not wrong them, but they used to wrong themselves.

Name: The Bee
Verse: Then indeed your Lord — to those who did evil out of ignorance, and then repented after that and made amends — indeed your Lord after that is Forgiving, Merciful.

Name: The Bee
Verse: Truly Abraham was a community, obedient to God, a hanīf, and he was not of the idolaters;

Name: The Bee
Verse: grateful [as he was] for His graces, He chose him, and guided him to a straight path.

Name: The Bee
Verse: And We gave him in this world good, and in the Hereafter he will indeed be among the righteous.

Name: The Bee
Verse: Then We revealed to you, [saying]: ‘Follow the creed of Abraham, a hanīf, and he was not of the idolaters’.

Name: The Bee
Verse: The Sabbath was only prescribed for those who differed concerning it; and lo! your Lord will judge between them on the Day of Resurrection, concerning that wherein they used to differ.

Name: The Bee
Verse: Call to the way of your Lord with wisdom and fair exhortation, and dispute with them by way of that which is best. Truly your Lord knows best those who stray from His way and He knows best those who are guided.

Name: The Bee
Verse: And if you retaliate, retaliate with the like of what you have been made to suffer; and yet if you endure patiently, verily that is better for the patient.

Name: The Bee
Verse: So be patient, and your patience is only by [the help of] God. And do not grieve for them, nor be in distress because of that which they scheme.

Name: The Bee
Verse: Truly God is with those who fear, and those who are virtuous.

Name: The Children of Israel
Verse: Glory be to Him Who carried His servant by night from the Sacred Mosque to the Farthest Mosque; the environs of which We have blessed, that We might show him some of Our signs. Indeed He is the Hearing, the Seeing.

Name: The Children of Israel
Verse: And We gave Moses the Scripture, and made it a guidance for the Children of Israel [saying] that they should not choose beside Me any guardian.

Name: The Children of Israel
Verse: And We decreed to the Children of Israel in the Scripture: ‘You shall indeed work corruption in the land, twice and you shall indeed become great tyrants’.

Name: The Children of Israel
Verse: So when the time for the first of the two [prophecies] came, We roused against you servants of Ours of great might, who ransacked [your] habitations, and it was a promise fulfilled.

Name: The Children of Israel
Verse: Then We gave you back the turn, [to prevail] over them, and We aided you with children and wealth, and made you greater in number.

Name: The Children of Israel
Verse: ‘If you are virtuous, you are being virtuous to your own souls, and if you do evil, it is for them’. So when the time for the other [prophecy] comes, that they might ravage you, and that they might enter the Temple, just as they entered it, the first time, and that they might destroy all that they conquered, utterly.

Name: The Children of Israel
Verse: It may be that your Lord will have mercy upon you, but if you revert, We [too] will revert; and We have made Hell a dungeon for the disbelievers.

Name: The Children of Israel
Verse: Truly this Qur’ān guides to that which is straightest and gives tidings to the believers who perform righteous deeds that there is a great reward for them.

Name: The Children of Israel
Verse: And that those who do not believe in the Hereafter, We have prepared for them a painful chastisement.

Name: The Children of Israel
Verse: And man prays for ill as [avidly as] he prays for good. And mankind is ever hasty.

Name: The Children of Israel
Verse: And We made the night and the day two signs. Then We effaced the sign of the night and made the sign of the day sight-giving; that you may seek bounty from your Lord, and that you may know the number of years and the reckoning, and everything We have detailed very distinctly.

Name: The Children of Israel
Verse: And We have attached every person’s omen upon his neck and We shall bring forth for him, on the Day of Resurrection, a book which he will find wide open.

Name: The Children of Israel
Verse: ‘Read your book! This day your soul suffices as your own reckoner’.

Name: The Children of Israel
Verse: Whoever is guided, is guided only to [the good of] his own soul, and whoever goes astray, goes astray only to its [his soul’s] detriment. No burdened soul shall bear the burden of another. And We never chastise until We have sent a messenger.

Name: The Children of Israel
Verse: And when We desire to destroy a town We command its affluent ones, but they fall into immorality therein, and so the Word is justified concerning it, and We destroy it utterly.

Name: The Children of Israel
Verse: How many generations We have destroyed since Noah! And your Lord suffices as One Informed and Beholder of the sins of His servants.

Name: The Children of Israel
Verse: Whoever desires the hasty world, We hasten for him therein whatever We will, for whom We please. Then We appoint for him Hell, to which he will be exposed, condemned, and rejected.

Name: The Children of Israel
Verse: And whoever desires the Hereafter and strives for it with the necessary effort, being a believer — for such their effort will find favour.

Name: The Children of Israel
Verse: Each We supply [to] these and [to] those from your Lord’s bounty. And your Lord’s bounty is not confined.

Name: The Children of Israel
Verse: See how We have given preference to some of them over others. And truly the Hereafter is greater in degrees and greater in preferment.

Name: The Children of Israel
Verse: Do not set up another god besides God, or you will sit blameworthy, forsaken.

Name: The Children of Israel
Verse: And your Lord has decreed that you worship none save Him, and kindness to parents. If they should reach old age with you, one of them or both then do not say to them ‘Fie’ nor repulse them, but speak to them gracious words.

Name: The Children of Israel
Verse: And lower to them the wing of humility out of mercy and say: ‘My Lord, have mercy on them, just as they reared me when I was little’.

Name: The Children of Israel
Verse: Your Lord knows best what is in your hearts. If you are righteous, then truly, to those who are penitent He is Forgiving.

Name: The Children of Israel
Verse: And give the kinsman his due, and the needy and the traveller [as well]; and do not squander.

Name: The Children of Israel
Verse: Indeed squanderers are brothers of devils, and the Devil was ever ungrateful to his Lord.

Name: The Children of Israel
Verse: But if you [have to] overlook them, seeking mercy from your Lord, [a mercy] which you expect [in the future], then speak to them gentle words.

Name: The Children of Israel
Verse: And do not keep your hand chained to your neck, nor open it completely, or you will sit blameworthy and denuded.

Name: The Children of Israel
Verse: Truly your Lord expands provision for whomever He will and He straitens. Indeed He is ever Aware and Seer of His servants.

Name: The Children of Israel
Verse: And do not slay your children, fearing penury. We shall provide for them and for you. Slaying them is truly a great sin.

Name: The Children of Israel
Verse: And do not come [anywhere] near fornication. It is indeed an indecency and an evil way.

Name: The Children of Israel
Verse: And do not slay the soul [whose life] God has made inviolable, except with due cause. Whoever is slain wrongfully, We have certainly given his heir, a warrant; but let him not commit excess; for he is supported [by the Law].

Name: The Children of Israel
Verse: And do not come [anywhere] near an orphan’s property, except in the fairest manner until he comes of age. And fulfil the covenant. Indeed the covenant will be enquired into.

Name: The Children of Israel
Verse: And give full measure when you measure, and weigh with a right balance: that is better and fairer in return.

Name: The Children of Israel
Verse: And do not pursue that of which you have no knowledge. Indeed the hearing and the sight and the heart — of each of these it will be asked.

Name: The Children of Israel
Verse: And do not walk in the earth exultantly. Indeed you will not rend the earth, nor attain the mountains in height.

Name: The Children of Israel
Verse: All of that — the evil of it is hateful in the sight of your Lord.

Name: The Children of Israel
Verse: This is [part] of the wisdom which your Lord has revealed to you. And do not set up with God any other god, or you will be cast into Hell, blameworthy, abandoned.

Name: The Children of Israel
Verse: Has your Lord then preferred you with sons and chosen for Himself females from among the angels? Truly you are speaking a monstrous word!

Name: The Children of Israel
Verse: And verily We have dispensed in this Qur’ān, so that they may remember, but it only increases them in aversion.

Name: The Children of Israel
Verse: Say: ‘If there were with Him [other] gods, as they say, they would, in that case, have sought against the Lord of the Throne some path.

Name: The Children of Israel
Verse: Glory be to Him and exalted be He above what they say, greatly!

Name: The Children of Israel
Verse: The seven heavens and the earth and all that is therein proclaim His praise. And there is not a thing, but proclaims His praise; but you do not understand their glorification. Lo! He is Forbearing, Forgiving.

Name: The Children of Israel
Verse: And when you recite the Qur’ān, We place between you and those who do not believe in the Hereafter a hidden barrier.

Name: The Children of Israel
Verse: And We place upon their hearts veils, lest they should understand it, and in their ears a deafness. And when you mention your Lord alone in the Qur’ān, they turn their backs in aversion.

Name: The Children of Israel
Verse: We know best what they listen to when they listen to you, and when they are in secret counsel, when the evildoers say: ‘You are only following a man bewitched’.

Name: The Children of Israel
Verse: Look how they strike similitudes for you, and they go astray, and cannot find a way.

Name: The Children of Israel
Verse: And they say: ‘What, when we are bones and fragments, shall we really be raised up in a new creation?’

Name: The Children of Israel
Verse: Say: ‘Be stones or iron,

Name: The Children of Israel
Verse: or some creation yet greater in your breasts. They will then say: ‘Who shall bring us back?’ Say: ‘He Who originated you the first time. Then they will shake their heads at you, and they will say: ‘When will it be?’ Say: ‘Maybe it is near!’

Name: The Children of Israel
Verse: The day He calls you, you will respond with His praise, and you will think that you have remained only a little.

Name: The Children of Israel
Verse: And tell My servants to speak that which is finer. For Satan indeed incites ill feeling between them, and Satan is indeed man’s manifest enemy.

Name: The Children of Israel
Verse: Your Lord knows you best. If He will, He will have mercy on you, or if He will, He will chastise you. And We did not send you to be a guardian over them.

Name: The Children of Israel
Verse: And your Lord knows best all who are in the heavens and the earth. And verily We have preferred some of the prophets above others; and We gave David the Psalms.

Name: The Children of Israel
Verse: Say: ‘Call on those whom you assumed besides Him; yet they have no power to rid you of misfortune nor to transfer.

Name: The Children of Israel
Verse: Those whom they call, [they themselves] seek a means to their Lord, which of them is nearer; and they hope for His mercy and fear His chastisement. Truly your Lord’s chastisement is a thing to beware of.

Name: The Children of Israel
Verse: There is not a town but We shall destroy it before the Day of Resurrection, or chastise it with terrible chastisement. That has been inscribed in the Book.

Name: The Children of Israel
Verse: Nothing prevented Us from sending the signs, except that the ancients denied them. And We gave Thamūd the she-camel as apparent, but they wronged it. And We do not send signs, except for deterrence.

Name: The Children of Israel
Verse: And when We said to you, ‘Truly your Lord encompasses mankind’. And We did not appoint the vision that We showed you, except as a test for people, and [likewise] the tree cursed in the Qur’ān; And We [seek to] deter them but it only increases them in gross insolence.

Name: The Children of Israel
Verse: And when We said to the angels, ‘Prostrate yourselves before Adam’, and so they [all] prostrated themselves, except Iblīs: he said, ‘Shall I prostrate myself before one whom You have created from clay?’

Name: The Children of Israel
Verse: Said he, ‘Do You see this one whom You have honoured above me? If You defer me to the Day of Resurrection I shall verily eradicate his seed, [all] save a few’.

Name: The Children of Israel
Verse: Said He: ‘Begone. Whoever of them follows you — indeed Hell shall be your requital, a requital [that is indeed] ample.

Name: The Children of Israel
Verse: And tempt whomever of them you can with your voice, and rally against them your cavalry and your infantry, and share with them in wealth, and children, and make promises to them’. And Satan promises them nothing but delusion.

Name: The Children of Israel
Verse: ‘Truly as for My servants, you shall have no warrant’. And Your Lord suffices as a guardian.

Name: The Children of Israel
Verse: Your Lord is He Who drives for you the ships upon the sea that you may seek of His bounty. Truly He is ever Merciful towards you.

Name: The Children of Israel
Verse: And when distress befalls you at sea, those whom you [are wont to] invoke are no longer present, except Him. But when He delivers you, to land, you are rejective, for man is ever ungrateful.

Name: The Children of Israel
Verse: Do you feel secure that He will not cause a side of the earth to swallow you up, or unleash upon you a squall of pebbles? Then you will not find for yourselves any guardian.

Name: The Children of Israel
Verse: Or do you feel secure that He will not return you to it a second time and unleash upon you a shattering gale, and drown you for your ungratefulness? And then you will not find for yourselves any redresser of this against Us.

Name: The Children of Israel
Verse: And verily We have honoured the Children of Adam, and carried them over land and sea, and provided them with good things and We have preferred them above many of those whom We created with a marked preferment.

Name: The Children of Israel
Verse: The day when We shall summon all men with their leader. And whoever is given his book in his right hand, those will read their book, and they will not be wronged, [so much as] a single date-thread.

Name: The Children of Israel
Verse: And whoever has been in this blind, will be blind in the Hereafter, and [even] further astray from the [right] way.

Name: The Children of Israel
Verse: And indeed they were about to beguile you away from that which We revealed to you, so that you might invent against Us [something] other than that; and then they would have taken you as a friend.

Name: The Children of Israel
Verse: And if We had not made you [stand] firm, certainly you might have inclined to them a little.

Name: The Children of Israel
Verse: Then We would have surely made you taste a double in life and a double upon death. Then you would not have found for yourself any helper against Us.

Name: The Children of Israel
Verse: And indeed they were about to provoke you out of the land to expel you from it, but then they would not have remained after you, except a little [while].

Name: The Children of Israel
Verse: That is] the way in the case of those whom We have sent from among Our messengers before you. And as regards Our [established] way you will not find any change.

Name: The Children of Israel
Verse: Establish prayer from the sun’s decline until the dark of night and the recital [of the Qur’ān] at dawn. Verily the dawn recital is ever witnessed.

Name: The Children of Israel
Verse: And for a part of the night, keep vigil therewith as a supererogatory [devotion] for you. It may be that your Lord will raise you to a praiseworthy station.

Name: The Children of Israel
Verse: And say: ‘My Lord, make me enter with a veritable entrance, and bring me out with a veritable departure. And grant me from Yourself a favourable authority’.

Name: The Children of Israel
Verse: And say: ‘The Truth has come and falsehood has vanished away. Truly falsehood is ever bound to vanish’.

Name: The Children of Israel
Verse: And We reveal of the Qur’ān that which is a cure, and a mercy for believers; though it only increases the evildoers in loss.

Name: The Children of Israel
Verse: And when We are gracious to man, he is disregardful and turns aside; but when an ill befalls him, he is in despair.

Name: The Children of Israel
Verse: Say: ‘Everyone acts according to his [own] character, and your Lord knows best who is better guided as to the way’.

Name: The Children of Israel
Verse: And they will question you concerning the Spirit. Say: ‘The Spirit is of the command of my Lord. And of knowledge you have not been given except a little’.

Name: The Children of Israel
Verse: And if We willed We could take away what We have revealed to you. Then you would not find in respect thereof any guardian for yourself against Us;

Name: The Children of Israel
Verse: Say: ‘Verily, should mankind and jinn come together to produce the like of this Qur’ān, they could not produce the like thereof, even if they backed one another’.

Name: The Children of Israel
Verse: And verily We have dispensed for people in this Qur’ān every [kind of] similitude, but most people insist on disbelieving.

Name: The Children of Israel
Verse: And they say, ‘We will not believe you until you make gush forth for us from the ground a spring;

Name: The Children of Israel
Verse: or until you [come to] have a garden of date-palms and vines, and cause streams to gush forth therein, abundantly;

Name: The Children of Israel
Verse: or until you cause the heaven to fall upon us, as you assert, in pieces, or bring God and the angels [right] in front [of us];

Name: The Children of Israel
Verse: or until you [come to] have a house adorned with gold, or ascend into the heaven, and [even then] we will not believe your ascension, until you bring down for us a book, that we may read’. Say: ‘Glory be to my Lord! Am I anything but a human, a messenger [from God]?’

Name: The Children of Israel
Verse: And nothing prevented mankind from believing when guidance came to them, but that they said: ‘Has God sent a human as a messenger [from Him]?’

Name: The Children of Israel
Verse: Say: ‘Had there been in the earth angels, walking [and living] secure, We would have sent down to them from the heaven an angel as Messenger’.

Name: The Children of Israel
Verse: Say: ‘God suffices as a witness between me and you. Truly He is Aware, Seer of His servants’.

Name: The Children of Israel
Verse: And he whom God guides is rightly guided, and he whom He sends astray — you will not find for them [any] guardians besides Him. And We shall assemble them on the Day of Resurrection on their faces, blind, dumb, and deaf; their abode shall be Hell — whenever it abates, We shall intensify for them the blaze.

Name: The Children of Israel
Verse: That is their requital because they disbelieved Our signs and said: ‘What, when we are bones and fragments, shall we really be raised in a new creation?’

Name: The Children of Israel
Verse: Have they not seen that God, [He] Who created the heavens and the earth, has the power to create the like of them? He has appointed for them a term whereof is no doubt; yet the wrongdoers insist on disbelief.

Name: The Children of Israel
Verse: Say: ‘If you possessed the treasuries of my Lord’s mercy, you would surely withhold [them] for fear of spending; and man is ever niggardly’.

Name: The Children of Israel
Verse: And verily We gave Moses nine manifest signs. Ask the Children of Israel when he came to them, Pharaoh said to him, ‘O Moses, I truly think that you are bewitched’.

Name: The Children of Israel
Verse: He [Moses] said, ‘Indeed you know that none revealed these, except the Lord of the heavens and the earth, as proofs; and I truly think that you, O Pharaoh, are doomed’.

Name: The Children of Israel
Verse: And he desired to scare them from the land; so We drowned him and those with him, all together.

Name: The Children of Israel
Verse: And after him We said to the Children of Israel, ‘Dwell in the land; but when the promise of the Hereafter comes to pass, We shall bring you [gathered] in mixed company’.

Name: The Children of Israel
Verse: With the truth have We revealed it, and with the truth has it been revealed; and We have not sent you, except as a bearer of good tidings, and as a warner.

Name: The Children of Israel
Verse: And [it is] a Qur’ān that We have divided that you may recite it to mankind at intervals, and We have revealed it by [successive] revelation.

Name: The Children of Israel
Verse: Say: ‘Believe in it or do not believe; indeed those who were given knowledge before it, when it is recited to them, fall down in prostration on their faces,

Name: The Children of Israel
Verse: and say, “Glory be to our Lord. Indeed Our Lord’s promise is bound to be fulfilled”.

Name: The Children of Israel
Verse: And they fall down on their faces, weeping; and it increases them in humility’.

Name: The Children of Israel
Verse: Say: ‘Invoke God or invoke the Compassionate One, whichever you invoke, to Him belong the Most Beautiful Names’: And do not be loud in your prayer, nor be silent therein, but seek between that a way.

Name: The Children of Israel
Verse: And say: ‘Praise be to God, Who has neither taken a son, nor has He any partner in sovereignty, nor has He [taken] any ally out of weakness’. And magnify Him with magnifications [worthy of Him].

Name: The Cave
Verse: Praise belongs to God [alone], Who has revealed to His servant the Book, and has not allowed for it any crookedness,

Name: The Cave
Verse: wherein they will abide forever,

Name: The Cave
Verse: and to warn those who say, 'God has taken a son'.

Name: The Cave
Verse: They do not have, in this any knowledge, nor did their fathers. Dreadful is the word that comes out of their mouths. They speak nothing but lies.

Name: The Cave
Verse: Yet it may be that you will consume yourself in their wake if they should not believe in this discourse out of grief.

Name: The Cave
Verse: Truly We have made all that is on the earth as an adornment for it, that We may try them which of them is best in conduct.

Name: The Cave
Verse: And indeed We shall turn all that is therein into barren shreds.

Name: The Cave
Verse: Or did you think that the Companions of the Cave and the Inscription were a [unique] marvel from among Our signs?

Name: The Cave
Verse: When the youths took refuge in the Cave they said, 'Our Lord! Give us mercy from Yourself and remedy for us our affair through rectitude'.

Name: The Cave
Verse: So We smote their ears in the Cave for several years.

Name: The Cave
Verse: Then We aroused them that We might know which of the two parties was better in calculating what they had tarried in [terms of the] length of time.

Name: The Cave
Verse: We relate to you their story with truth. They were indeed youths who believed in their Lord, and We increased them in guidance.

Name: The Cave
Verse: And We strengthened their hearts when they stood up and said, 'Our Lord is the Lord of the heavens and the earth. We will not call on any god besides Him, for then we shall certainly have uttered an outrage.

Name: The Cave
Verse: These our people have taken gods besides Him. Why [if what they claim is true] do they not bring some clear warrant regarding them? And who does greater wrong than he who invents a lie against God?

Name: The Cave
Verse: And when you withdraw from them and from that which they worship except God, then take refuge in the Cave. Your Lord will reveal for you something of His mercy and prepare for you in your affair some comfort'.

Name: The Cave
Verse: And you might have seen the sun, when it rose, inclining away from their Cave towards the right, and when it set, go past them on the left, while they were in a cavern therein. That was [one] of God's signs. Whomever God guides, he indeed is rightly guided, and whomever He leads astray, you will not find for him a guiding friend.

Name: The Cave
Verse: And you would have supposed them awake, though they were asleep. And We caused them to turn over to the right and to the left, and their dog [lay] stretching its forelegs on the threshold. If you had observed them you would have turned away from them in flight and you would have been filled with awe because of them.

Name: The Cave
Verse: And so it was that We aroused them that they might question one another. One of them said, 'How long have you tarried?' They said, 'We have tarried a day, or part of a day'. They said, 'Your Lord knows best how long you have tarried. Now send one of you with this silver coin of yours to the city, and let him see which is the purest food, and [let him] bring you a supply thereof. Let him be careful and not make anyone aware of you.

Name: The Cave
Verse: For indeed if they should come to know of you, they will [either] stone you or make you return to their creed, and then you will never prosper'.

Name: The Cave
Verse: And so it was that We disclosed them that they might know that God's promise is true; and that, as for the Hour, there is no doubt concerning it. Behold they were disputing among themselves their affair; so they said, 'Build over them a building; their Lord knows them best'. Those who prevailed regarding their affair, 'We will verily set up over them, a place of worship'.

Name: The Cave
Verse: They will say: 'Three; their dog the fourth of them'; and they will say, 'Five; their dog the sixth of them' - guessing at random. And they will say, 'Seven; and their dog the eighth of them'. Say: 'My Lord knows best their number, and none knows them except a few'. So do not contend concerning them except with an outward manner [of contention] and do not question concerning them any of them.

Name: The Cave
Verse: And never say regarding something, 'I will indeed do that tomorrow',

Name: The Cave
Verse: without [adding], 'If God will'. And remember your Lord if you forget. And say, 'May be my Lord will guide me to [something] closer [in time] than this by way of guidance.

Name: The Cave
Verse: And they tarried in the Cave three hundred years and add nine.

Name: The Cave
Verse: Say: 'God is more knowledgeable of how long they tarried. To Him belongs the Unseen of the heavens and the earth. How well He sees! How well He hears! They have no guardian besides Him, and He makes none to share in His rule'.

Name: The Cave
Verse: And recite that which has been revealed to you of the Book of your Lord. There is none who can change His words. And you will not find, besides Him, any refuge.

Name: The Cave
Verse: And restrain yourself along with those who call upon their Lord at morning and evening, desiring His Countenance; and do not let your eyes overlook them desiring the glitter of the life of this world. And do not obey him whose heart We have made oblivious to Our remembrance, and who follows his own whim, and whose conduct is [mere] prodigality.

Name: The Cave
Verse: And say, 'The truth [that comes] from your Lord; so whoever will, let him believe, and whoever will, let him disbelieve'. Indeed We have prepared for the wrongdoers a Fire, and they will be surrounded by its pavilion. If they cry out for help, they will be succoured with water like molten copper which scalds faces. What an evil drink, and how ill a resting-place!

Name: The Cave
Verse: Truly those who believe and perform righteous deeds - indeed We do not leave the reward of those of good deeds to go to waste.

Name: The Cave
Verse: Those, for them there shall be Gardens of Eden, underneath which rivers flow; therein they shall be adorned with bracelets of gold and they shall wear green garments of fine silk and [heavy] silk brocade, reclining therein on couches. How excellent a reward, and how fair a resting-place!

Name: The Cave
Verse: And strike for them a similitude: two men to one of whom We had assigned two gardens of vines, and We had surrounded them with date-palms and had set between them [a field of] crops.

Name: The Cave
Verse: Each of the two gardens yielded its produce without stinting anything thereof. And We caused a stream to gush forth therein.

Name: The Cave
Verse: And he had fruit and he said to his companion, as he conversed with him: 'I have more wealth than you and am stronger in respect of men'.

Name: The Cave
Verse: And he entered his garden having wronged himself. He said, 'I do not think that [all] this will ever perish.

Name: The Cave
Verse: Moreover, I do not think that the Hour will ever come; and [even] if I am indeed returned to my Lord, I shall surely find better than this as a resort'.

Name: The Cave
Verse: His companion said to him, as he conversed with him: 'Do you disbelieve in Him Who created you of dust, then of a drop of fluid, then fashioned you a man?

Name: The Cave
Verse: But lo He [is] God, my Lord, and I do not ascribe any partner to my Lord.

Name: The Cave
Verse: And if only when you entered your garden, you had said, "What God has willed. There is no power except in God". If you see me as less than you in wealth and children,

Name: The Cave
Verse: maybe my Lord will give me [something] better than your garden and unleash upon it bolts from the heaven so that it becomes a bare plain;

Name: The Cave
Verse: or [maybe] its water will sink [deep] down so that you have no means of acquiring it'.

Name: The Cave
Verse: And his fruit was beset, and so he began to wring his hands because of what he had spent on it, as it lay fallen on its trellises, saying, 'O I wish I had not ascribed any partner to my Lord!'

Name: The Cave
Verse: But there was no party to help him, besides God, nor could he help himself.

Name: The Cave
Verse: There, [all] protection belongs to God, the True. He is better at rewarding, and best in consequence.

Name: The Cave
Verse: And strike for them the similitude of the life of this world as water which We send down out from the heaven, and the vegetation of the earth mingles with it, and it then becomes chaff, scattered by the winds. And God is Omnipotent over all things.

Name: The Cave
Verse: Wealth and children are an adornment of the life of this world. But the enduring things, the righteous deeds - [these] are better with your Lord for reward and better in [respect of] hope.

Name: The Cave
Verse: And the day when the mountains shall be set in motion and you will see the earth exposed. And We shall gather them, such that We will not leave out anyone of them.

Name: The Cave
Verse: And they shall be presented before your Lord in ranks: 'Verily you have come to Us just as We created you the first time; rather you claimed that We would not appoint for you a tryst'.

Name: The Cave
Verse: And the Book shall be set in place. And you will see the guilty apprehensive of what is in it, and they will say: 'O woe to us! What is it with this Book that it leaves out neither small nor great, but [instead it] has counted it?' And they shall find all that they did present. And your Lord does not wrong anyone.

Name: The Cave
Verse: And when We said to the angels, ‘Prostrate before Adam’, and so they prostrated, [all] except Iblīs. He was [one] of the jinn, and he transgressed against his Lord’s command. Will you then take him and his offspring for your patrons instead of Me, when they are an enemy to you? How evil for the evildoers is that substitute!

Name: The Cave
Verse: I did not make them a witness to the creation of the heavens and the earth, nor to their own creation. Nor do I take misleaders as [My] support.

Name: The Cave
Verse: And the day when He will say, 'Call those partners of Mine, as you used to claim'; and then they will call them, but they will not respond to their call, and We shall set between them a gulf of doom.

Name: The Cave
Verse: And the criminals will behold the Fire and realise that they are about to fall into it. And they will find no means of avoiding it.

Name: The Cave
Verse: And verily We have dispensed for mankind in this Qur’ān [an example] of every kind of similitude. But man is most disputatious.

Name: The Cave
Verse: And nothing prevented people from believing when the guidance came to them, and from asking forgiveness of their Lord, without that there should come upon them the precedent of the ancients, or that the chastisement should come upon them before their very eyes.

Name: The Cave
Verse: And We do not send messengers except as bearers of good tidings and as warners. But those who disbelieve dispute with falsehood that they may refute thereby the truth. And they have taken My signs and that whereof they have been warned derisively.

Name: The Cave
Verse: And who does greater wrong than he who has been reminded of the signs of his Lord, yet turns away from them and forgets what his hands have sent ahead? Indeed on their hearts We have cast veils, lest they should understand it, and in their ears a deafness; and though you call them to guidance, they will not be guided in that case, ever.

Name: The Cave
Verse: And your Lord is the Forgiver, Full of Mercy. Were He to take them to task for what they have earned, He would have hastened for them the chastisement; but they have a tryst from which they will not find any escape.

Name: The Cave
Verse: And those towns, We destroyed them when they did evil, and We appointed for their destruction a tryst.

Name: The Cave
Verse: And when Moses said to his lad, 'I will not give up until I have reached the juncture of the two seas, though I march on for ages'.

Name: The Cave
Verse: So when they reached a juncture between the two, they forgot their fish, and so it made its way into the sea by burrowing.

Name: The Cave
Verse: And when they had made the traverse, he said to his lad, 'Bring us our breakfast. We have certainly encountered on this journey of ours much fatigue'.

Name: The Cave
Verse: He said, 'Do you see? when we sheltered at the rock, indeed I forgot the fish - and none but Satan made me forget to mention it and it made its way into the sea in an amazing manner'.

Name: The Cave
Verse: Said he, 'That is what we have been seeking!' So they turned back, retracing their footsteps.

Name: The Cave
Verse: So [there] they found one of Our servants to whom We had given mercy from Us and We had taught him knowledge from Us.

Name: The Cave
Verse: Moses said to him, 'May I follow you for the purpose that you teach me of what you have been taught [in the way] of probity?'

Name: The Cave
Verse: Said he, 'Truly you will not be able to bear with me.

Name: The Cave
Verse: And how can you bear with that whereof you have never been informed?'

Name: The Cave
Verse: He said, 'You will find me, God willing, patient, and I will not disobey you in any matter'.

Name: The Cave
Verse: He said, 'If you follow me then do not question me concerning anything until I [myself] make mention of it to you'.

Name: The Cave
Verse: So they set off until when they embarked on the ship, he made a hole in it. Said [Moses], 'Did you make a hole in it to drown its people? You have certainly done a dreadful thing'.

Name: The Cave
Verse: He said, 'Did I not say [that] you would not be able to bear with me?'

Name: The Cave
Verse: He said, 'Do not take me to task on account of that which I forgot, and do not exhaust me in this affair of mine with difficulty'.

Name: The Cave
Verse: So they set off until, when they met a boy and he slew him - [Moses] said: 'Have you slain an innocent soul, [one slain] not in retaliation for another soul? Verily you have committed an dreadful thing'.

Name: The Cave
Verse: He said, 'Did I not say to you that you would never be able to bear with me?'

Name: The Cave
Verse: So they set off, until, when they came to the folk of a [certain] town, they asked its folk for food, but they refused to extend them any hospitality. They then found in it a wall about to collapse, so he straightened it. [Moses] said, 'Had you wished, you could have taken a wage for it'.

Name: The Cave
Verse: Said he, 'This is the parting between me and you. I will inform you the interpretation of that over which you were not able to maintain patience.

Name: The Cave
Verse: As for the ship, it belonged to poor people who earned a living on the sea; and I wanted to make it defective, for behind them was a king, seizing every ship by force.

Name: The Cave
Verse: And as for the boy, his parents were believers and We feared lest he should overwhelm them with insolence and disbelief.

Name: The Cave
Verse: So We desired that their Lord should give them in exchange one better than him in purity and closer to mercy.

Name: The Cave
Verse: And as for the wall, it belonged to two orphan boys [who lived] in the city, and beneath it there was a treasure belonging to them. Their father had been a righteous man and your Lord desired that they should come of age and extract their treasure as a mercy from your Lord. And I did not do it of my own accord. This is the interpretation of that over which you could not maintain patience'.

Name: The Cave
Verse: And they question you concerning Dhū’l-Qarnayn. Say: ‘I shall recite to you a mention of him’.

Name: The Cave
Verse: Indeed We empowered him throughout the land, and We gave him to everything a way.

Name: The Cave
Verse: And he followed a way

Name: The Cave
Verse: until, when he reached the setting of the sun, he found it setting in a muddy spring; and he found by it a folk. We said, ‘O Dhū’l-Qarnayn — either chastise, or treat them kindly’.

Name: The Cave
Verse: He said, 'As for him who does wrong, we shall chastise him. Then he shall be returned to his Lord and He shall chastise him with an awful chastisement.

Name: The Cave
Verse: But as for him who believes and acts righteously, he shall have the fairest reward, and we shall speak to him mildly in our command'.

Name: The Cave
Verse: ] Then he followed a way,

Name: The Cave
Verse: until, when he reached the rising of the sun, he found it rising on a folk for whom We had not provided against it any [form of] cover.

Name: The Cave
Verse: So [it was]; and We encompassed whatever pertained to him in knowledge.

Name: The Cave
Verse: Then he followed a way,

Name: The Cave
Verse: until, when he reached between the two barriers he found on this side of them a folk that could scarcely comprehend speech.

Name: The Cave
Verse: They said, ‘O Dhū’l-Qarnayn, truly Gog and Magog are causing corruption in the land. So shall we pay you a tribute on condition that you build between us and them a barrier?

Name: The Cave
Verse: He said, 'That wherewith my Lord has empowered me is better; so help me with strength and I will build between you and them a rampart.

Name: The Cave
Verse: Bring me ingots of iron!' Until, when he had levelled up [the gap] between the two flanks he said, 'Blow!' until when he had made it a fire, he said, 'Bring me molten copper to pour over it'.

Name: The Cave
Verse: And so they were not able to scale it, nor could they pierce it.

Name: The Cave
Verse: Said he, 'This is a mercy from my Lord. But when the promise of my Lord comes to pass, He will level it, for my Lord's promise is [always] true'.

Name: The Cave
Verse: And on that day, We shall let some of them surge against others, and the Trumpet shall be blown and We shall gather them a [single] gathering.

Name: The Cave
Verse: And on that day We shall present Hell to the disbelievers, plain to view,

Name: The Cave
Verse: those [disbelievers] whose eyes were masked from My remembrance, and who could not [bear to] hear.

Name: The Cave
Verse: Do the disbelievers reckon that they can take My servants as patrons beside Me? Truly We have prepared Hell for the disbelievers as [a place of] hospitality.

Name: The Cave
Verse: Say: 'Shall We inform you who will be the greatest losers in [regard to] their works?

Name: The Cave
Verse: Those whose effort goes astray in the life of this world, while they reckon that they are doing good work.

Name: The Cave
Verse: Those are they who disbelieve in the signs of their Lord and the encounter with Him'. So their works have failed, and on the Day of Resurrection We shall not assign any weight to them.

Name: The Cave
Verse: That is their requital - Hell - because they disbelieved and took My signs and My messengers in mockery.

Name: The Cave
Verse: Truly those who believe and perform righteous deeds - theirs will be the gardens of Firdaws as [a place of] hospitality,

Name: The Cave
Verse: wherein they will abide, with no desire to be removed from them.

Name: The Cave
Verse: Say: 'If the sea were ink for the Words of my Lord, the sea would be spent before the Words of my Lord were spent even though We brought the like of it as replenishment'.

Name: The Cave
Verse: Say: 'I am only a human being like you; it has been revealed to me that your God is only One God. So whoever hopes to encounter his Lord, let him do righteous work and not associate with the worship of his Lord

Name: Mary
Verse: Kāf hā yā ‘ayn sād.

Name: Mary
Verse: A mention of your Lord's mercy to His servant Zachariah,

Name: Mary
Verse: when he called out to his Lord a call in secret.

Name: Mary
Verse: He said, 'My Lord, truly the bones within me have become feeble, and my head is alight with grey hair, and I have never been in my supplications to You, my Lord, unsuccessful.

Name: Mary
Verse: And truly I fear my kinsfolk after me, and my wife is barren. So grant me from Yourself a successor,

Name: Mary
Verse: who may inherit from me and inherit from the House of Jacob, and make him, my Lord, acceptable'.

Name: Mary
Verse: 'O Zachariah! Indeed We give you good tidings of a boy, whose name is John. Never before have We made anyone his namesake'.

Name: Mary
Verse: He said, 'My Lord, how shall I have a son when my wife is barren and I have reached infirm old age?'

Name: Mary
Verse: He said, 'It shall be so! Your Lord says, "It is easy for Me, for I certainly created you before when you were nothing" '.

Name: Mary
Verse: He said, 'Lord, appoint for me some sign'. Said He, 'Your sign is that you shall not speak to people for three nights, while [you are] in sound health'.

Name: Mary
Verse: So he emerged before his people from the sanctuary and signalled to them, 'Make glorifications at morning and evening'.

Name: Mary
Verse: O John! Hold on to the Scripture firmly'. And We gave him judgement, while still a child,

Name: Mary
Verse: and compassion from Us, and purity, and he was God-fearing,

Name: Mary
Verse: and dutiful to his parents. And he was not arrogant or rebellious.

Name: Mary
Verse: 'And peace be upon him, the day he was born, and the day he dies, and the day he shall be raised alive!'

Name: Mary
Verse: And mention in the Book Mary when she withdrew from her family to an easterly place.

Name: Mary
Verse: Thus she veiled herself from them, whereupon We sent to her Our Spirit, and he assumed before her the likeness of a well-proportioned human.

Name: Mary
Verse: She said, 'Lo! I seek refuge in the Compassionate One from you! If you fear God'.

Name: Mary
Verse: He said, 'I am only a messenger of your Lord, that I may give you a boy [who shall be] pure'.

Name: Mary
Verse: She said, 'How shall I have a boy when no human being has [ever] touched me, neither have I been unchaste?'

Name: Mary
Verse: He said, 'It shall be so! Your Lord has said: "It is easy for Me, and so that We may make him a sign for mankind, and a mercy from Us. And it is a thing [already] decreed" '.

Name: Mary
Verse: Thus she conceived him and then withdrew with him to a distant place.

Name: Mary
Verse: And the birth pangs brought her to the trunk of the palm-tree. She said, 'O would that I had died before this and become a forgotten thing, beyond recall!'

Name: Mary
Verse: Then he called her from below her, 'Do not grieve. Your Lord has made below you a rivulet.

Name: Mary
Verse: And shake the trunk of the palm-tree towards you - there will drop on you dates fresh and ripe.

Name: Mary
Verse: So eat and drink, and [let] your eye be comforted; and if you [happen to] see any human being, then say, "I have vowed to the Compassionate One a fast, so I will not speak to any human today" '.

Name: Mary
Verse: Then, carrying him, she brought him to her folk and they said, 'O Mary, truly you have done a curious thing!

Name: Mary
Verse: O sister of Aaron your father was not a wicked man, nor was your mother unchaste'.

Name: Mary
Verse: Thereat she pointed to him. They said, 'How can we talk to one who is in the cradle, [still] a little child?'

Name: Mary
Verse: He said, 'Lo! I am God's servant. He has given me the Scripture and made me a prophet.

Name: Mary
Verse: And He has made me blessed wherever I may be and He has enjoined upon me prayer and alms-giving, as long as I remain alive;

Name: Mary
Verse: and [He has made me] dutiful towards my mother. And He has not made me arrogant, wretched.

Name: Mary
Verse: And peace be upon me the day I was born, and the day I die, and the day I shall be raised alive!'

Name: Mary
Verse: ] That is Jesus, son of Mary, a statement of truth concerning which they are in doubt.

Name: Mary
Verse: It is not [befitting] for God to take to Himself a son. Glory be to Him. When He decrees a thing, He only says to it, 'Be!', and it is.

Name: Mary
Verse: And indeed God is my Lord and your Lord. So worship Him. This is a straight path.

Name: Mary
Verse: But the factions differed among themselves. So woe to those who disbelieve at the scene of an awful Day.

Name: Mary
Verse: How hearing they are and seeing on the Day when they come to Us. Yet the evildoers today are in manifest error.

Name: Mary
Verse: And warn them of the Day of Regret, when the matter will be decided, while they are [yet] heedless and do not believe.

Name: Mary
Verse: Indeed We shall inherit the earth and all who are on it, and to Us they shall be returned.

Name: Mary
Verse: And mention in the Book Abraham. Indeed he was a truthful one, a prophet.

Name: Mary
Verse: When he said to his father, 'O my father! Why do you worship that which neither hears nor sees, and is of no avail to you in any way?

Name: Mary
Verse: O my father! Indeed there has come to me of knowledge that which has not come to you. So follow me that I may guide you to a path that is right.

Name: Mary
Verse: O my father! Do not worship Satan. Truly Satan is disobedient to the Compassionate One.

Name: Mary
Verse: O my father! I do fear lest a chastisement from the Compassionate One should befall you and then you become an ally of Satan.

Name: Mary
Verse: He said, 'Are you renouncing my gods, O Abraham? If you do not desist, I shall surely assail you; and stay away from me for a long time'.

Name: Mary
Verse: He said, 'Peace be to you. I shall ask forgiveness of my Lord for you. Truly He is ever gracious to me.

Name: Mary
Verse: And I shall shun you and that which you call upon besides God. I will supplicate my Lord - hopefully in calling upon my Lord I shall not be wretched'.

Name: Mary
Verse: And so after he had shunned them and that which they worshipped besides God, We gave him Isaac and Jacob, and each We made a prophet.

Name: Mary
Verse: And We gave them out of Our mercy, and We assigned for them a worthy repute [one] that is lofty.

Name: Mary
Verse: And mention in the Book Moses. Indeed he was devoted [to God] and he was a messenger, a prophet.

Name: Mary
Verse: And We called him from the right side of the Mount and We brought him near in communion.

Name: Mary
Verse: And We gave him out of Our mercy his brother Aaron, [likewise] a prophet.

Name: Mary
Verse: And mention in the Book Ishmael. Indeed he was true to his promise, and he was a messenger, a prophet [likewise].

Name: Mary
Verse: He used to enjoin upon his kinsfolk prayer and the [payment of] alms, and he was pleasing to his Lord.

Name: Mary
Verse: And mention in the Book Idrīs. Indeed he was a truthful one, a prophet.

Name: Mary
Verse: And We raised him to a high station.

Name: Mary
Verse: Those to whom God has been gracious from among the prophets of the seed of Adam, and of those whom We carried with Noah, and of the seed of Abraham, and Israel, and from among those whom We guided and chose, when the signs of the Compassionate One were recited to them, they would fall down prostrating and weeping.

Name: Mary
Verse: But there succeeded after them a posterity who neglected the prayer and followed [their] lusts. So they shall [soon] encounter Ghayy;

Name: Mary
Verse: whereas those who repent and believe and act righteously - such shall enter Paradise and shall not be wronged in any way;

Name: Mary
Verse: Therein they shall not hear anything that is trifling, but only [a greeting of] 'Peace!' And therein they will have their provision morning and evening.

Name: Mary
Verse: That is the Paradise which We shall give as inheritance those of Our servants who are God-fearing.

Name: Mary
Verse: And We do not descend except by the commandment of your Lord. To Him belongs all that is before us, and all that is behind us, and all that is between those [two]. And your Lord is never forgetful.

Name: Mary
Verse: The Lord of the heavens and the earth and all that is between them. So worship Him and be steadfast in His worship. Do you know [of] anyone who could be His namesake?

Name: Mary
Verse: And man says, 'When I am dead, shall I then be brought forth alive?'

Name: Mary
Verse: Does not man then remember that We created him before, when he was nothing?

Name: Mary
Verse: For by your Lord, We will surely gather them and the devils; then We shall bring them around Hell, crouching.

Name: Mary
Verse: Then We shall pluck out from every party whichever of them was most hardened in disdain of the Compassionate One.

Name: Mary
Verse: Then indeed We shall know best those most deserving of it for the burning.

Name: Mary
Verse: There is not one of you but shall come to it. That is an inevitability [already] decreed by your Lord.

Name: Mary
Verse: Then We will deliver those who were wary and leave those who did wrong crouching therein.

Name: Mary
Verse: And when Our manifest signs are recited to them, those who disbelieve say to those who believe, 'Which of the two parties is better in station and more excellent in assembly?'

Name: Mary
Verse: And how many a generation have We destroyed before them, who were superior in [their possession of] gear and in appearance.

Name: Mary
Verse: Say: 'As for him who is in error, the Compassionate One shall defer him, by [granting him] some respite until when they catch sight of that which they were promised, whether it be chastisement [in this world] or the Hour. Then they will surely know who is worse in [respect of] position and weaker in [respect of the number of] hosts'.

Name: Mary
Verse: And God increases in guidance those who found [right] guidance; and the enduring things, the righteous deeds are better in your Lord's sight in [terms of] reward, and better in [terms of the] return.

Name: Mary
Verse: Have you seen him who disbelieves in Our signs and says, 'I shall assuredly be given wealth and children?'

Name: Mary
Verse: Has he come to learn [something] of the Unseen, or has he made a covenant with the Compassionate One?

Name: Mary
Verse: Nay, but We will assuredly write down that which he says and prolong for him the chastisement endlessly,

Name: Mary
Verse: and We shall take over from him that which he talks about, and he shall come to Us, alone.

Name: Mary
Verse: And they have taken besides God [other] gods that they may be for them a [source of] might.

Name: Mary
Verse: Nay, but they shall reject their worship, and they shall be [pitted] against them as opponents.

Name: Mary
Verse: Have you not regarded that We unleash the devils against the disbelievers to urge them impetuously?

Name: Mary
Verse: So do not make haste against them. Indeed We are only counting for them, carefully.

Name: Mary
Verse: The day on which We shall gather those who fear God, to the Compassionate One, [honoured] on mounts

Name: Mary
Verse: and drive the guilty into Hell, a thirsty herd.

Name: Mary
Verse: They will not have the power to intercede, save him who has made a covenant with the Compassionate One.

Name: Mary
Verse: And they say, 'The Compassionate One has taken a son'.

Name: Mary
Verse: Truly you have uttered something hideous.

Name: Mary
Verse: The heavens are almost rent because of it and the earth [is almost] split asunder, and the mountains [almost] fall down crashing,

Name: Mary
Verse: that they have ascribed a son to the Compassionate One.

Name: Mary
Verse: When it is not meet for [the Majesty of] the Compassionate One to take a son.

Name: Mary
Verse: There is none in the heavens and the earth but he comes to the Compassionate One as a servant.

Name: Mary
Verse: Verily He knows their number and has counted them precisely.

Name: Mary
Verse: And each one of them will come to Him on the Day of Resurrection, [each one] alone.

Name: Mary
Verse: Truly those who believe and perform righteous deeds - for them the Compassionate One shall appoint love.

Name: Mary
Verse: Indeed We have made it easy in your tongue, only that you may bear good tidings therewith to the God-fearing, and warn therewith a folk [who are] contumacious.

Name: Mary
Verse: And how many a generation We have destroyed before them. Can you see [so much as] one of them, or hear from them [so much as] the faintest sound?

Name: Tâ Hâ
Verse: Tā hā.

Name: Tâ Hâ
Verse: We have not revealed the Qur’ān to you that you should be miserable,

Name: Tâ Hâ
Verse: but only to remind him who fears

Name: Tâ Hâ
Verse: a revelation from Him Who created the earth and the high heavens.

Name: Tâ Hâ
Verse: The Compassionate One presided upon the Throne.

Name: Tâ Hâ
Verse: To Him belongs whatever is in the heavens and whatever is in the earth and whatever is between them and whatever is beneath the soil.

Name: Tâ Hâ
Verse: And should you be loud in your speech, then indeed He knows the secret and [that which is] yet more hidden.

Name: Tâ Hâ
Verse: God - there is no god save Him. To Him belong the Most Beautiful Names.

Name: Tâ Hâ
Verse: Has the story of Moses come to you?

Name: Tâ Hâ
Verse: When he caught sight of a fire and said to his family, 'Wait, Indeed I see a fire [in the distance]. Perhaps I [can] bring you a brand from it, or find at the fire some guidance'.

Name: Tâ Hâ
Verse: And when he reached it he was called [by name], 'O Moses!

Name: Tâ Hâ
Verse: Indeed I am your Lord. So take off your sandals, for lo! you are in the holy valley of Tuwā.

Name: Tâ Hâ
Verse: And I [Myself] have chosen you, so listen to what is being revealed.

Name: Tâ Hâ
Verse: Verily I am God - there is no god except Me. So worship Me and establish prayer for to make remembrance of Me.

Name: Tâ Hâ
Verse: The Hour is assuredly coming. [But] I will to keep it hidden so that every soul may be requited for what it strives for.

Name: Tâ Hâ
Verse: So do not let him bar you from it, who believes not in it but follows his own whim, lest you perish.

Name: Tâ Hâ
Verse: And what is that in your right hand, O Moses?'

Name: Tâ Hâ
Verse: He said, 'It is my staff. I lean upon it and I beat down [leaves] with it for my sheep, and I have uses for it in other ways'.

Name: Tâ Hâ
Verse: He said, 'Cast it down, O Moses!'

Name: Tâ Hâ
Verse: And he cast it down, and lo! it was a serpent moving swiftly.

Name: Tâ Hâ
Verse: He said, 'Take [hold of] it and do not fear. We will restore it to its former state.

Name: Tâ Hâ
Verse: And thrust your hand into your flank, it will emerge white without any fault. [That is] yet another sign.

Name: Tâ Hâ
Verse: That We may show you of Our greatest signs,

Name: Tâ Hâ
Verse: Go to Pharaoh. He has indeed transgressed'.

Name: Tâ Hâ
Verse: He said, 'My Lord, expand my breast for me.

Name: Tâ Hâ
Verse: And make easy for me my affair.

Name: Tâ Hâ
Verse: And undo the knot upon my tongue,

Name: Tâ Hâ
Verse: so that they may understand what I [shall] say.

Name: Tâ Hâ
Verse: And appoint for me a minister, from my family,

Name: Tâ Hâ
Verse: Aaron, my brother.

Name: Tâ Hâ
Verse: Confirm through him my strength

Name: Tâ Hâ
Verse: and let him share in my affair.

Name: Tâ Hâ
Verse: So that we may glorify You over and over again

Name: Tâ Hâ
Verse: and remember You over and over again.

Name: Tâ Hâ
Verse: Indeed You are ever Seeing of us'.

Name: Tâ Hâ
Verse: He said, 'You have been granted your request, O Moses!

Name: Tâ Hâ
Verse: And certainly, We have done you a favour [already] another time,

Name: Tâ Hâ
Verse: when We revealed to your mother that which was revealed,

Name: Tâ Hâ
Verse: "Cast him in the ark, then cast him into the river, and then the river shall throw him up onto the shore; [there] an enemy of Mine and an enemy of his shall take him". And I cast upon you a love from Me and that you might be reared under My eyes.

Name: Tâ Hâ
Verse: When your sister walked up and she then said, "Shall I show you someone who will take care of him?" Thus We restored you to your mother that her eyes might rejoice and not grieve. Then you slew a soul, whereupon We delivered you from [great] distress, and We tried you with various ordeals. Then you stayed for several years among the people of Midian. Then you came [hither] as ordained, O Moses!

Name: Tâ Hâ
Verse: And I chose you for Myself.

Name: Tâ Hâ
Verse: Go, you and your brother with My signs, and do not flag in remembrance of Me.

Name: Tâ Hâ
Verse: Go the two of you to Pharaoh. Truly he has transgressed [the bounds].

Name: Tâ Hâ
Verse: And speak to him gentle words that perhaps he may be mindful or fear'.

Name: Tâ Hâ
Verse: The two [of them] said, 'Our Lord, We truly fear that he may forestall us or become tyrannical'.

Name: Tâ Hâ
Verse: He said, 'Do not fear, for I shall be with the two of you, hearing and seeing.

Name: Tâ Hâ
Verse: So go to him and say, "Truly we are two messengers of your Lord, so let the Children of Israel go with us and do not [continue to] chastise them. We have verily brought you a sign from your Lord, and may peace be upon him who follows [right] guidance.

Name: Tâ Hâ
Verse: Indeed it has been revealed to us that the chastisement shall befall him who denies and turns away" '.

Name: Tâ Hâ
Verse: He said, 'So who is your Lord, O Moses?'

Name: Tâ Hâ
Verse: He said, 'Our Lord is He Who gave to everything its [peculiar] nature and then guided [it]'.

Name: Tâ Hâ
Verse: He said, 'So what of the generations of old?'

Name: Tâ Hâ
Verse: Said he: 'The knowledge thereof is with my Lord, in a Book. My Lord does not err, nor does He forget.

Name: Tâ Hâ
Verse: The One Who made for you the earth a cradle, and threaded for you therein ways, and sent down from the heaven water. And therewith We brought forth various kinds of plants.

Name: Tâ Hâ
Verse: Eat and pasture your cattle. In that there are indeed signs for people of sense.

Name: Tâ Hâ
Verse: From it We created you, and into it We shall restore you, and from it We shall bring you forth a second time'.

Name: Tâ Hâ
Verse: And verily We showed him all Our signs, but he denied and refused.

Name: Tâ Hâ
Verse: He said, 'Have you come to us so that you may expel us from our land by your sorcery, O Moses? <

Name: Tâ Hâ
Verse: Yet We [too] shall produce for you a sorcery like it. So fix a tryst between us and you, [a tryst] which neither we nor you shall fail to keep, [at] a place of equal distance.

Name: Tâ Hâ
Verse: Said he, 'Your tryst shall be the Day of Adornment and let the people assemble at forenoon'. [20:60]

Name: Tâ Hâ
Verse: Then Pharaoh withdrew, and summoned up his guile, and then came.

Name: Tâ Hâ
Verse: Moses said to them, 'Woe to you! Do not invent a lie against God, lest He annihilate you by some chastisement. For verily he who invents lies, fails'.

Name: Tâ Hâ
Verse: So they disputed their matter among themselves and kept secret their private counsel.

Name: Tâ Hâ
Verse: They said, 'These two men are indeed sorcerers who intend to expel you from your land by their sorcery, and do away with your excellent traditions.

Name: Tâ Hâ
Verse: So summon up your guile and come in battle-line. For truly he who is uppermost, this day shall be the victor!'

Name: Tâ Hâ
Verse: They said, 'O Moses! Either cas or we shall be the first to cast'.

Name: Tâ Hâ
Verse: He said, 'Nay, you cast!', and lo! their ropes and their staffs appeared to him by [the effect of] their sorcery as though they were gliding swiftly.

Name: Tâ Hâ
Verse: And Moses sensed fear within himself.

Name: Tâ Hâ
Verse: We said, 'Do not be afraid! Indeed you shall have the upper hand.

Name: Tâ Hâ
Verse: And cast that which is in your right hand. It shall swallow up that which they have produced. For what they have produced is only a sorcerer's trick, and the sorcerer does not succeed wherever he may go'.

Name: Tâ Hâ
Verse: Thereat the sorcerers cast [their heads] down prostrating. They said, 'We [now] believe in the Lord of Aaron and Moses'.

Name: Tâ Hâ
Verse: Said he, 'Do you profess belief in him before I give you permission? He is indeed your chief who taught you sorcery. I shall assuredly cut off your hands and feet on opposite sides and I shall assuredly crucify you on the trunks of palm trees. And you shall then know which of us is harsher in [inflicting] chastisement, and [which of us is] more lasting'.

Name: Tâ Hâ
Verse: They said, 'We will not choose you over what has come to us of clear signs, and [over] Him Who originated us. Decree what you will decree. What you decree is only [relevant] in the life of this world.

Name: Tâ Hâ
Verse: Indeed We profess belief in our Lord, that He may forgive us our sins and the sorcery to which you forced us. And God is better and more enduring'.

Name: Tâ Hâ
Verse: Truly whoever comes to his Lord a criminal, for him there shall be Hell wherein he shall neither die nor live.

Name: Tâ Hâ
Verse: And whoever comes to Him a believer, having performed righteous deeds, for such shall be the highest degrees -

Name: Tâ Hâ
Verse: the Gardens of Eden underneath which rivers flow, abiding therein, and that is the reward of him who keeps pure.

Name: Tâ Hâ
Verse: And verily We revealed to Moses, [saying], 'Lead My servants on a journey by night and strike for them a dry path in the sea. Do not fear to be overtaken and do not be afraid'.

Name: Tâ Hâ
Verse: Then Pharaoh pursued them with his hosts, and there engulfed them what did engulf them of the sea.

Name: Tâ Hâ
Verse: And Pharaoh led his people astray and he did not guide them.

Name: Tâ Hâ
Verse: O Children of Israel, truly We delivered you from your enemy, and We made a tryst with you on the right side of the [Tūr] Mount, and We sent down to you manna and quails:

Name: Tâ Hâ
Verse: 'Eat of the good things We have provided you, but do not transgress regarding it, lest My wrath descend on you. And he on whom My wrath descends certainly perishes.

Name: Tâ Hâ
Verse: And indeed I am Forgiving toward him who repents, and believes, and acts righteously, and then follows guidance'.

Name: Tâ Hâ
Verse: 'And what has hurried you [to depart] from your people, O Moses?'

Name: Tâ Hâ
Verse: He said, 'They are close upon my track, and I hastened to You, my Lord, that You may be pleased'.

Name: Tâ Hâ
Verse: He said, 'Indeed We tried your people after you, and the Samaritan led them astray'.

Name: Tâ Hâ
Verse: Thereupon Moses returned to his people, angry and sad. He said, 'O my people, did not your Lord promise you a fair promise? Did the period seem too long for you, or did you desire that wrath should become incumbent against you from your Lord, and so you broke your tryst with me?'

Name: Tâ Hâ
Verse: They said, 'We did not break our tryst with you of our own accord, but we were laden with the burdens of the people's ornaments, and we cast them, and so did the Samaritan cast.

Name: Tâ Hâ
Verse: Then he produced for them a calf, a [mere] body with a low. And they said, 'This is your God and the God of Moses: so he forgot'.

Name: Tâ Hâ
Verse: Did they not see that it did not reciprocate their words, nor did it have any power over hurt for them or any benefit?

Name: Tâ Hâ
Verse: And Aaron had certainly said to them beforehand, 'O my people, you are only being tested thereby! But truly your Lord is the Compassionate One, so follow me and obey my command'.

Name: Tâ Hâ
Verse: They said, 'We will not cease to cling to it until Moses returns to us'.

Name: Tâ Hâ
Verse: He said, 'O Aaron, what held you back when you saw them going astray

Name: Tâ Hâ
Verse: that you did not follow me? Did you then disobey my command?'

Name: Tâ Hâ
Verse: He said, 'O son of my mother do not clutch my beard or my head! Indeed I feared that you would have said, "You have caused division among the Children of Israel and you did not wait for my word" '.

Name: Tâ Hâ
Verse: He said, 'And what have you to say, O Samaritan?'

Name: Tâ Hâ
Verse: He said, 'I perceived what they did not perceive, so I seized a handful from the track of the messenger and threw it [in]. Thus my soul prompted me'.

Name: Tâ Hâ
Verse: Said he, 'Begone! It shall be yours [as your lot] throughout life to say, "Do not touch [me]!" And indeed there will be a tryst for you, which you will not fail to keep. Now look at your god to whom you remained clinging! We will surely burn it and then scatter [the ashes of] it into the waters.

Name: Tâ Hâ
Verse: Indeed your God is the One God, than whom there is no other god. He embraces all things in [His] knowledge'.

Name: Tâ Hâ
Verse: Thus, We relate to you some stories of what is past, and We have given you from Ourselves a Reminder.

Name: Tâ Hâ
Verse: Whoever turns away from it, he shall indeed, on the Day of Resurrection, bear a burden,

Name: Tâ Hâ
Verse: therein abiding. And evil for them on the Day of Resurrection is that burden!

Name: Tâ Hâ
Verse: The day the Trumpet is blown, and We shall assemble the criminals on that day bruised.

Name: Tâ Hâ
Verse: They will whisper to one another: 'You have tarried only ten nights'.

Name: Tâ Hâ
Verse: We know very well what they will say, when the justest of them in the way will say, 'You have tarried only a day'.

Name: Tâ Hâ
Verse: They will question you concerning the mountains. Say: 'My Lord will scatter them as ashes,

Name: Tâ Hâ
Verse: then He will leave them a level hollow,

Name: Tâ Hâ
Verse: wherein you will see neither crookedness, nor any curving'.

Name: Tâ Hâ
Verse: On that day they will follow the Summoner - there will be no deviation therein. Voices will be hushed before the Compassionate One, so that you hear nothing but a faint shuffle.

Name: Tâ Hâ
Verse: On that day intercession will not profit except [intercession] from him whom the Compassionate One permits and whose word He approves.

Name: Tâ Hâ
Verse: He knows what is before them and behind them, and they do not comprehend such [things] in knowledge.

Name: Tâ Hâ
Verse: And faces shall be humbled before the Living, the Eternal Sustainer; and he will certainly have failed [he] who carries [the burden of] evildoing.

Name: Tâ Hâ
Verse: But whoever does righteous deeds, being a believer, shall fear neither wrong, nor injustice.

Name: Tâ Hâ
