Verse: And it was said to the people, 'Will you assemble!'

Name: The Poets
Verse: Maybe we will follow the sorcerers, should they be the victors'.

Name: The Poets
Verse: So when the sorcerers came, they said to Pharaoh, 'Shall we indeed have a reward if we were to be the victors?'

Name: The Poets
Verse: He said, 'Yes [of course]! And you shall then be among those closest [to me]'.

Name: The Poets
Verse: Moses said to them, 'Cast what you have to cast'.

Name: The Poets
Verse: So they cast their ropes and their staffs, and said, 'By the power of Pharaoh we shall surely be the victors!'

Name: The Poets
Verse: Thereat Moses cast his staff and lo! it was swallowing what they had faked.

Name: The Poets
Verse: So the sorcerers fell down prostrating.

Name: The Poets
Verse: They said, 'We believe in the Lord of the Worlds,

Name: The Poets
Verse: the Lord of Moses and Aaron'.

Name: The Poets
Verse: Pharaoh said, 'Do you believe him, though I have not given you leave? He is indeed your chief, the one who has taught you sorcery. Soon you will know I will assuredly cut off your hands and legs on opposite sides, then I shall surely crucify you all'.

Name: The Poets
Verse: They said, 'There is no harm [in that]. Surely to our Lord we shall return.

Name: The Poets
Verse: Indeed We hope our Lord will forgive us our iniquities, for being the first to believe'.

Name: The Poets
Verse: And We revealed to Moses, [saying], 'Journey with My servants by night, for indeed you will be pursued'.

Name: The Poets
Verse: Then Pharaoh sent to the cities musterers,

Name: The Poets
Verse: 'Lo! these are but a small gang.

Name: The Poets
Verse: And indeed they have enraged us,

Name: The Poets
Verse: and indeed we are all on our guard.

Name: The Poets
Verse: So We made them go forth from gardens, and springs,

Name: The Poets
Verse: and treasures, and splendid places.

Name: The Poets
Verse: So [it was], and We made the Children of Israel to inherit these.

Name: The Poets
Verse: Then they pursued them at sunrise.

Name: The Poets
Verse: And when the two hosts sighted each other, the companions of Moses said, 'We have been caught!'

Name: The Poets
Verse: He said, 'Certainly not! indeed I have my Lord with me. He will guide me'.

Name: The Poets
Verse: Thereupon We revealed to Moses: 'Strike the sea with your staff', whereupon it parted, and each part was as a mighty mountain.

Name: The Poets
Verse: And there We brought near the others.

Name: The Poets
Verse: And We delivered Moses and all those who were with him.

Name: The Poets
Verse: Then We drowned the others.

Name: The Poets
Verse: Surely in that there is a sign, but most of them are not believers.

Name: The Poets
Verse: And surely your Lord, He is the Mighty, the Merciful.

Name: The Poets
Verse: And recite to them the tiding of Abraham

Name: The Poets
Verse: when he said to his father and his people, 'What do you worship?'

Name: The Poets
Verse: They said, 'We worship idols and remain cleaving to them'.

Name: The Poets
Verse: He said, 'Do they hear you when you supplicate?

Name: The Poets
Verse: Or do they bring you benefit or harm?

Name: The Poets
Verse: They said, 'Rather, we found our fathers so doing'.

Name: The Poets
Verse: He said, 'Have you considered what you have been worshipping,

Name: The Poets
Verse: you and your ancestors?

Name: The Poets
Verse: They are indeed hateful to me, but the Lord of the Worlds,

Name: The Poets
Verse: and provides me with food and drink,

Name: The Poets
Verse: and when I am sick, it is He Who cures me;

Name: The Poets
Verse: and Who will make me die, then give me life,

Name: The Poets
Verse: and Who, I hope, will forgive me my iniquity on the Day of Judgement.

Name: The Poets
Verse: My Lord! Grant me [unerring] judgement and unite me with the righteous.

Name: The Poets
Verse: And confer on me a worthy repute among posterity.

Name: The Poets
Verse: And make me among the inheritors of the Garden of Bliss.

Name: The Poets
Verse: And forgive my father, for indeed he is one of those who are astray.

Name: The Poets
Verse: And do no disgrace me on the day when they are resurrected;

Name: The Poets
Verse: the day when neither wealth nor children will avail,

Name: The Poets
Verse: except him who comes to God with a heart that is sound.

Name: The Poets
Verse: And Paradise will be brought near for the God-fearing,

Name: The Poets
Verse: and Hell will be revealed [plainly] for the perverse.

Name: The Poets
Verse: And it will be said to them, 'Where is that which you used to worship

Name: The Poets
Verse: besides God? Do they help you, or do they help one another?'

Name: The Poets
Verse: Then they will be hurled into it, they and the perverse,

Name: The Poets
Verse: and the hosts of Iblīs, all together.

Name: The Poets
Verse: They shall say, as they wrangle therein,

Name: The Poets
Verse: 'By God, we had indeed been in manifest error,

Name: The Poets
Verse: when we equated you with the Lord of the Worlds.

Name: The Poets
Verse: And it was none other than the sinners that led us astray.

Name: The Poets
Verse: So [now] we have no intercessors,

Name: The Poets
Verse: nor any sympathetic friend.

Name: The Poets
Verse: If only we had another turn, we would have been among those who believe!'

Name: The Poets
Verse: Surely in that there is a sign; but most of them are not believers.

Name: The Poets
Verse: And truly your Lord, He is the Mighty, the Merciful.

Name: The Poets
Verse: The people of Noah denied the messengers,

Name: The Poets
Verse: when Noah, their brother said to them, 'Will you not fear [God]?

Name: The Poets
Verse: Truly I am a trusted messenger [sent] to you.

Name: The Poets
Verse: So fear God and obey me.

Name: The Poets
Verse: I do not ask of you any reward for it; for my reward lies only with the Lord of the Worlds.

Name: The Poets
Verse: So fear God and obey me'.

Name: The Poets
Verse: They said, 'Shall we believe in you, when it is the lowliest people who follow you?'

Name: The Poets
Verse: He said, 'And what do I know of what they may have been doing?

Name: The Poets
Verse: Their reckoning is only my Lord's concern, if only you were aware.

Name: The Poets
Verse: And I am not about to drive away the believers.

Name: The Poets
Verse: I am just a plain warner'.

Name: The Poets
Verse: They said, 'Lo! if you do not desist, O Noah, you will assuredly be among those assailed'.

Name: The Poets
Verse: He said, 'My Lord, my people have denied me,

Name: The Poets
Verse: so judge conclusively between me and them, and deliver me and the believers who are with me'.

Name: The Poets
Verse: So We delivered him and those who were with him in the laden ark.

Name: The Poets
Verse: Then afterwardsWe drowned the rest.

Name: The Poets
Verse: Surely in that there is a sign; but most of them are not believers.

Name: The Poets
Verse: Truly your Lord, He is the Mighty, the Merciful.

Name: The Poets
Verse: ‘ād denied the messengers,

Name: The Poets
Verse: when Hūd, their brother, said to them, ‘Will you not fear God?

Name: The Poets
Verse: Truly I am a trusted messenger [sent] to you.

Name: The Poets
Verse: So fear God and obey me.

Name: The Poets
Verse: I do not ask of you any reward for this; for my reward lies only with the Lord of the Worlds.

Name: The Poets
Verse: Do you build on every prominence a monument so that you may hurl abuse?

Name: The Poets
Verse: And you set up structures that perhaps you might last forever.

Name: The Poets
Verse: And when you assault, you assault like tyrants.

Name: The Poets
Verse: So fear God, and obey me.

Name: The Poets
Verse: And fear Him Who has provided you, in a way that you know,

Name: The Poets
Verse: provided you with cattle and sons,

Name: The Poets
Verse: and gardens, and springs.

Name: The Poets
Verse: Indeed I fear for you the chastisement of a tremendous day'.

Name: The Poets
Verse: They said, 'It is the same to us whether you admonish [us] or are not one of those who admonish.

Name: The Poets
Verse: This is merely the fabrication of the ancients,

Name: The Poets
Verse: and we will not be chastised'.

Name: The Poets
Verse: So they denied him, whereupon We destroyed them. Surely in that there is a sign; but most of them are not believers.

Name: The Poets
Verse: Truly your Lord, He is the Mighty, the Merciful.

Name: The Poets
Verse: Thamūd denied the messengers,

Name: The Poets
Verse: when Sālih, their brother, said to them, ‘Will you fear God?

Name: The Poets
Verse: Truly I am a trusted messenger [sent] to you.

Name: The Poets
Verse: So fear God and obey me.

Name: The Poets
Verse: I do not ask of you any reward for this; for my reward lies only with the Lord of the Worlds.

Name: The Poets
Verse: Will you be left secure in that which is here,

Name: The Poets
Verse: amid gardens and springs,

Name: The Poets
Verse: and farms and date palms with slender spathes?

Name: The Poets
Verse: And you hew dwellings out of the mountains arrogantly.

Name: The Poets
Verse: So fear God and obey me,

Name: The Poets
Verse: and do not obey the command of the prodigal,

Name: The Poets
Verse: who cause corruption in the earth, and act righteously'.

Name: The Poets
Verse: They said, 'You are indeed one of the bewitched.

Name: The Poets
Verse: And you are just a human being like us. So bring [us] a sign, if you are sincere'.

Name: The Poets
Verse: He said, 'This is a she-camel; she shall drink, and you shall drink [each] on a known day.

Name: The Poets
Verse: And do not cause her any harm, for then you shall be seized by the chastisement of an awful day'.

Name: The Poets
Verse: But they hamstrung her, and then became remorseful.

Name: The Poets
Verse: So they were seized by the chastisement. Surely in that there is a sign; but most of them are not believers.

Name: The Poets
Verse: Truly your Lord, He is the Mighty, the Merciful.

Name: The Poets
Verse: The people of Lot denied the messengers,

Name: The Poets
Verse: when Lot, their brother, said to them, 'Will you not fear God?

Name: The Poets
Verse: Truly I am a trusted messenger [sent] to you.

Name: The Poets
Verse: So fear God and obey me.

Name: The Poets
Verse: I do not ask of you any reward for this; my reward lies only with the Lord of the Worlds.

Name: The Poets
Verse: What! Of all people you come unto males [to fornicate],

Name: The Poets
Verse: and forsake the wives your Lord has created for you? Nay, but you are a transgressing folk'.

Name: The Poets
Verse: They said, 'If you do not desist, O Lot, you will assuredly be of those expelled'.

Name: The Poets
Verse: He, said, 'Truly I abhor what you do.

Name: The Poets
Verse: My Lord, deliver me and my family from what they do'.

Name: The Poets
Verse: So We delivered him and all his family,

Name: The Poets
Verse: except an old woman among those who stayed behind.

Name: The Poets
Verse: Then We destroyed [all] the others,

Name: The Poets
Verse: and We rained on them a rain, and evil was the rain of those who were warned!

Name: The Poets
Verse: Surely in that there is a sign; but most of them are not believers.

Name: The Poets
Verse: Surely your Lord, He is the Mighty, the Merciful.

Name: The Poets
Verse: The dwellers in the wood denied the messengers,

Name: The Poets
Verse: when Shu‘ayb said to them, ‘Will you not fear God?

Name: The Poets
Verse: Truly I am a trusted messenger [sent] to you.

Name: The Poets
Verse: So fear God and obey me.

Name: The Poets
Verse: I do not ask of you any reward for this; indeed my reward lies only with the Lord of the Worlds.

Name: The Poets
Verse: Give full measure and do not be of those who give short measure,

Name: The Poets
Verse: and weigh with an even balance,

Name: The Poets
Verse: and do not defraud people in their goods, and do not be degenerate in the earth, seeking corruption.

Name: The Poets
Verse: And fear Him Who created you and the former generations'.

Name: The Poets
Verse: They said, 'You are indeed one of the bewitched.

Name: The Poets
Verse: You are just a human being like us. And we indeed think that you are one of the liars.

Name: The Poets
Verse: Then make fragments of the heaven fall upon us, if you are of the truthful'.

Name: The Poets
Verse: He said, 'My Lord knows best what you are doing'.

Name: The Poets
Verse: But they denied him, so they were seized by the chastisement of the day of the shade. Assuredly it was the chastisement of a tremendous day.

Name: The Poets
Verse: Surely in that there is a sign; but most of them are not believers.

Name: The Poets
Verse: Surely your Lord, He is the Mighty, the Merciful.

Name: The Poets
Verse: Truly it is the revelation of the Lord of the Worlds,

Name: The Poets
Verse: brought down by the Trustworthy Spirit,

Name: The Poets
Verse: upon your heart, that you may be [one] of the warners,

Name: The Poets
Verse: in a clear Arabic tongue.

Name: The Poets
Verse: And truly it is in the Scriptures of the ancients.

Name: The Poets
Verse: Is it not a sign for them that the learned of the Children of Israel recognise it?

Name: The Poets
Verse: For had We revealed it to some non-Arabs,

Name: The Poets
Verse: and had he recited it to them, they would not have believed in it.

Name: The Poets
Verse: So We have caused it to penetrate the hearts of the criminals.

Name: The Poets
Verse: They will not believe in it until they behold the painful chastisement,

Name: The Poets
Verse: so that it will come upon them suddenly while they are not aware.

Name: The Poets
Verse: Thereupon they will say, 'Shall we be granted any respite?'

Name: The Poets
Verse: So do they [seek to] hasten Our chastisement?

Name: The Poets
Verse: Consider [this] then: If We were to let them enjoy [life] for [many] years,

Name: The Poets
Verse: then there were to come on them that which they have been promised,

Name: The Poets
Verse: in what way would that enjoyment which they were given avail them?

Name: The Poets
Verse: And We have not destroyed any town but it had warners,

Name: The Poets
Verse: as a reminder, for We were never unjust.

Name: The Poets
Verse: It has not been brought down by the devils.

Name: The Poets
Verse: Neither would it behove them, nor are they capable.

Name: The Poets
Verse: Truly they are barred from the hearing.

Name: The Poets
Verse: So do not invoke any other god with God, lest you be among the chastised.

Name: The Poets
Verse: And warn the nearest of your kinsfolk.

Name: The Poets
Verse: And lower your wing to the believers who follow you.

Name: The Poets
Verse: But if they disobey you, say, 'I am absolved of what you do'.

Name: The Poets
Verse: And put your trust in the Mighty, the Merciful,

Name: The Poets
Verse: Who sees you when you stand,

Name: The Poets
Verse: and your movements among those who prostrate.

Name: The Poets
Verse: Shall I inform you upon whom the devils descend?

Name: The Poets
Verse: They descend upon every sinful liar.

Name: The Poets
Verse: They report the heard [sayings], but most of them are liars.

Name: The Poets
Verse: As for the poets, [only] the perverse follow them.

Name: The Poets
Verse: Have you not noticed that in every valley they rove

Name: The Poets
Verse: and that they say what they do not do?

Name: The Poets
Verse: Save those who believe and perform righteous deeds and remember God frequently and vindicate themselves after they have been wronged, and those who are wrongdoers will soon know the reversal with which they will meet.

Name: The Ant
Verse: Tā sīn. Those are the signs of the Qur’ān and a Manifest Book,

Name: The Ant
Verse: a guidance, and good tidings for the believers.

Name: The Ant
Verse: Those who observe prayer and give alms and who are certain of the Hereafter.

Name: The Ant
Verse: Truly those who do not believe in the Hereafter, We have adorned their deeds for them, and so they are bewildered.

Name: The Ant
Verse: Those are they for whom there is an awful chastisement; and in the Hereafter they will be the greatest losers.

Name: The Ant
Verse: And truly you are receiving the Qur’ān, from One Wise, Knowing.

Name: The Ant
Verse: When Moses said to his family, 'Assuredly I notice a fire. I will bring you news from there, or bring you a firebrand that perhaps you might warm yourselves'.

Name: The Ant
Verse: But when he reached it, he was called [with the following words]: 'Blessed is he, who is in the fire, and who is around it, and Glory be to God, the Lord of the Worlds.

Name: The Ant
Verse: O Moses, lo! it is I, God, the Mighty, the Wise.

Name: The Ant
Verse: Throw down your staff'. And when he saw it wriggling like a serpent, he turned his back in flight and did not come back. 'O Moses, do not fear. Surely in My presence the messengers do not fear,

Name: The Ant
Verse: except him who has done wrong, but then changed [his wrong] for good after [having done] evil, then truly I am Forgiving, Merciful.

Name: The Ant
Verse: And insert your hand into your bosom, and it will emerge white without any blemish. [This will be one] among nine signs to Pharaoh and his folk; indeed they are an immoral lot'.

Name: The Ant
Verse: But when Our signs came to them plain to see, they said, 'This is manifest sorcery'.

Name: The Ant
Verse: And they denied them, though their souls had been convinced wrongfully and arrogantly. So behold, how was the sequel for the agents of corruption.

Name: The Ant
Verse: And verily We gave David and Solomon knowledge, and they said, 'Praise be to God Who has favoured us over many of His believing servants'.

Name: The Ant
Verse: And Solomon inherited from David, and he said, 'O people, we have been taught the speech of the birds, and we have been given of all things. Indeed this is the manifest favour'.

Name: The Ant
Verse: And Solomon's hosts of jinn and humans and birds stood assembled for him as they were being arrayed.

Name: The Ant
Verse: When they came to the Valley of the Ants, an ant said, 'O ants, enter your dwellings, lest Solomon and his hosts crush you while they are unaware!'

Name: The Ant
Verse: Whereat he smiled, amused at its words. And he said, ‘My Lord, inspire me to be thankful for Your grace with which You have favoured me and my parents, and to do good that will please You, and include me, by Your mercy, among Your righteous servants’.

Name: The Ant
Verse: And he reviewed the birds, then he said, 'Why is it that I do not see the hoopoe? Or is he among the absent?

Name: The Ant
Verse: 'Assuredly I will chastise him with a severe chastisement, or I will slaughter him, unless he brings me a clear warrant'.

Name: The Ant
Verse: But he did not remain long [in absence], and he said, 'I have discovered something of which you have no knowledge, and I have brought you from Sheba a verified report.

Name: The Ant
Verse: I found a woman ruling over them, and she has been given [an abundance] of all things, and she possesses a great throne.

Name: The Ant
Verse: I found her and her people prostrating to the sun instead of God, and Satan has adorned for them their deeds and he has barred them from the Way, so that they are not guided

Name: The Ant
Verse: to prostrate themselves to God; [He] Who brings forth the hidden in the heavens and the earth, and He knows what they conceal and what they proclaim.

Name: The Ant
Verse: God - there is no god except Him, the Lord of the Mighty Throne'.

Name: The Ant
Verse: He said, 'We shall see whether you have spoken the truth, or whether you are of the liars.

Name: The Ant
Verse: Take this letter of mine and deliver it to them, then turn away from them and see what [response] they shall return'.

Name: The Ant
Verse: She said, 'O [members of the] council, lo! a noble letter has been delivered to me.

Name: The Ant
Verse: It is from Solomon and lo! it is: "In the Name of God, the Compassionate, the Merciful.

Name: The Ant
Verse: Do not rise up against me [in defiance], but come to me in submission"'.

Name: The Ant
Verse: She said, 'O [members of the] council, give me an opinion in this matter of mine. I never decide on a matter until you are present'.

Name: The Ant
Verse: They said, 'We possess force and we possess great might. The matter is for you [to decide]. So see what you will command'.

Name: The Ant
Verse: She said, 'Indeed kings, when they enter a town, ruin it, and reduce the mightiest of its inhabitants to the most abased. That is what they too will do.

Name: The Ant
Verse: Now I will send them a gift and wait to see with what [response] the envoys return'.

Name: The Ant
Verse: But when he came to Solomon, he said, 'Are you supplying me with wealth? What God has given me is better than what He has given you. Nay, but it is you [and not I] who exult in your gift.

Name: The Ant
Verse: Go back to them, for We shall assuredly come to them with hosts which they will not be able to face and we shall expel them from there humiliated, and they shall be utterly abased'.

Name: The Ant
Verse: He said, 'O [members of the] council, which of you will bring me her throne before they come to me in submission?'

Name: The Ant
Verse: An afreet from among the jinn said, 'I will bring it to you before you rise from your place. Indeed I have the strength for it and I am trustworthy'.

Name: The Ant
Verse: The one who had knowledge of the Scripture said: 'I will bring it to you before your glance returns to you. Then, when he saw it standing before him, he said, 'This is of my Lord's bounty, that He may try me, whether I give thanks or am ungrateful. And whoever gives thanks, gives thanks only for his own sake, and whoever is ungrateful, [should know] then my Lord is surely Independent, Generous'.

Name: The Ant
Verse: He said, 'Disguise her throne for her that we may see whether she will be guided, or be of those who cannot be guided'.

Name: The Ant
Verse: So when she came, it was said, 'Is your throne like this?' She said, 'It as though it is the one'. 'And we were given the knowledge before her and we had submitted [to God].

Name: The Ant
Verse: And what she worshipped besides God barred her, for she belonged to disbelieving folk'.

Name: The Ant
Verse: It was said to her, 'Enter the palace [hallway]'. And when she saw it, she supposed it to be a pool, and so she bared her legs. He said, 'It is a hallway paved [smooth] with crystal'. She said, 'My Lord, indeed I have wronged myself, and I submit with Solomon to God, the Lord of the Worlds'.

Name: The Ant
Verse: And verily We sent to Thamūd their brother Sālih: ‘Worship God!’ And lo! they [then] became two parties quarrelling with one another.

Name: The Ant
Verse: He said, 'O my people, why do you [seek to] hasten on evil before [seeking] good? Why do you not ask God to forgive you, so that you might be shown mercy?'

Name: The Ant
Verse: They said, 'We augur evil of you and of those who are with you'. He said, 'Your evil augury is with God; nay, but you are a people being tried'.

Name: The Ant
Verse: And there were in the city a band of nine men, who were causing corruption in the land and did not reform [their ways].

Name: The Ant
Verse: They said, 'Swear to one another by God that we will attack him by night together with his folk. Then we will surely say to his heir that we did not witness the destruction of his folk and [that] indeed we are being truthful'.

Name: The Ant
Verse: So they plotted a plot, but We [also] plotted a plot, while they were not aware.

Name: The Ant
Verse: So behold how was the consequence of their plot! For lo! We destroyed them and all their people.

Name: The Ant
Verse: So those then are their houses [lying] deserted because of the evil which they did. Surely in that there is a sign for a people who have knowledge.

Name: The Ant
Verse: And We delivered those who believed and were fearful.

Name: The Ant
Verse: And Lot, when he said to his people, 'What! Do you commit [such] abomination while you watch?

Name: The Ant
Verse: What! Do you come unto men in lust instead of women? Nay, but you are truly a people in ignorance'.

Name: The Ant
Verse: But the only response of his people was that they said, 'Expel Lot's family from your town. They are indeed a folk who [prefer to] remain pure!'

Name: The Ant
Verse: So We delivered him and his family, except his wife - We decreed [for] her to be of those who remained behind.

Name: The Ant
Verse: Then We rained on them a rain. And evil indeed was the rain of those who were warned.

Name: The Ant
Verse: Say [O Muhammad]: ‘Praise be to God and peace be on His servants whom He has chosen’. Is God better, or the partners which they ascribe?

Name: The Ant
Verse: Or He Who created the heavens and the earth, and sends down for you water from the heaven, whereby We cause to grow splendid gardens whose trees you could never cause to grow? Is there a god with God? Nay, but they are a people who ascribe equals [to Him].

Name: The Ant
Verse: Or He Who made the earth an abode [of stability] and made rivers [to flow] throughout it and set firm mountains for it, and set an isthmus between the two seas. Is there a god with God? Nay, but most of them have no knowledge.

Name: The Ant
Verse: Or He Who answers the desperate one when he calls to Him and Who removes [his] distress and makes you successors in the earth. Is there a god with God? Little do you remember.

Name: The Ant
Verse: Or He Who guides you in the darkness of the land and the sea and Who sends forth the winds as harbingers of His mercy. Is there a god with God? Exalted be God [high] above what they associate [with Him].

Name: The Ant
Verse: Or He Who originates creation then brings it back again, and Who provides for you from the heaven and [from] the earth. Is there a god with God? Say: 'Produce your proof if you are truthful'.

Name: The Ant
Verse: Say: 'No one in the heavens or the earth knows the Unseen, except God, and they are not aware when they will be resurrected.

Name: The Ant
Verse: Nay, has their knowledge come to comprise the Hereafter? Nay, for they are in doubt of it. Rather they are blind to it.

Name: The Ant
Verse: And the disbelievers say: 'What! When we and our fathers are dust shall we indeed be brought forth [again]?

Name: The Ant
Verse: Already we and our fathers have been promised this before. [But] these are just the [legendary] fables of the ancients'.

Name: The Ant
Verse: Say: 'Travel in the land and see how was the sequel for the criminals'.

Name: The Ant
Verse: And do not grieve for them, and do not be distressed by their schemes.

Name: The Ant
Verse: And they say, 'When will this promise be, if you are truthful?'

Name: The Ant
Verse: Say: 'It may be that part of what you seek to hasten on is close behind you'.

Name: The Ant
Verse: And surely your Lord is bountiful to mankind, but most of them are not thankful.

Name: The Ant
Verse: And surely your Lord knows what their hearts conceal and what they proclaim.

Name: The Ant
Verse: And there is not a thing hidden in the heaven and the earth but it is in a manifest Book.

Name: The Ant
Verse: Truly this Qur’ān recounts to the Children of Israel [the means to resolve] most of that concerning which they differ.

Name: The Ant
Verse: And truly it is a guidance and a mercy for believers.

Name: The Ant
Verse: Surely your Lord will decide between them of His judgement. And He is the Mighty, the Knower.

Name: The Ant
Verse: So rely on God, for you are indeed upon the manifest truth.

Name: The Ant
Verse: Indeed you cannot make the dead hear, nor can you make the deaf hear the call when they have turned their backs [upon you];

Name: The Ant
Verse: nor can you lead the blind out of their error. You can only make those hear who believe in Our signs and have therefore submitted.

Name: The Ant
Verse: And when the word [of judgement] falls upon them, We shall bring forth for them a beast from the earth which shall speak to them [saying]: 'Indeed mankind had no faith in Our signs'.

Name: The Ant
Verse: And the day when We shall gather from every community a group of those who denied Our signs, and they will be set in array,

Name: The Ant
Verse: until, when they arrive, He shall say, 'Did you deny, My signs without comprehending them in knowledge, or what was it that you did?

Name: The Ant
Verse: And the word [of judgement] shall fall upon them because of the evil they committed, and they will not speak.

Name: The Ant
Verse: Do they not see that We made the night that they may rest in it, and the day for sight? Surely in that there are signs for a people who believe.

Name: The Ant
Verse: And the day when the Trumpet will be blown, and whoever is in the heavens and the earth will be terrified, except whom God will. And all will come to Him in [utter] humility.

Name: The Ant
Verse: And you see the mountains, supposing them to be still, while they drift like passing clouds. The handiwork of God Who has perfected everything. Truly He is aware of what you do.

Name: The Ant
Verse: Whoever brings a good deed, shall have good for it; and they shall be secure from the terror of that day.

Name: The Ant
Verse: And whoever brings an evil deed, their faces shall be thrust into the Fire: 'Are you requited except for what you used to do?'

Name: The Ant
Verse: I have been commanded only to worship the Lord of this land which He has made inviolable, and to Whom all things belong. And I have been commanded to be of those who submit,

Name: The Ant
Verse: and to recite the Qur’ān. So whoever is guided, is guided only for his own sake; and whoever goes astray, say: ‘I am just one of the warners’.

Name: The Ant
Verse: And say: 'Praise be to God. He will show you His signs and you will recognise them. And your Lord is not oblivious of what they do'.

Name: The Story
Verse: Tā sīn mīm

Name: The Story
Verse: Those are the signs of the Manifest Book.

Name: The Story
Verse: We will recount to you [something] of the tale of Moses and Pharaoh truthfully, for a people who believe.

Name: The Story
Verse: Truly Pharaoh had exalted himself in the land and reduced its people into sects, oppressing a group of them, slaughtering their sons, and sparing their women. Indeed he was of those who cause corruption.

Name: The Story
Verse: And We desired to show favour to those who were oppressed in the land, and to make them exemplars, and to make them the inheritors,

Name: The Story
Verse: and to establish them in the land, and to show Pharaoh and Hāmān and their hosts from them that of which they were apprehensive..

Name: The Story
Verse: And We revealed to the mother of Moses: ‘Suckle him, then, when you fear for him, cast him into the waters, and do not fear or grieve, for We will restore him to you and make him one of the messengers’.

Name: The Story
Verse: Then Pharaoh’s folk picked him up to be an enemy and a [cause of] grief to them. Truly Pharaoh and Hāmān, and their hosts were sinners.

Name: The Story
Verse: And Pharaoh’s wife said, ‘A joyous sight for me and you. Do not slay him. Perhaps he will be of benefit to us, or we will adopt him as a son’. And they were not aware.

Name: The Story
Verse: And the heart of Moses’s mother became empty. Indeed she was about to expose him had We not fortified her heart that she might be of the believers.

Name: The Story
Verse: And she said to his sister, ‘Follow him’. So she watched him from afar, while they were not aware.

Name: The Story
Verse: And We had forbidden him to [take to the breasts of] fostermothers from before. So she said, ‘Shall I show you a household who will take care of him for you and who will act in good faith towards him?’

Name: The Story
Verse: Thus We restored him to his mother so that her eyes might delight and not grieve, and that she might know that God’s promise is true; but most of them do not know.

Name: The Story
Verse: And when he came of age and [then] was [fully] mature, We gave him judgement and knowledge. And so do We reward those are virtuous.

Name: The Story
Verse: And he entered the city at a time when its people were oblivious, and found therein two men fighting, one of his own faction, and the other of his enemies. So the one who was of his faction called to him for help against the one who was of his enemies. So Moses punched him and did away with him. He said, ‘This is of Satan’s doing. Indeed he is an enemy, a manifest misleader’.

Name: The Story
Verse: He said, ‘My Lord, I have indeed wronged myself, so forgive me!’ So He forgave him. Truly He is the Forgiving, the Merciful.

Name: The Story
Verse: He said, ‘My Lord, forasmuch as You have been gracious to me, I will never be a partisan of the criminals’.

Name: The Story
Verse: In the morning he was in the city, fearful, vigilant, when behold, the one who had sought his help the day before cried out to him for help [again]. Moses said to him, ‘Clearly you are a trouble-maker!’

Name: The Story
Verse: But when he was about to strike the man who was an enemy to both of them, he said, ‘O Moses, do you want to slay me just as you slew a soul yesterday? You merely want to be a tyrant in the land, and you do not want to be of the reformers’.

Name: The Story
Verse: And a man came from the outskirts of the city, hastening. He said, ‘O Moses, lo! the council are conspiring to slay you. So leave. Truly I am speaking to you in good faith’.

Name: The Story
Verse: So he departed from it, fearful, vigilant. He said, ‘My Lord, deliver me from the evildoing people’.

Name: The Story
Verse: And when he turned his face towards Midian, he said, ‘Perhaps my Lord will show me the right way’.

Name: The Story
Verse: And when he arrived at the Water of Midian, he found a group of people there watering, and he found, besides them, two women holding back their flock. He said, ‘What is your business?’ They said, ‘We do not water [our flock] until the shepherds have moved on and our father is a very old man’.

Name: The Story
Verse: So he watered [their flock] for them, then he retreated to the shade and said, ‘My Lord, indeed I am in utter need of whatever good You send down to me’.

Name: The Story
Verse: Then one of the two women came to him, walking bashfully and said, ‘My father invites you, that he may pay you a wage for watering [our flock] for us’. So when he came to him and recounted to him the story, he [their father] said, ‘Do not be afraid. You have escaped from the evildoing people’.

Name: The Story
Verse: One of the two women said, ‘O my father, hire him. Surely the best [man] you can hire is the strong, the trustworthy man’.

Name: The Story
Verse: He said, ‘I desire to marry you to one of these two daughters of mine, on condition that you hire yourself to me for eight years. And if you complete ten, that shall be of your own accord. I do not want to be hard on you. God willing you shall find me to be one of the righteous’.

Name: The Story
Verse: He said, ‘That is [settled then] between me and you. Whichever of the two terms I complete, there shall be no injustice [done] to me. And God is Guardian over what we say’.

Name: The Story
Verse: So when Moses had completed the term and was travelling with his family, he saw in the distance on the side of the Mount [Tūr] a fire. He said to his family, ‘Wait, I see a fire in the distance. Maybe I will bring you from it news or a brand from the fire, that you may warm yourselves’.

Name: The Story
Verse: And when he reached it, a call came from the right bank of the valley at the blessed spot from the tree, [saying] that ‘O Moses! Indeed I am God, the Lord of the Worlds’.

Name: The Story
Verse: And: ‘Throw down your staff’. And when he saw it quivering, as if it were a serpent he turned his back, and did not look back: ‘O Moses! Come forward, and do not be afraid. Indeed you are safe.

Name: The Story
Verse: Insert your hand into your bosom and it will emerge, white, without any blemish; and draw your arm [back] to your side [as a precaution] against fear. These then shall be two proofs from your Lord to Pharaoh and his council; for surely they are an immoral people’.

Name: The Story
Verse: He said, ‘My Lord, I have indeed slain a soul among them and so I fear that they will slay me.

Name: The Story
Verse: And my brother Aaron is more eloquent than me in speech. So send him with me as a helper to confirm me, for I truly fear that they will deny me’.

Name: The Story
Verse: He said, ‘We will strengthen your arm by means of your brother, and We will give authority so that they will not be able to touch [either of] you with Our signs the two of you, and those who follow you [two], will be the victors’.

Name: The Story
Verse: But when Moses brought them Our clear signs they said, ‘This is nothing but concocted sorcery. And we never heard of such [a thing] among our forefathers’.

Name: The Story
Verse: And Moses said, ‘My Lord knows best who brings guidance from Him and whose will be the sequel of the [Blissful] Abode. Truly the evildoers will not be successful’.

Name: The Story
Verse: And Pharaoh said, ‘O [members of the] council, I do not know of any god for you other than me. So kindle for me, O Hāmān, [a fire] over the clay, and make me a tower that I may take a look at the god of Moses; for truly I consider him to be a liar’.

Name: The Story
Verse: And he and his hosts acted arrogantly in the land without right, and thought they would not return to Us.

Name: The Story
Verse: So We seized him and his hosts, and flung them into the waters. So behold how was the sequel for the evildoers.

Name: The Story
Verse: And We made them leaders who invite to the Fire, and on the Day of Resurrection they will not be helped.

Name: The Story
Verse: And We made a curse pursue them in this world, and on the Day of Resurrection they will be among the spurned.

Name: The Story
Verse: And verily We gave Moses the Scripture after We had destroyed the former generations, [containing] eye-openers for mankind, and as guidance, and mercy, that perhaps they might remember.

Name: The Story
Verse: And you were not on the western side when We decreed to Moses the commandment, nor were you among the witnesses,

Name: The Story
Verse: but We brought forth generations, and life was prolonged in their case. And you were not a dweller among the people of Midian reciting to them Our revelations; but truly We are the senders.

Name: The Story
Verse: And you were not on the side of the Mount when We called out, but as a mercy from your Lord, that you may warn a people to whom no warner came before you and that perhaps they may remember.

Name: The Story
Verse: Otherwise, if an affliction should befall them because of what their own hands have sent before them, they might say, ‘Our Lord, why did You not send a messenger to us, that we might have followed Your signs and been of the believers?’

Name: The Story
Verse: But when the truth came to them from Us, they said, ‘Why has he not been given the like of what Moses was given?’ And did they not disbelieve in what was given to Moses before? They said: ‘Two sorcerers abetting each other’. And they said, ‘We indeed disbelieve in both’.

Name: The Story
Verse: Say: ‘Then bring some Scripture from God that is better in guidance than these two, that I may follow it, if you are truthful’.

Name: The Story
Verse: Then if they do not respond to you, know that they are only following their desires. And who is more astray than he who follows his desire without any guidance from God? Truly God does not guide the evildoing folk.

Name: The Story
Verse: And now verily We have brought them the Word, that perhaps they might remember.

Name: The Story
Verse: Those to whom We gave the Scripture before this, they believe in it.

Name: The Story
Verse: And, when it is recited to them, they say, ‘We believe in it. It is indeed the Truth from our Lord. Lo! [even] before it we had submitted’.

Name: The Story
Verse: Those will be given their reward twice over for the patience they showed, and they ward off evil with good, and expend of that which We have provided them.

Name: The Story
Verse: And when they hear vanity, they disregard it and say, ‘To us [belong] our deeds and to you [belong] your deeds. Peace to you. We do not desire [friendship with] the ignorant’.

Name: The Story
Verse: You cannot guide whom you like, but [it is] God [Who] guides whomever He will, and He knows best those who will be guided.

Name: The Story
Verse: And they say, ‘If we were to follow the Guidance with you, we will be deprived from our land’. Have We not established for them a secure Sanctuary to which are brought fruits of all kinds as a provision from Us? But most of them do not know.

Name: The Story
Verse: And how many a town We have destroyed whose lifestyle was one of arrogant ungratefulness. Those are their dwellings, which have not been dwelt in after them except a little. And it was We Who were the [sole] inheritors.

Name: The Story
Verse: And your Lord never destroyed the towns until He had raised up in their mother-town a messenger to recite Our signs to them. And We never destroyed the towns unless their inhabitants were committing evil.

Name: The Story
Verse: And whatever things you have been given are [only] the [short-lived] enjoyment of the life of this world and an ornament thereof; and what is with God is better and more lasting. Will you not understand?

Name: The Story
Verse: Is he to whom We have given a fair promise, which he will receive, like him to whom We have given the enjoyment of the life of this world, then on the Day of Resurrection he will be of those arraigned?

Name: The Story
Verse: And on the day when He will call to them and say, ‘Where [then] are My partners, those whom you used to claim?’

Name: The Story
Verse: Those against whom the Word [of punishment] will have become due, shall say, ‘Our Lord! These are the ones whom we led astray. We led them astray, even as we went astray. We declare our innocence before You; it was not us that they worshipped’.

Name: The Story
Verse: And it shall be said, ‘Call [now] to your associates!’ So they will call to them, but they will not answer them, and they will see the chastisement: [they will wish] if only they had been guided!

Name: The Story
Verse: And on the day when He will call to them and say, ‘What response did you give to those [messengers] who were sent?’

Name: The Story
Verse: The tidings will be obscured to them on that day so they will not question one other.

Name: The Story
Verse: But as for him who repents, and believes, and acts righteously, maybe he will be among the successful.

Name: The Story
Verse: And your Lord creates whatever He will and chooses. They, the idolaters, do not have the choice. Glory be to God and exalted be He above what they associate with Him.

Name: The Story
Verse: And your Lord knows what their breasts conceal and what they proclaim.

Name: The Story
Verse: And He is God; there is no god except Him. To Him belongs [all] praise in the former and in the latter. And to Him belongs the judgement, and to Him you will be returned.

Name: The Story
Verse: Say: ‘Have you considered if God were to make the night everlasting over you until the Day of Resurrection, what god other than God could bring you light? Will you not then listen?’

Name: The Story
Verse: Say: ‘Have you considered, if God were to make the day everlasting over you until the Day of Resurrection, what god other than God could bring you night wherein you rest? Will you not then see?

Name: The Story
Verse: And of His mercy He has made for you night and day, that you may rest therein, and that you may seek of His bounty that perhaps you might give thanks’.

Name: The Story
Verse: And on the day when He will call to them and say, ‘Where [now] are My associates those whom you used to claim?’

Name: The Story
Verse: And We shall draw from every community a witness, and We shall say, ‘Produce your evidence’. Then they will know that the right is God’s. And that which they used to invent will fail them.

Name: The Story
Verse: Indeed Korah belonged to the people of Moses but he became insolent towards them. For We had given him so many treasures that [the number of] their keys would verily have burdened a group of strong men. When his people said to him, ‘Do not be exultant; truly God does not love the exultant,

Name: The Story
Verse: but seek, in that which God has given you, the Abode of the Hereafter, and do not forget your share of this world, and be good just as God has been good to you. And do not seek to cause corruption in the earth. Surely God does not love the agents of corruption’.

Name: The Story
Verse: He said, ‘In fact I have been given it because of knowledge I possess’. Does he not know that God had already destroyed before him generations of men stronger than him in might and greater in the amassing? The guilty will not be questioned about their sins.

Name: The Story
Verse: So he emerged before his people in his finery. Those who desired the life of this world said, ‘O would that we had the like of what Korah has been given. Truly he enjoys great fortune.

Name: The Story
Verse: But those to whom knowledge had been given said: ‘Woe to you! God’s reward, is better for him who believes and acts righteously; and none will obtain it, except those who are steadfast’.

Name: The Story
Verse: So We caused the earth to swallow him and his dwelling, and he had no host to help him besides God, nor was he of those who can rescue themselves.

Name: The Story
Verse: And those who had longed to be in his place the day before were saying, ‘Alas! God expands provision for whomever He will of His servants and straitens [it]. Had God not been gracious to us, He would have made us to be swallowed too. Lo! indeed those who are ungrateful never prosper.

Name: The Story
Verse: That is the Abode of the Hereafter which We shall grant to those who do not desire to be haughty in the earth, nor [to cause] corruption. And the sequel will be for those who fear.

Name: The Story
Verse: Whoever brings a good deed shall have better than it; while whoever brings an evil deed, those who commit evil deeds shall only be requited for what they used to do.

Name: The Story
Verse: Indeed He Who has prescribed for you the Qur’ān will surely restore you to a place of return. Say: ‘My Lord knows best him who brings guidance and him who is in manifest error’.

Name: The Story
Verse: And you never expected that the Scripture would be conferred on you; but it was as a mercy from your Lord. So never be a supporter of the disbelievers.

Name: The Story
Verse: And never let them bar you from God’s signs after they have been revealed to you, and summon to your Lord, and never be of the idolaters.

Name: The Story
Verse: And do not call on another god with God; there is no god except Him. Everything will perish except His Countenance. His is the judgement and to Him you will be brought back.

Name: The Spider
Verse: Alif lām mīm.

Name: The Spider
Verse: Do people suppose that they will be left to say, ‘We believe’, and they will not be tried?

Name: The Spider
Verse: And certainly We tried those who were before them. So God shall surely know those who are sincere, and He shall surely know those who are liars.

Name: The Spider
Verse: Or do those who commit evil deeds suppose that they can elude Us? Evil is that which they judge!

Name: The Spider
Verse: Whoever expects to encounter God, [should know that] God’s [appointed] term will indeed come. And He is the Hearer, the Knower.

Name: The Spider
Verse: And whoever struggles, struggles only for his own sake. For truly God is Independent of [the creatures of] all the Worlds.

Name: The Spider
Verse: And those who believe and perform righteous deeds, We will surely absolve them of their misdeeds, and We will indeed requite them with the best of what they used to do.

Name: The Spider
Verse: And We have enjoined on man kindness to his parents, but if they urge you to ascribe to Me as partner that of which you do not have any knowledge, then do not obey them. To Me will be your return whereat I will inform you of what you used to do.

Name: The Spider
Verse: And those who believe and perform righteous deeds, assuredly We shall admit them among the righteous.

Name: The Spider
Verse: And among people there are those who say, ‘We believe in God’, but if such [a person] suffers hurt in God’s cause, he takes people’s persecution to be [the same] as God’s chastisement. Yet if there comes help from your Lord, they will assuredly say, ‘We were indeed with you’. Does God not know best what is in the breasts of all creatures?

Name: The Spider
Verse: And God shall surely ascertain those who believe, and He shall surely ascertain the hypocrites.

Name: The Spider
Verse: And those who disbelieve say to those who believe, ‘Follow our path and we will bear [responsibility for] your sins’. But they will not [be able to] bear anything of their sins. Truly they are liars.

Name: The Spider
Verse: And they shall certainly bear their [own] burdens and other burdens along with their [own] burdens, and on the Day of Resurrection they shall surely be questioned concerning what they used to invent.

Name: The Spider
Verse: And verily We sent Noah to his people and he remained among them a thousand-less-fifty years; so the Flood engulfed them, for they were wrongdoers.

Name: The Spider
Verse: Then We delivered him and the occupants of the ship, and We made this a sign for all peoples.

Name: The Spider
Verse: And Abraham, when he said to his people, ‘Worship God and fear Him; that is better for you, if you only knew.

Name: The Spider
Verse: What you worship besides God are only graven images and you fabricate a calumny. Truly those whom you worship besides God have no power to provide for you. So seek your provision from God, and worship Him, and be thankful to Him; to Him you shall be returned.

Name: The Spider
Verse: But if you deny, then [many] communities have denied before you; and the messenger’s duty is only to communicate [the Message] clearly’.

Name: The Spider
Verse: Have they not seen how God originates creation, then restores it? Surely that is easy for God.

Name: The Spider
Verse: Say: ‘Travel in the land and observe how He originated creation. Then God shall bring about the other genesis. Truly God has power over all things.

Name: The Spider
Verse: He chastises whomever He will, and has mercy on whomever He will, and to Him you shall be returned.

Name: The Spider
Verse: And you will never be able to thwart [Him] on earth, or in the heaven; and you do not have besides God any guardian, or any helper.

Name: The Spider
Verse: And those who disbelieve in God’s signs and the encounter with Him, they have despaired of My mercy, and for those there shall be a painful chastisement.

Name: The Spider
Verse: But the only answer of his people was that they said, ‘Slay him, or burn him!’ Then God delivered him from the fire. Surely in that there are signs for a people who believe.

Name: The Spider
Verse: And he said: ‘You have adopted mere idols besides God for the sake of [mutual] affection between you in the life of this world. Then on the Day of Resurrection you will disown one another, and you will curse one another, and your abode will be the Fire, and you will have no helpers’.

Name: The Spider
Verse: And Lot believed in him, and he said, ‘Indeed I am migrating toward my Lord. Indeed He is the Mighty, the Wise’.

Name: The Spider
Verse: And We gave him Isaac, and Jacob, and We ordained among his descendants prophethood and the Scripture. And We gave him his reward in this world. And in the Hereafter he shall truly be among the righteous.

Name: The Spider
Verse: And Lot, when he said to his people ‘Truly you commit lewdness, such as none in [all] the worlds has committed before you.

Name: The Spider
Verse: What! Do you come unto men, and cut off the way, and you discuss in your gatherings indecency?’ But the only answer of his people was that they said, ‘Bring us the chastisement of God, if you are truthful’.

Name: The Spider
Verse: He said, ‘My Lord, help me against the people who work corruption’.

Name: The Spider
Verse: And when Our messengers came to Abraham with the good tidings, they said, ‘We shall assuredly destroy the people of this town, for truly its people are evildoers’.

Name: The Spider
Verse: He said, ‘Lo! Lot is in it’. They said, ‘We know very well who is in it. Assuredly We shall deliver him and his family, except his wife: she is of those who will stay behind’.

Name: The Spider
Verse: And when Our messengers came to Lot, he was distressed on their account, and he was constrained [unable] to help them. But they said, ‘Do not be afraid, nor grieve. We shall surely deliver you and your family, except your wife: she is of those who will remain behind.

Name: The Spider
Verse: We are indeed going to bring down upon the people of this town a scourge from the heaven because of their immorality’.

Name: The Spider
Verse: And verily We have left of that a clear sign for a people who understand.

Name: The Spider
Verse: And to Midian [We sent], their brother Shu‘ayb. He said, ‘O my people! Worship God and anticipate the Last Day, and do not be degenerate in the earth, working corruption’.

Name: The Spider
Verse: But they denied him, and so the earthquake seized them, and they ended up lying lifeless prostrate in their habitations.

Name: The Spider
Verse: And ‘ād, and Thamūd, it is indeed evident to you from their [former] dwellings. For Satan adorned for them their deeds, and thus barred them from the Way, though they had been discerning.

Name: The Spider
Verse: And Korah, and Pharaoh, and Hāmān! And verily Moses brought them clear signs, but they acted arrogantly in the land; and they could not thwart Us.

Name: The Spider
Verse: So each We seized for his sin; and among them were some upon whom We unleashed a squall of stones, and among them were some who were seized by the Cry, and among them were some whom We made the earth swallow, and among them were some whom We drowned. And God never wronged them, but they wronged themselves.

Name: The Spider
Verse: The likeness of those who choose besides God [other] patrons is as the likeness of the spider that makes a home. And truly the frailest of homes is the home of the spider if they only knew.

Name: The Spider
Verse: Truly God knows whatever thing they call on besides Him. And He is the Mighty, the Wise.

Name: The Spider
Verse: And such similitudes, We strike them for [the sake of] mankind; but none understands them, except those who know.

Name: The Spider
Verse: God created the heavens and the earth with truth. Surely in that there is a sign for believers.

Name: The Spider
Verse: Recite what has been revealed to you of the Book, and maintain prayer; truly prayer prohibits lewd acts and indecency. And the remembrance of God is surely greater, and God knows what you do.

Name: The Spider
Verse: And do not dispute with the People of the Scripture unless it be with that, bettering the most virtuous way, except [in the case of] those of them who have done wrong, and say: ‘We believe in that which has been revealed to us and revealed to you our God and your God is one [and the same], and to Him we submit’.

Name: The Spider
Verse: Thus have We revealed to you the Book. And so those to whom We have given the Scripture believe in it, and of these there are some who believe in it; and none denies Our signs, except disbelievers.

Name: The Spider
Verse: And you did not use to recite before this any [other] Book, nor did you write it with your right hand, for then those who follow falsehood would have had doubts.

Name: The Spider
Verse: Nay, but it is clear signs in the breasts of those who have been given knowledge, and none denies Our signs except wrongdoers.

Name: The Spider
Verse: And they say, ‘Why has not some sign been sent down to him from his Lord?’ Say: ‘Signs are only with God and I am only a plain warner’.

Name: The Spider
Verse: Is it not sufficient for them that We have revealed to you the Book which is recited to them? Surely in that is mercy and a reminder for a people who believe.

Name: The Spider
Verse: Say: ‘God suffices as a witness between me and you’. He knows whatever is in the heavens and the earth. And those who believe in falsehood, and [who] disbelieve in God, those, they are the losers.

Name: The Spider
Verse: And they ask you to hasten the chastisement. Yet were it not for an appointed term, the chastisement would have come upon them, but it shall assuredly come upon them suddenly while they are unaware.

Name: The Spider
Verse: And they ask you to hasten the chastisement. And lo! Hell shall encompass the disbelievers,

Name: The Spider
Verse: on the Day when the chastisement shall envelop them from above them and from under their feet, and We shall say, ‘Taste now what you used to do!’

Name: The Spider
Verse: O My servants who believe! My earth is indeed vast. So worship [only] Me.

Name: The Spider
Verse: Every soul shall taste death. Then to Us you shall be returned.

Name: The Spider
Verse: And those who believe and perform righteous deeds, We shall surely lodge them in lofty abodes of Paradise, underneath which rivers flow, to abide in them — excellent is the reward of the toilers;

Name: The Spider
Verse: those who are steadfast, and who put their trust in their Lord.

Name: The Spider
Verse: And how many an animal there is that does not bear its own provision. Yet God provides for it, and for you. And He is the Hearer, the Knower.

Name: The Spider
Verse: And if you were to ask them, ‘Who created the heavens and the earth and disposed the sun and the moon?’ They would assuredly say, ‘God’. So how then are they turned away?

Name: The Spider
Verse: God extends provision for whomever He will of His servants and He straitens for him. Truly God has knowledge of all things.

Name: The Spider
Verse: And if you were to ask them, ‘Who sends down water from the heaven, and therewith revives the earth after its death?’ They would assuredly say, ‘God’. Say: ‘Praise be to God!’ Nay, but most of them do not realise.

Name: The Spider
Verse: And the life of this world is nothing but diversion and play. But surely the Abode of the Hereafter is indeed the [true] Life, if they only knew.

Name: The Spider
Verse: And when they board the ship, they call on God, making their supplications purely to Him, but when He delivers them to land, behold! they ascribe partners [to Him].

Name: The Spider
Verse: That they may be ungrateful for what We have bestowed on them, and that they may seek enjoyment, for they will soon know!

Name: The Spider
Verse: Or is it that they have not seen that We have appointed a secure Sanctuary, while people are snatched away all around them? Is it that they believe in falsehood, and are [wont to be] ungrateful for God’s grace?

Name: The Spider
Verse: And who does greater wrong than he who invents a lie against God, or denies truth when it comes to him? Is there not in Hell a lodging for the disbelievers?

Name: The Spider
Verse: But as for those who struggle for Our sake, We shall assuredly guide them in Our ways, and truly God is with the virtuous.

Name: The Romans
Verse: Alif lām mīm.

Name: The Romans
Verse: The Byzantines have been vanquished

Name: The Romans
Verse: in the nearer [part of the] land. But they, after their vanquishing shall be the victors

Name: The Romans
Verse: in a few years. To God belongs the command before and after, and on that day, the believers shall rejoice

Name: The Romans
Verse: in God’s help. He helps whomever He will; and He is the Mighty, the Merciful.

Name: The Romans
Verse: The promise of God. God does not fail His promise, but most people are not aware.

Name: The Romans
Verse: They know [merely] an outward aspect of the life of this world; but they, of the Hereafter, they are oblivious.

Name: The Romans
Verse: Have they not contemplated themselves? God did not create the heavens and the earth, and what is between them, except with the truth and an appointed term. But indeed many people disbelieve in the encounter with their Lord.

Name: The Romans
Verse: Have they not travelled in the land and beheld how was the consequence for those before them? They were more powerful than them, and they effected the land, and developed it more than these have developed it; and their messengers brought them clear signs, for God would never wrong them, but they used to wrong themselves.

Name: The Romans
Verse: Then the consequence for those who committed evil was evil because they denied the signs of God and made a mock of them.

Name: The Romans
Verse: God originates creation, then He will reproduce it, then to Him you shall be returned.

Name: The Romans
Verse: And on the Day when the Hour comes, the sinners will be dumbfounded.

Name: The Romans
Verse: And none from among those partners of theirs shall be intercessors for them and they shall disavow these partners of theirs.

Name: The Romans
Verse: And on the Day when the Hour comes, that day they shall be separated.

Name: The Romans
Verse: As for those who believed and performed righteous deeds, they shall be made happy in a garden [of Paradise].

Name: The Romans
Verse: But as for those who disbelieved and denied Our signs and the encounter of the Hereafter, those, they shall be arraigned into the chastisement.

Name: The Romans
Verse: So glory be to God when you enter the [time of the] night and when you rise in the morning.

Name: The Romans
Verse: And to Him belongs [all] praise in the heavens and the earth — and as the sun declines and when you enter noontime.

Name: The Romans
Verse: He brings forth the living from the dead, and He brings forth the dead from the living, and He revives the earth after it has died. And in such [a manner], you shall be brought forth.

Name: The Romans
Verse: And of His signs is that He created you of dust, then lo! you are human beings, spreading.

Name: The Romans
Verse: And of His signs is that He created for you from yourselves mates that you might find peace by their side, and He ordained between you affection and mercy. Surely in that there are signs for a people who reflect.

Name: The Romans
Verse: And of His signs is the creation of the heavens and the earth and the differences of your tongues and your colours. Surely in that there are signs for all peoples.

Name: The Romans
Verse: And of His signs is your sleep by night and day and your seeking of His bounty. Surely in that there are signs for people who listen.

Name: The Romans
Verse: And of His signs is His showing you lightning to arouse fear and hope, and He sends down water from the heaven and with it He revives the earth after it has died. Surely in that there are signs for people who understand.

Name: The Romans
Verse: And of His signs is that the heaven and the earth remain standing by His command; then, when He calls you [to come] out of the earth, lo! you shall come forth.

Name: The Romans
Verse: And to Him belongs whoever is in the heavens and the earth. All are obedient to Him.

Name: The Romans
Verse: And He it is Who initiates the creation, then brings it back, and that is [even] easier for Him. His is the loftiest description in the heavens and the earth. And He is the Mighty, the Wise.

Name: The Romans
Verse: He has struck for you a similitude from yourselves: do you have among those whom your right hands own any partners, [who may share] in what We have provided for you, so that you are equal therein, fearing them as you fear your own [folk]. So We detail the signs for people who understand.

Name: The Romans
Verse: Nay, but those who do evil follow their own desires without any knowledge. So who will guide he whom God has led astray? And they have no helpers.

Name: The Romans
Verse: So set your purpose for religion, as a hanīf — a nature given by God, upon which He originated mankind. There is no changing God’s creation. That is the upright religion, but most people do not know,

Name: The Romans
Verse: turning to Him and fear Him and establish prayer and do not be among the idolaters,

Name: The Romans
Verse: And when some distress befalls people, they call on their Lord, turning, in penitence to Him. Then, when He lets them taste mercy from Him, lo! a party of them ascribe partners to their Lord.

Name: The Romans
Verse: Let them be ungrateful for what We have given them. ‘So take your enjoyment. Soon you will know’.

Name: The Romans
Verse: Or have We revealed any warrant to them which might speak of what they associate with Him?

Name: The Romans
Verse: And when We let people taste some mercy, they exult in it. But if some evil befalls them for what their own hands have sent ahead, behold! they despair.

Name: The Romans
Verse: Have they not seen that God extends His provision to whomever He will, and straitens? Surely in that there are signs for people who believe.

Name: The Romans
Verse: And give the relative what is his due, and the needy and the wayfarer. That is better for those who desire God’s Countenance; those, they are the successful.

Name: The Romans
Verse: And what you give in usury that it may increase the wealth of the people, does not increase with God. But what you give as alms, seeking God’s Countenance, such [of you who do so] — they are the receivers of manifold increase.

Name: The Romans
Verse: God is the One Who created you, then provided for you, then makes you die, then gives you life: is there anyone among your associates, who does anything of the kind? Glory be to Him and exalted be He above what they associate.

Name: The Romans
Verse: Corruption has appeared on land and on sea because of what people’s hands have perpetrated that He may make them taste something of what they have done that perhaps they may repent.

Name: The Romans
Verse: Say: ‘Travel in the land and behold how was the consequence for those who were before; most of them were idolaters’.

Name: The Romans
Verse: So set your purpose for the upright religion before there comes the inevitable day from God. On that day they shall be sundered.

Name: The Romans
Verse: Whoever disbelieves, [the consequence of] his disbelief shall upon him, and those who act righteously, they will be paving the way for [the salvation of] their own souls,

Name: The Romans
Verse: that He may requite those who believe and perform righteous deeds out of His bounty. Indeed He does not like the disbelievers.

Name: The Romans
Verse: And of His signs is that He unleashes the winds as bearers of good tidings and that He may let you taste, of His mercy, and that the ships may run by His command, and that you may seek His bounty, and that perhaps you might [then] give thanks.

Name: The Romans
Verse: And verily We sent before you messengers to their people and they brought them clear signs. Then We took vengeance upon those who were guilty, and it was ever incumbent upon Us to give victory to the believers.

Name: The Romans
Verse: God is the One Who unleashes the winds which then raise clouds, and He then spreads them across the heaven as He will, and He forms them into fragments and then you see the rain issuing out of them. Then when He drops it upon whomever of His servants He will, lo! they rejoice.

Name: The Romans
Verse: Though indeed before it was sent down upon them, before that they had been despondent.

Name: The Romans
Verse: So behold the effects of God’s mercy, how He revives the earth after it has died. Surely He is the Reviver of the dead and He has power over all things.

Name: The Romans
Verse: But if We unleash a [different] wind, and they see it turn yellow, they would begin to disbelieve.

Name: The Romans
Verse: And so you cannot make the dead hear, nor can you make the deaf hear the call when they go away with their backs turned.

Name: The Romans
Verse: Nor can you guide the blind out of their error. You can only make hear those who believe in Our signs, and have thus submitted.

Name: The Romans
Verse: God is the One Who created you from [a state of] weakness, then He ordained after weakness strength, then after strength He appointed weakness [again] and grey hair. He creates what He will, and He is the Knower, the Omnipotent.

Name: The Romans
Verse: And on the Day when the Hour comes the guilty shall swear that they had not remained more than an hour. That is how they use to be deceived.

Name: The Romans
Verse: But those who have been given knowledge and faith shall say, ‘You have remained according to God’s decree until the Day of Resurrection. This is the Day of Resurrection, but you did not know’.

Name: The Romans
Verse: So on that day their excuses will not profit the evildoers, nor will they be asked to make amends.

Name: The Romans
Verse: And verily We have struck for mankind in this Qur’ān every [kind of] similitude. And if you were to bring them a [miraculous] sign, those who disbelieve will certainly say, ‘You are nothing but followers of falsehood’.

Name: The Romans
Verse: Thus does God seal the hearts of those who do not know.

Name: The Romans
Verse: So be patient. Surely God’s promise is true. And do not let them cause you to be inconstant, those who are uncertain.

Name: Luqmân
Verse: Alif lām mīm.

Name: Luqmân
Verse: Those are the signs of the wise Book,

Name: Luqmân
Verse: a guidance and a mercy for the virtuous,

Name: Luqmân
Verse: who maintain the prayer and pay the alms and who are certain of the Hereafter.

Name: Luqmân
Verse: Such follow guidance from their Lord and it is they who are the successful.

Name: Luqmân
Verse: And among people there is he who purchases idle talk that he may lead [people] astray from the way of God without knowledge and take it in mockery. For such there will be a humiliating chastisement.

Name: Luqmân
Verse: And when Our signs are recited to such [a one] he turns away disdainfully as though he never heard them, as though there were a deafness in his ears. So give him tidings of a painful chastisement.

Name: Luqmân
Verse: Surely those who believe and perform righteous deeds, for them there shall be Gardens of Bliss,

Name: Luqmân
Verse: abiding therein — a promise of God in truth, and He is the Mighty, the Wise.

Name: Luqmân
Verse: He created the heavens without any pillars that you can see and cast high mountains into the earth, lest it shake with you, and He dispersed therein all kinds beasts. And We sent down water from the heaven and We caused to grow in it of every splendid kind.

Name: Luqmân
Verse: This is God’s creation. Now show me what those [you worship] besides Him have created. Nay but the evildoers are in manifest error.

Name: Luqmân
Verse: And verily We gave Luqm?n wisdom: ‘Give thanks to God. Whoever gives thanks only for his own sake and whoever is ungrateful, then surely God is Independent, Praised’.

Name: Luqmân
Verse: And when Luqmān said to his son, when he was admonishing him, ‘O my son do not ascribe partners to God: idolatry is truly a tremendous wrong’.

Name: Luqmân
Verse: And We have enjoined man concerning his parents — his mother bears him in weakness after weakness, and his weaning is in two year. ‘Give thanks to Me and to your parents. To Me is the journey’s end.

Name: Luqmân
Verse: But if they urge you to ascribe to Me as partner that whereof you have no knowledge, then do not obey them. And keep them company in this world honourably, and follow the way of him who returns to Me [in penitence]. Then to Me will be your return, and I will inform you of what you used to do.

Name: Luqmân
Verse: ‘O my son! Even if it should be the weight of a grain of mustard-seed, and [even if] it be in a rock, or in the heavens, or in the earth, God will bring it forth. Truly God is Subtle, Aware.

Name: Luqmân
Verse: O my son! Establish prayer and enjoin decency and forbid indecency. And be patient through whatever may befall you. Truly that is true constancy.

Name: Luqmân
Verse: And do not turn your cheek disdainfully from people and do not walk upon the earth exultantly. Truly God does not like any swaggering braggart.

Name: Luqmân
Verse: And be modest in your bearing and lower your voice; indeed the most hideous of voices is the donkey’s voice’.

Name: Luqmân
Verse: Do you not see that God has disposed for you whatever is in the heavens and whatever is in the earth, and He has showered His favours upon you, [both] outwardly and inwardly? Yet among people there are those who dispute concerning God without any knowledge or guidance or an illuminating scripture.

Name: Luqmân
Verse: And if it is said to them: ‘Follow what God has revealed’, they say, ‘We will rather follow what we found our fathers following’. What! even though Satan were calling them to the chastisement of the Blaze?

Name: Luqmân
Verse: And whoever surrenders his purpose to God and is virtuous, has certainly grasped the firmest handle, and to God belongs the sequel of all matters.

Name: Luqmân
Verse: And whoever disbelieves, then do not let his disbelief grieve you. To Us shall be their return and We shall inform them of what they did. Truly God knows [best] what is in the breasts.

Name: Luqmân
Verse: We will give them comfort for a little [while], then We will drive them, to a harsh chastisement.

Name: Luqmân
Verse: And if you were to ask them, ‘Who created the heavens and the earth?’ they will surely say, ‘God’. Say: ‘Praise be to God’. Nay, but most of them do not realise.

Name: Luqmân
Verse: To God belongs whatever is in the heavens and the earth. Indeed God, He is the Independent, the Praised.

Name: Luqmân
Verse: And if all the trees on earth were pens, and the sea replenished with seven more seas, the Words of God would not be spent. Truly God is Mighty, Wise.

Name: Luqmân
Verse: Your creation and your resurrection are only as [that of] a single soul. Truly God is Hearer, Seer.

Name: Luqmân
Verse: Have you not seen that God makes the night pass into the day and makes the day pass into the night, and He has disposed the sun and the moon, each running to an appointed term, and that God is Aware of what you do?

Name: Luqmân
Verse: That is [so] because God, He is the Truth, and whatever they call on besides Him is falsehood, and because God is the High [Exalted], the Great.

Name: Luqmân
Verse: Have you not seen that the ships run upon the sea by the grace of God, that He may show you some of His signs? Surely in that there are signs for every [servant who is] steadfast, grateful.

Name: Luqmân
Verse: And if waves cover them like awnings, they call on God, sincere before Him in their faith; but when He delivers them to land, some of them compromise. And none denies Our signs, except every perfidious ingrate.

Name: Luqmân
Verse: O people, fear your Lord and fear a day when no parent shall avail a child; and no child shall avail its parent in any way. Surely God’s promise is true. So do not let the life of this world deceive you, and do not let the Deceiver deceive you concerning God.

Name: Luqmân
Verse: Lo! God, with Him lies knowledge of the Hour; and He sends down the rain, and He knows what is in the wombs. And no soul knows what it will earn tomorrow, and no soul knows in what land it will die. Truly God is Knower, Aware.

Name: The Prostration
Verse: Alif lām mīm.

Name: The Prostration
Verse: The revelation of the Book, whereof there is no doubt from the Lord of the Worlds.

Name: The Prostration
Verse: Or do they say: ‘He has invented it’? Nay, but it is the truth from your Lord, that you may warn a people to whom no warner came before you that perhaps they may find [right] guidance.

Name: The Prostration
Verse: God is He Who created the heavens and the earth and whatever is between them in six days, then He presided upon the Throne. You do not have besides Him any protector or intercessor. Will you not then remember?

Name: The Prostration
Verse: He directs the command from the heaven to the earth, then it ascends to Him in a day whose measure is a thousand years by your reckoning.

Name: The Prostration
Verse: That is the Knower of the Unseen and the visible, the Mighty, the Merciful,

Name: The Prostration
Verse: Who perfected everything that He created. And He began the creation of man from clay,

Name: The Prostration
Verse: then He made his progeny from an extract of a base fluid,

Name: The Prostration
Verse: then He proportioned him, and breathed into him of His spirit. And He made for you hearing, and sight and hearts. Little thanks do you give.

Name: The Prostration
Verse: And they say: ‘When we are lost beneath the earth, shall we be indeed created anew?’ Nay, but they disbelieve in the encounter with their Lord.

Name: The Prostration
Verse: Say: ‘The Angel of death, who has been charged with you, shall receive you [in death], then to your Lord you shall be returned’.

Name: The Prostration
Verse: And if could you but see the guilty hanging their heads [low] before their Lord: ‘Our Lord! We have seen and heard. So send us back so that we may act righteously, for indeed we are convinced’.

Name: The Prostration
Verse: ‘And had We [so] willed, We could have given every soul its [means to] guidance, but My Word became due: “Verily I shall fill Hell with jinn and mankind together”.

Name: The Prostration
Verse: So taste [now], for your having forgotten the encounter of this day of yours. We [too] shall forget you. And taste [now] the everlasting chastisement for what you used to practise’.

Name: The Prostration
Verse: Only those believe in Our signs, who, when they are reminded of them, fall down in prostration and make glorifications in praise of their Lord, and they do not disdain.

Name: The Prostration
Verse: Their sides withdraw from their lying places to supplicate to their Lord in fear and in hope, and they expend of what We have provided them.

Name: The Prostration
Verse: For no soul knows what has been kept hidden for them in the way of joyous sights as a reward for what they used to do.

Name: The Prostration
Verse: Is he who is a believer like him who is a transgressor? They are not equal.

Name: The Prostration
Verse: As for those who believe and perform righteous deeds, for them shall be the Gardens of the Abode — a hospitality for what they used to do.

Name: The Prostration
Verse: But as for those who transgressed, their abode shall be the Fire. Whenever they seek to exit from it, they shall be brought back into it, and it shall be said to them, ‘Taste the chastisement of the Fire which you used to deny’.

Name: The Prostration
Verse: And We shall surely make them taste the nearer chastisement before the greater chastisement that perhaps they may return.

Name: The Prostration
Verse: And who does greater wrong than he who is reminded of the signs of his Lord, but then turns away from them? Assuredly We shall take vengeance upon the criminals.

Name: The Prostration
Verse: And verily We gave Moses the Scripture; so do not be in doubt concerning the encounter with Him; and We appointed him a guidance for the Children of Israel.

Name: The Prostration
Verse: And We appointed among them leaders who guided by Our command, when they had endured [patiently] and had conviction in Our signs.

Name: The Prostration
Verse: Surely your Lord will judge between them on the Day of Resurrection concerning that wherein they used to differ.

Name: The Prostration
Verse: Or is it not an indication for them how many generations We destroyed before them amid whose dwellings they walk? Surely in that there are signs. Are they not able to hear?

Name: The Prostration
Verse: Or have they not seen how We drive the water to barren land and therewith bring forth crops whereof their cattle and [they] themselves eat? Can they not see?

Name: The Prostration
Verse: And they say: ‘When will this [decisive] Judgement be, if you are truthful?’

Name: The Prostration
