Verse: Say: ‘On the day of [this] Judgement, their [newly found] faith [then] shall not benefit those who had been disbelievers, nor shall they be given respite.

Name: The Prostration
Verse: So turn away from them and wait. They too are waiting.

Name: The Clans
Verse: O Prophet! Fear God and do not obey the disbelievers and the hypocrites. Truly God is Knower, Wise.

Name: The Clans
Verse: And follow what is revealed to you from your Lord. Truly God is Aware of what you do.

Name: The Clans
Verse: And put your trust in God, and God suffices as Guardian.

Name: The Clans
Verse: God has not placed two hearts inside any man, nor has He made your wives whom you repudiate by zihār your mothers. Nor has He made those whom you claim as [adopted] sons your sons. That is a mere utterance of your mouths. But God speaks the truth and He guides to the way.

Name: The Clans
Verse: Attribute them to their [true] fathers. That is more equitable in the sight of God. If you do not know their [true] fathers, then they are your brethren in religion and [as] your associates. And you would not be at fault for any mistake you make, except what your hearts may premeditate. And God is Forgiving, Merciful.

Name: The Clans
Verse: The Prophet is closer to the believers than their [own] souls, and his wives are their mothers. And those related by blood are more entitled, [from] one another in the Book of God than the [other] believers and the Emigrants, barring any favour you may do your friends. This is written in the Book.

Name: The Clans
Verse: And when We took a pledge from the prophets and from you, and from Noah and Abraham and Moses and Jesus son of Mary. And We took from them a solemn pledge,

Name: The Clans
Verse: that He may question the truthful about their truthfulness; and He has prepared for those who disbelieve a painful chastisement.

Name: The Clans
Verse: O you who believe! Remember God’s favour to you when hosts came against you, and We unleashed against them a [great] wind and hosts you did not see. And God is ever Seer of what you do.

Name: The Clans
Verse: When they came at you from above you and from below you, and when the eyes turned away [in fear], and the hearts lept to the throats, while you entertained all sorts of thoughts concerning God,

Name: The Clans
Verse: it was there that the believers were [sorely] tried, and were shaken with a mighty shock.

Name: The Clans
Verse: And when the hypocrites, and those in whose hearts is sickness were saying, ‘What God and His Messenger promised us was [nothing] but delusion’.

Name: The Clans
Verse: And when a party of them said, ‘O people of Yathrib! there is not a stand [possible] for you [here], so turn back. And a group of them [even] sought the permission of the Prophet, saying, ‘Our homes are exposed’, although they were not exposed. They only sought to flee.

Name: The Clans
Verse: And had they been invaded in it from all sides and had they been exhorted to treachery, they would have committed it and would have hesitated thereupon but a little.

Name: The Clans
Verse: Though they had assuredly pledged to God before that, that they would not turn their backs [to flee]; and a pledge given to God must be answered for.

Name: The Clans
Verse: Say: ‘Flight will not avail you should you flee from death or [from] being slain, and then you would not be extended comfort, except a little’.

Name: The Clans
Verse: Say: ‘Who is it that can protect you from God should He desire [to cause] you ill, or should He desire for you mercy?’ And they shall not find for themselves besides God any protector or helper.

Name: The Clans
Verse: Indeed God already knows the hinderers among you and those who say to their brethren, ‘Come to us’, and they do not engage in the battle except a little,

Name: The Clans
Verse: grudging to you. And when there is a panic, you see them looking at you, their eyes rolling like one fainting at death, but when the panic subsides, they scald you, with [their] sharp tongues, in their greed for the riches. Those, they never believed. Therefore God has invalidated their works, and that is easy for God.

Name: The Clans
Verse: They suppose that the confederates have not [yet] departed, and were the confederates to come, they would wish that they were in the desert with the Bedouins asking about your news. And if they were among you, they would fight but a little.

Name: The Clans
Verse: Verily there is for you a good example in the Messenger of God for whoever hopes for [the encounter with] God and the Last Day, and remembers God often.

Name: The Clans
Verse: And when the believers saw the confederates, they said, ‘This is what God and His Messenger promised us, and God and His Messenger were truthful’. And that only increased them in faith and submission.

Name: The Clans
Verse: Among the believers are men who are true to the covenant they made with God. Some of them have fulfilled their vow, and some are still awaiting; and they have not changed in the least;

Name: The Clans
Verse: that God may reward the truthful for their truthfulness and chastise the hypocrites, if He will, or relent to them. Surely God is Forgiving, Merciful.

Name: The Clans
Verse: And God repulsed those who were disbelievers in their rage, without their attaining any good. And God spared the believers from fighting. And truly God is Strong, Mighty.

Name: The Clans
Verse: And He brought down those of the People of the Scripture, who had supported them from their strongholds and He cast terror into their hearts, [so that] some you slew and some you took captive.

Name: The Clans
Verse: And He made you inherit their land and their homes and their possessions, and a land you had not trodden. And God has power over all things.

Name: The Clans
Verse: O Prophet! Say to your wives: ‘If you desire the life of this world and its adornment, come [now], I will provide for you and release you in a gracious manner.

Name: The Clans
Verse: But if you desire God and His Messenger and the Abode of the Hereafter, then God has indeed prepared for the virtuous among you, a great reward’.

Name: The Clans
Verse: O wives of the Prophet! Whoever of you commits manifest indecency the chastisement shall be doubled for her, and that is easy for God.

Name: The Clans
Verse: But whoever of you is obedient to God and His Messenger, and acts righteously, We shall give her a twofold reward. And We have prepared a noble provision for her.

Name: The Clans
Verse: O wives of the Prophet! You are not like any other women. If you fear [God], then do not be complaisant in your speech, lest he in whose heart is a sickness aspire [to you], but speak honourable words.

Name: The Clans
Verse: And stay in your houses and do not flaunt your finery in the [flaunting] manner of the former Time of Ignorance. And maintain prayer and pay the alms, and obey God and His Messenger. Indeed God will but to rid you of sin, People of the House, and to purify you with a thorough purification.

Name: The Clans
Verse: And remember that which is recited in your houses of the revelations of God and wisdom. Truly God is Kind, Aware.

Name: The Clans
Verse: Indeed the men who have submitted [to God] and the women who have submitted [to God], and the believing men and the believing women, and the obedient men and the obedient women, and the men who are truthful and the women who are truthful, and the patient men and the patient women, and the humble men and the humble women, and the charitable men and the charitable women, and the men who fast and the women who fast, and the men who guard their private parts and the women who guard their private parts, and the men who remember God often and the women who remember God often — for them God has prepared forgiveness and a great reward.

Name: The Clans
Verse: And it is not [fitting] for any believing man or believing woman, when God and His Messenger have decided on a matter, to have a choice in their matter. And whoever disobeys God and His Messenger has certainly strayed into manifest error.

Name: The Clans
Verse: And when you said to him to whom God had shown favour, and to whom you [too] had shown favour. ‘Retain your wife for yourself and fear God’. But you had hidden in your heart what God was to disclose, and you feared people, though God is worthier that you should fear Him. So when Zayd had fulfilled whatever need he had of her, We joined her in marriage to you so that there may not be any restriction for the believers in respect of the wives of their adopted sons, when the latter have fulfilled whatever wish they have of them. And God’s commandment is bound to be realised.

Name: The Clans
Verse: There is no restriction for the Prophet in what God has ordained for him: [that is] God’s precedent with those who passed away before, and God’s commandment, is inexorable destiny

Name: The Clans
Verse: — [those] who deliver the Messages of God and fear Him, and fear no one except Him. And God suffices as Reckoner.

Name: The Clans
Verse: Muhammad is not the father of any man among you, but the Messenger of God and the Seal of the Prophets. And God has knowledge of all things.

Name: The Clans
Verse: O you who believe! Remember God with much remembrance.

Name: The Clans
Verse: And glorify Him morning and evening.

Name: The Clans
Verse: It is He Who blesses you and His angels that He may bring you forth from darkness into light. And He is Merciful to the believers.

Name: The Clans
Verse: Their greeting on the day they encounter Him will be ‘Peace’. And He has prepared for them a noble reward.

Name: The Clans
Verse: O Prophet! Indeed We have sent you as a witness, and as a bearer of good tidings, and as a warner,

Name: The Clans
Verse: and as a summoner to God by His leave, and as a illuminating lamp.

Name: The Clans
Verse: And give good tidings to the believers that there will be for them a great bounty from God.

Name: The Clans
Verse: And do not obey the disbelievers and the hypocrites, and disregard their injuriousness. And put your trust in God, and God suffices as Guardian.

Name: The Clans
Verse: O you who believe if you marry believing women and then divorce them before you have touched them, there shall be no [waiting] period for you to reckon against them. But provide for them and release them in a gracious manner.

Name: The Clans
Verse: O Prophet! Indeed We have made lawful for you your wives whom you have given their dowries and what your right hand owns, of those whom God has given you as spoils of war, and the daughters of your paternal uncles and the daughters of your paternal aunts, and the daughters of your maternal uncles and the daughters of your maternal aunts who emigrated with you, and any believing woman if she gift herself [in marriage] to the Prophet and if the Prophet desire to take her in marriage — a privilege for you exclusively, not for the [rest of the] believers. Indeed We know what We have imposed upon them with respect to their wives, and what their right hands own, so that there may be no [unnecessary] restriction for you. And God is Forgiving, Merciful.

Name: The Clans
Verse: You may put off whomever of them you wish and consort whomever you wish, and as for whomever you may desire of those whom you have set aside, you would not be at fault. That makes it likelier that they will be comforted and not grieve, and that they will be satisfied with what you give them, every one of them will be well-pleased with what you give her. And God knows what is in your hearts. And God is Knower, Forbearing.

Name: The Clans
Verse: Women are not lawful for you beyond that, nor [is it lawful] for you to change them for other wives, even though their beauty impress you, except those whom your right hand owns. And God is Watcher over all things.

Name: The Clans
Verse: O you who believe, do not enter the Prophet’s houses unless permission is granted you to [share] a meal without waiting for the [right] moment. But when you are invited, enter, and, when you have had your meal, disperse, without any [leisurely] conversation. Indeed that is upsetting for the Prophet, and he is [too] shy of you, but God is not shy of the truth. And when you ask anything of [his] womenfolk, ask them from behind a screen. That is purer for your hearts and their hearts. And you should never cause the Messenger of God hurt; nor ever marry his wives after him. Assuredly that in God’s sight would be very grave.

Name: The Clans
Verse: Whether you disclose anything or keep it hidden, truly God has knowledge of all things.

Name: The Clans
Verse: They [the Prophet’s wives] would not be at fault with regard to [socialising with] their fathers, or their sons, or their brothers, or their brothers’ sons, or their sisters’ sons, or their own women, or what their right hands own. And fear [O women] God. Surely God is Witness to all things.

Name: The Clans
Verse: Indeed God and His angels bless the Prophet. O you who believe, invoke blessings on him and invoke peace upon him in a worthy manner.

Name: The Clans
Verse: Indeed those who are injurious to God and His Messenger, God has cursed them in this world and the Hereafter, and has prepared for them a humiliating chastisement.

Name: The Clans
Verse: And those who cause hurt to believing men and believing women without the latter’s having done anything, have verily borne [the guilt of] calumny and [the burden of] manifest sin.

Name: The Clans
Verse: O Prophet! Tell your wives and daughters and the women of the believers to draw their cloaks closely over themselves. That makes it likelier that they will be known and not be molested. And God is Forgiving, Merciful.

Name: The Clans
Verse: If the hypocrites do not desist, and likewise those in whose hearts is a sickness, as well as the scaremongers in the city, assuredly We will urge you [to take action] against them, then they will not be your neighbours in it except for a little [while].

Name: The Clans
Verse: Accursed [shall they be], wherever they are found they shall be seized and slain violently.

Name: The Clans
Verse: God’s precedent with those who passed away before, and you will find that there is no changing God’s precedent.

Name: The Clans
Verse: People question you concerning the Hour. Say: ‘Knowledge thereof lies only with God — and what do you know, perhaps the Hour is near’.

Name: The Clans
Verse: God has indeed cursed the disbelievers, and prepared for them a blaze

Name: The Clans
Verse: to abide therein forever. They shall not find any protector or helper.

Name: The Clans
Verse: On the day when their faces are turned about in the Fire they shall say, ‘O would that we had obeyed God and obeyed the Messenger!’

Name: The Clans
Verse: And they shall say, ‘Our Lord, we obeyed our leaders and elders, and they led us astray from the way.

Name: The Clans
Verse: Our Lord, give them a double chastisement and curse them with numerous curses!’

Name: The Clans
Verse: O you who believe, do not behave as did those who harmed Moses, whereat God absolved him of what they alleged. And he was distinguished in God’s sight.

Name: The Clans
Verse: O you who believe, fear God and speak words of integrity.

Name: The Clans
Verse: He will rectify your deeds for you and will forgive you your sins. And whoever obeys God and His Messenger has verily achieved a great success.

Name: The Clans
Verse: Indeed We offered the Trust to the heavens and the earth and the mountains, but they refused to bear it and were apprehensive of it; but man undertook it. Truly he is a wrongdoer, ignorant

Name: The Clans
Verse: so that God may chastise the hypocrites, men and women, and the idolaters, men and women, and that God may relent to the believing men and believing women. And God is Forgiving, Merciful.

Name: Saba
Verse: Praise be to God to Whom belongs whatever is in the heavens and whatever is in the earth. And to Him belongs [all] praise in the Hereafter. And He is the Wise, the Aware.

Name: Saba
Verse: He knows what penetrates the earth, and what issues out of it, and what comes down from the heaven, and what ascends into it, and He is the Merciful, the Forgiving.

Name: Saba
Verse: And those who disbelieve say, ‘The Hour will never come to us’. Say: ‘Yes indeed, by my Lord, it shall come to you — [by] the Knower of the Unseen. Not [even] the weight of an atom escapes Him in the heavens or in the earth, nor [is there] anything smaller than that or greater, but it is in a Manifest Book,

Name: Saba
Verse: that He may requite those who believe and perform righteous deeds — for such there will be forgiveness and a fair provision.

Name: Saba
Verse: And those who strive against Our signs, deeming Us inomnipotent, for such there will be a chastisement of an awful punishment’.

Name: Saba
Verse: And those who have been given knowledge see that what has been revealed to you from your Lord is the truth, and [that] it guides to the path of the Mighty, the Praised.

Name: Saba
Verse: And those who disbelieve say, ‘Shall we show you a man who will inform you that when you have been utterly torn to pieces you shall indeed be created anew?’

Name: Saba
Verse: Has he invented a lie against God, or is there a madness in him? Nay, but those who do not believe in the Hereafter will be in the chastisement and in error that is far.

Name: Saba
Verse: Have they not observed what is before them and what is behind them of heaven and earth? If We will [it], We can make the earth swallow them or let fall on them fragments from the heaven. Surely in that there is a sign for every penitent servant.

Name: Saba
Verse: And verily We bestowed on David a [great] favour from Us: ‘O mountains, repeat with him [in praise], and the birds [too]!’ And We made iron malleable for him.

Name: Saba
Verse: ‘Fashion long coats of mail and measure [well] the links’. And act righteously. Indeed I am Seer of what you do.

Name: Saba
Verse: And unto Solomon [We gave] the wind, its morning course was a month’s journey and its evening course was a month’s journey. And We caused a fount of [molten] copper to flow for him. And of the jinn [there] were those who worked before him by the leave of his Lord. And such of them as deviated from Our command, We would make them taste the chastisement of the Blaze.

Name: Saba
Verse: They fashioned for him whatever he wished: lofty shrines, and statues, and basins like cisterns, and cauldrons built into the ground. ‘Work, House of David in thankfulness. And few indeed of My servants are thankful’.

Name: Saba
Verse: And when We decreed for him death, nothing indicated to them that he had died except a termite that gnawed away at his staff. And when he fell down, the jinn realised that had they known the Unseen they would not have continued in the humiliating chastisement.

Name: Saba
Verse: Verily there was for Sheba in their dwelling-place a sign: two gardens to the right and to the left. ‘Eat of your Lord’s provision and give thanks to Him, A good land and a forgiving Lord’.

Name: Saba
Verse: But they were disregardful, so We unleashed upon them the flood of the Dam. And We gave them in place of their two gardens two gardens bearing bitter fruit and tamarisk and sparse lote trees.

Name: Saba
Verse: That is what We requited them with for their ingratitude: and is anyone but the ingrate ever [so] requited?

Name: Saba
Verse: And We set between them and the towns which We had blessed prominent towns, and We facilitated [for travellers] the journeying through them, ‘Travel through them night and day safely’.

Name: Saba
Verse: But they said, ‘Our Lord, make far apart the stages of our travel’, and they wronged their souls, and so We made them bywords, and We caused them to disintegrate totally. Surely in that there are signs for every [servant who is] steadfast, grateful.

Name: Saba
Verse: And verily Iblīs proved true his opinion of them. So they followed him — [all] except a group of the believers.

Name: Saba
Verse: And he did not have any warrant over them, but that We might know him who believed in the Hereafter from him who was in doubt thereof. And your Lord is Preserver of all things.

Name: Saba
Verse: Say: ‘Call on those whom you have asserted besides God. They do not possess [even] so much as the weight of an atom in the heavens or in the earth, and they do not have any share in either of them, nor has He among them any auxiliary’.

Name: Saba
Verse: And intercession will not avail with Him, except for him to whom leave is given. Yet, when fear is banished from their hearts, they will say: ‘What has your Lord said?’ They will say: ‘The truth’. And He is the Exalted, the Great.

Name: Saba
Verse: Say: ‘Who provides for you from the heavens and [from] the earth?’ Say: ‘God!’ And indeed either we or you are rightly guided or in manifest error.

Name: Saba
Verse: Say: ‘You will not be questioned about the sins we committed, nor shall we be questioned about what you do’.

Name: Saba
Verse: Say: ‘Our Lord will bring us together, then He will judge between us with truth. And He is the Judge, the Knowing’.

Name: Saba
Verse: Say: ‘Show me those whom you have joined to Him as associates. No indeed! Rather He is God, the Mighty, the Wise’.

Name: Saba
Verse: And We did not send you except to all of mankind [both] as a bearer of good tidings and a warner, but most people do not know.

Name: Saba
Verse: And they say, ‘When shall this promise be [fulfilled], if you are being truthful?’

Name: Saba
Verse: And those who disbelieve say, ‘We will not believe in this Qur’ān, nor in that which was [revealed] before it’. But if you were to see when the evildoers are brought to stand before their Lord, bandying arguments against one another. Those who were oppressed will say to those who were arrogant: ‘Had it not been for you, we would have been believers’.

Name: Saba
Verse: Those who were arrogant will say to those who were oppressed, ‘Was it us who barred you from guidance after it had come to you? Rather you were guilty’.

Name: Saba
Verse: And those who were oppressed will say to those who were arrogant, ‘Nay, but [it was your] scheming night and day, when you used to command us to disbelieve in God and set up partners with Him’. And they will conceal their remorse when they see the chastisement, and We will place fetters around the necks of the disbelievers. Shall they be requited except for what they used to do?

Name: Saba
Verse: And We did not send a warner to any town without its affluent ones, saying, ‘Indeed we disbelieve in that [Message] with which you have been sent’.

Name: Saba
Verse: And they say, ‘We possess more wealth and children, and we shall not be chastised’.

Name: Saba
Verse: Say: ‘Truly my Lord extends provision for whomever He will and restricts [it], but most people do not know’.

Name: Saba
Verse: Nor is it your wealth or your children that will bring you near to Us in closeness, except for those who believe and act righteously: those, they shall have a twofold reward for what they did, and they shall be in the lofty abodes, secure.

Name: Saba
Verse: And those who strive against Our signs, supposing [Us] to be inomnipotent, those, they will be arraigned into the chastisement.

Name: Saba
Verse: Say: ‘My Lord extends provision for whomever He will of His servants, and restricts [it] for him, and whatever thing you may expend, He will replace it. And He is the best of providers’.

Name: Saba
Verse: And on the Day when He will gather them all together, He will say to the angels, ‘Was it these who used to worship you?’

Name: Saba
Verse: They will say, ‘Glory be to You, You are our Supporter, not they. Nay, rather, they used to worship the jinn; most of them were believers in them’.

Name: Saba
Verse: ‘So today none among you has any power over another, either to benefit or to hurt’. And We shall say to those who did wrong: ‘Taste the chastisement of the Fire which you used to deny!’

Name: Saba
Verse: And when Our signs are recited to them, [being] clear signs, they say, ‘This is just a man who desires to bar you from [worshipping] what your fathers used to worship’. And they say, ‘This is nothing but a calumny that has been invented. And those who disbelieve say to the truth when it comes to them, ‘This is nothing but plain sorcery’.

Name: Saba
Verse: And We did not give them any scriptures for them to study, nor did We send them any warner before you.

Name: Saba
Verse: And those who were before them [also] denied, and they have not received [even] a tenth of what We gave those [others]. Yet they denied My messengers, so how was My abhorrence!

Name: Saba
Verse: Say: ‘I will give you just one [piece of] admonition: that you rise up for God in twos and individually, and then reflect: there is no madness in your companion. He is just a warner to you before [the befalling of] a severe chastisement’.

Name: Saba
Verse: Say: ‘I have not asked you any reward, since it is for [the benefit of] you. Indeed my reward lies only with God, and He is Witness over all things’.

Name: Saba
Verse: Say: ‘Indeed my Lord hurls the truth. [He is] the Knower of the Unseen’.

Name: Saba
Verse: Say: ‘The truth has come. And falsehood neither originates nor restores [anything]’.

Name: Saba
Verse: Say: ‘If I go astray, I will be going astray only to my own loss, and if I am rightly guided, it will have been by what my Lord reveals to me. Truly He is Hearer. Nigh’.

Name: Saba
Verse: If you could but see when they are stricken with terror, and so there is no escape, and they are seized from a close quarter.

Name: Saba
Verse: And they will say, ‘We believe in him [now]’. But how can they attain [it] from a place that is far away,

Name: Saba
Verse: when they disbelieved in it before? And they throw guesses at the Unseen from a far-off place.

Name: Saba
Verse: And a barrier is set between them and what they crave, just as was done with their counterparts formerly. Indeed they used to be in grave doubt.

Name: The Angels
Verse: Praise be to God Originator of the heavens and the earth, Appointer of the angels as messengers, having wings in [sets of] two or three or four. He multiplies in creation what He will. Surely God has power over all things.

Name: The Angels
Verse: Whatever mercy God unfolds for mankind, none can withhold it; and whatever He withholds, none can release it after Him. And He is the Mighty, the Wise.

Name: The Angels
Verse: O people, remember God’s grace to you. Is there any creator other than God who provides for you from the heaven and earth? There is no god except Him. So how then do you deviate?

Name: The Angels
Verse: And if they deny you, verily [other] messengers before you were denied, and to God all matters are returned.

Name: The Angels
Verse: O mankind! Indeed God’s promise is true. So do not let the life of this world deceive you, and do not let the Deceiver deceive you concerning God.

Name: The Angels
Verse: Truly Satan is an enemy to you. So treat him as an enemy; he only summons his faction so that they may be among the inhabitants of the Blaze.

Name: The Angels
Verse: Those who disbelieve, theirs will be a severe chastisement; but those who believe and perform righteous deeds, theirs will be forgiveness and a great reward.

Name: The Angels
Verse: Is he, the evil of whose deeds is made [to seem] fair to him, so that he deems it good […]? Indeed God leads astray whomever He will and guides whomever He will. So do not let your soul expire for their sake out of sighings. Indeed God is Knower of what they do.

Name: The Angels
Verse: And it is God Who unleashes the winds and they raise clouds, then We drive them to a dead land, and therewith revive the earth after it has been dead. Such will be the Raising.

Name: The Angels
Verse: Whoever desires glory [should know that] all glory belongs to God. To Him ascends good words; and as for righteous action, He exalts it; but those who plot evil, theirs shall be a severe chastisement and their plotting shall come to nothing.

Name: The Angels
Verse: And God created you from dust, then from a drop of [seminal] fluid, then He made you pairs. And no female bears or brings forth except with His knowledge and no long-living person is given long life, nor is anything diminished of his life, but it is [recorded] in a Book. Surely that is easy for God.

Name: The Angels
Verse: Nor are the two [kinds of] seas alike: this one is extremely sweet, pleasant to drink and that one is salty, extremely bitter. Yet from each, you eat fresh meat, and obtain ornaments which you wear. And you see the ships therein ploughing through that you may seek of His bounty, and that perhaps you may give thanks.

Name: The Angels
Verse: He makes the night pass into the day, and He makes the day pass into the night, and He has disposed the sun and the moon, each moving to an appointed term. That is God, your Lord; to Him belongs [all] sovereignty. As for those on whom you call besides Him, they do not possess [even] so much as the husk of a date-stone.

Name: The Angels
Verse: If you call on them, they will not hear your call, and [even] if they heard they would not [be able to] respond to you; and on the Day of Resurrection they will disown your [idolatrous] associations. And none can inform you like One Who is Aware.

Name: The Angels
Verse: O mankind! You are the ones who are in need of God. And God, He is the Independent, the Praised.

Name: The Angels
Verse: If He will, He can take you away and bring about a new creation.

Name: The Angels
Verse: And that is not an arduous thing for God.

Name: The Angels
Verse: And no burdened soul shall bear the burden of another [sinful soul]. And should one burdened heavily call for its burden to be borne, nothing of it will be borne, even if [he] be a relative. You can only warn those who fear their Lord in secret and observe the prayer. For whoever purifies himself is purifying himself only for [the sake of] his own soul. And to God is the [end of the] journeying.

Name: The Angels
Verse: Nor are the blind and the seer equal,

Name: The Angels
Verse: nor darkness and light;

Name: The Angels
Verse: nor shade and torrid heat;

Name: The Angels
Verse: nor are the living equal to the dead. Indeed God makes to hear whomever He will. But you cannot make those who are in the graves to hear.

Name: The Angels
Verse: You are but a warner.

Name: The Angels
Verse: Truly We have sent you with the truth, as a bearer of good tidings, and a warner. And there is not a community but there has passed in it a warner.

Name: The Angels
Verse: And if they deny you, those before them also denied: their messengers brought them manifest signs, and with scriptures, and with the illuminating Book.

Name: The Angels
Verse: Then I seized those who disbelieved, and how was My abhorrence!

Name: The Angels
Verse: Have you not seen that God sends down water from the heaven, wherewith We bring forth fruits of diverse hues. And in the mountains are streaks white and red, of diverse hues, and [others] pitch-black?

Name: The Angels
Verse: And of humans and beasts and cattle, there are diverse hues likewise. Indeed only those of God’s servants who have knowledge fear Him. Truly God is Mighty, Forgiving.

Name: The Angels
Verse: Indeed those who recite the Book of God and observe prayer, and expend of what We have provided them secretly and openly, anticipate a commerce that will never be ruined,

Name: The Angels
Verse: that He may pay them in full their rewards and enrich them out of His bounty. Truly He is Forgiving, Appreciative.

Name: The Angels
Verse: And that which We have revealed to you of the Book is the truth, confirming what was [revealed] before it. Indeed, with regard to His servants, God is truly Aware and Seeing.

Name: The Angels
Verse: Then We gave the Book to those of Our servants whom We chose. Yet some of them are those who wrong themselves, and some of them are moderate, and some are those who take the lead in [performing] good works by the leave of God. That is the greatest favour!

Name: The Angels
Verse: Gardens of Eden into which they will be admitted, therein they will be adorned with bracelets of gold and pearls, and their garments therein will be of silk.

Name: The Angels
Verse: And they will say, ‘Praise be to God Who has removed grief from us. Truly our Lord is Forgiving, Appreciative,

Name: The Angels
Verse: Who out of His favour has made us to dwell in the Abode of [everlasting] Stay, wherein no toil shall touch us, nor shall we be touched by any fatigue’.

Name: The Angels
Verse: And as for those who disbelieve, there will be for them the fire of Hell: they will neither be done away with, so that they may die, nor will any [aspect] of its chastisement be lightened for them. In this way, We requite every ingrate.

Name: The Angels
Verse: While therein they will be crying out, ‘Our Lord! Bring us forth, and we will act righteously, other than how we used to act’. ‘Did We not give you long life, enough in which to take heed, for him who would take heed? And [moreover] the warner came to you, so taste now [this chastisement]! For the evildoers have no helper’.

Name: The Angels
Verse: Truly God is Knower of the Unseen of the heavens and the earth; truly He knows well what is in the breasts.

Name: The Angels
Verse: It is He Who made you successors in the earth. So whoever disbelieves, his disbelief will be to his own detriment. And their disbelief does not increase the disbelievers with their Lord [in anything] except disfavour. And their disbelief does not increase the disbelievers [in anything] except loss.

Name: The Angels
Verse: Say: ‘Have you considered your associates on whom you call, besides God? Show me what [part] of the earth they have created. Or do they have some partnership in the heavens?’ Or have We given them a scripture, so that they are [acting] upon a clear proof therefrom? Nay, but the evildoers promise one another nothing but delusion.

Name: The Angels
Verse: Truly God sustains the heavens and the earth lest they disappear. And if they were to disappear there is none that can sustain them after Him. Truly He is ever Forbearing, Forgiving.

Name: The Angels
Verse: And they swore by God their most solemn oaths, that if a warner were to come to them, they would be more readily guided than any one of the communities. But when a warner did come to them, this only increased them in aversion,

Name: The Angels
Verse: acting with disdain in the land and devising evil; and evil schemes will beset only their authors. So do they expect anything but the precedent of the ancients? Yet you will never find any change in God’s precedent, and you will never find any revision in God’s precedent.

Name: The Angels
Verse: Have they not travelled in the land and seen the nature of the consequence for those who were before them — and they were mightier than these in power? And God is not such that anything in the heavens or in the earth can escape Him. Truly He is ever Knower, Omnipotent.

Name: The Angels
Verse: Were God to take mankind to task for what they have acquired, He would not leave on its surface a single creature. But He reprieves them to an appointed term. And when their term comes — then truly [they will know that] God is ever Seer of His servants.

Name: Yâ Sîn
Verse: Yā sīn.

Name: Yâ Sîn
Verse: By the Definitive Qur’ān,

Name: Yâ Sîn
Verse: you are indeed of those sent [by God],

Name: Yâ Sîn
Verse: on a straight path.

Name: Yâ Sîn
Verse: A revelation from the Mighty, the Merciful,

Name: Yâ Sîn
Verse: that you may warn a people whose fathers were not warned, so they are oblivious.

Name: Yâ Sîn
Verse: The word has already proved true for most of them, for they will not believe.

Name: Yâ Sîn
Verse: Indeed We have put fetters around their necks, such that they are up to the chins so that their heads are upturned.

Name: Yâ Sîn
Verse: And We have set before them a barrier and behind them a barrier; so We have covered them, so they do not see.

Name: Yâ Sîn
Verse: And it is the same to them whether you warn them or do not warn them, they will not believe.

Name: Yâ Sîn
Verse: You can only warn him who follows the Remembrance, and fears the Compassionate One in secret; so give him the good tidings of forgiveness and a noble reward.

Name: Yâ Sîn
Verse: Truly it is We Who bring the dead to life, and record what they have sent ahead and their vestiges. And everything We have numbered in a clear register.

Name: Yâ Sîn
Verse: And strike for them as a similitude the inhabitants of the town, when the messengers came to it.

Name: Yâ Sîn
Verse: When We sent to them two men, and they denied them both, so We reinforced [them] with a third, and they said, ‘We have indeed been sent to you [by God]’.

Name: Yâ Sîn
Verse: They said, ‘You are nothing but humans like us, and the Compassionate One has revealed nothing. You are only lying!’

Name: Yâ Sîn
Verse: They said, ‘Our Lord knows that we have indeed been sent to you [by Him]!

Name: Yâ Sîn
Verse: And our duty is only to communicate in clear terms’.

Name: Yâ Sîn
Verse: They said, ‘We augur ill of you. If you do not desist, we will surely stone you and there shall befall you, at our hands, a painful chastisement’.

Name: Yâ Sîn
Verse: They said, ‘May your augury of ill be with you! What! [Even] if [it be that] you are being reminded? Nay, but you are a profligate people!’

Name: Yâ Sîn
Verse: And there came a man from the furthest part of the city, hastening. He said, ‘O my people, follow the messengers!

Name: Yâ Sîn
Verse: Follow them who do not ask you for any reward and who are rightly guided.

Name: Yâ Sîn
Verse: And why should I not worship Him Who originated me and to Whom you shall be returned?

Name: Yâ Sîn
Verse: Shall I take besides Him [other] gods, whose intercession, if the Compassionate One should wish me any harm, will not avail me in any way, nor will they [be able to] save me?

Name: Yâ Sîn
Verse: Truly then I would be in manifest error.

Name: Yâ Sîn
Verse: Lo! I believe in your Lord. So listen to me!’

Name: Yâ Sîn
Verse: It was said: ‘Enter Paradise!’ He said, ‘O would that my people knew.

Name: Yâ Sîn
Verse: with what [munificence] my Lord has forgiven me and made me of the honoured ones!’

Name: Yâ Sîn
Verse: And We did not send down on his people after him any host from the heaven, nor do We [ever] send down.

Name: Yâ Sîn
Verse: It was but one Cry and lo! they were extinguished.

Name: Yâ Sîn
Verse: Ah, the anguish for servants, never did a messenger come to them but that they mocked him.

Name: Yâ Sîn
Verse: Have they not seen, how many generations We have destroyed before them, [how] that they never return?

Name: Yâ Sîn
Verse: And indeed every one of them will be gathered before Us, arraigned.

Name: Yâ Sîn
Verse: And a sign for them is the dead earth which We revive and out of which We bring forth grain so that they eat thereof;

Name: Yâ Sîn
Verse: and We have placed therein gardens of date-palms and vines, and We have caused springs to gush forth therein,

Name: Yâ Sîn
Verse: that they might eat of its fruits; but it was not their hands that made it. Will they not then give thanks?

Name: Yâ Sîn
Verse: Glory be to Him Who created all the pairs of what the earth produces, and of themselves, and of what they do not know.

Name: Yâ Sîn
Verse: And a sign for them is the night, from which We strip the day and, behold, they find themselves in darkness.

Name: Yâ Sîn
Verse: And the sun [which] runs to its resting-place. That is the ordaining of the Mighty, the Knower.

Name: Yâ Sîn
Verse: And the moon We have determined it [to run] in phases until it returns, like an aged palm-bough.

Name: Yâ Sîn
Verse: It does not behove the sun to catch up with the moon, nor may the night outrun the day, and each [of these] is in an orbit, swimming.

Name: Yâ Sîn
Verse: And a sign for them is that We carried their seed in the laden Ark,

Name: Yâ Sîn
Verse: and We have created for them the like of it in which they ride.

Name: Yâ Sîn
Verse: And if We will, We drown them, whereat they have no one to call to, nor are they rescued,

Name: Yâ Sîn
Verse: except by a mercy from Us and for an enjoyment until some time.

Name: Yâ Sîn
Verse: And when it is said to them, ‘Beware of that which is before you, and that which is behind you that perhaps you might find mercy’.

Name: Yâ Sîn
Verse: And never did a sign of the signs of their Lord come to them, but that they turned away from it.

Name: Yâ Sîn
Verse: And when it is said to them, ‘Expend of what God has provided you’, those who disbelieve say to those who believe: ‘Are we to feed those whom, if God willed, He would feed? You are only in manifest error!’

Name: Yâ Sîn
Verse: And they say, ‘When will this promise be [fulfilled], if you are being truthful?’

Name: Yâ Sîn
Verse: They await but a single Cry that will seize them while they are disputing.

Name: Yâ Sîn
Verse: Then they will not be able to make any testament, nor will they return to their folk.

Name: Yâ Sîn
Verse: And the Trumpet is blown; and lo! they will be scrambling out of their graves towards their Lord.

Name: Yâ Sîn
Verse: They will say, ‘O woe to us! Who has raised us from our place of sleep? This is that which the Compassionate One had promised and the messengers had spoken the truth’.

Name: Yâ Sîn
Verse: It is but a single Cry, and, behold, they will all be arraigned before Us!

Name: Yâ Sîn
Verse: So today no soul shall be wronged in any way, and you shall not be requited, except what you used to do.

Name: Yâ Sîn
Verse: Indeed today the inhabitants of Paradise are busy rejoicing;

Name: Yâ Sîn
Verse: they and their spouses, beneath the shade, reclining upon couches.

Name: Yâ Sîn
Verse: They have fruits therein and they have whatever they call for.

Name: Yâ Sîn
Verse: “Peace!” — the word from a Lord [Who is] Merciful.

Name: Yâ Sîn
Verse: ‘And Stand apart, O you sinners, on this day!

Name: Yâ Sîn
Verse: Did I not charge you O children of Adam that you should not worship Satan; truly he is a manifest enemy to you,

Name: Yâ Sîn
Verse: and that [you should] worship Me — that is the straight path?

Name: Yâ Sîn
Verse: For verily he has led astray from among you many a creature. Did you not use to comprehend?

Name: Yâ Sîn
Verse: This is Hell, which you were promised!

Name: Yâ Sîn
Verse: Burn therein today [as chastisement] for that which you used to reject!’

Name: Yâ Sîn
Verse: Today We shall seal up their mouths, and their hands shall speak to Us, and their feet shall bear witness concerning what they used to earn.

Name: Yâ Sîn
Verse: And had We willed We would have obliterated their eyesight, then they [would have tried to] advance towards the path, but how would they have seen?

Name: Yâ Sîn
Verse: And had We willed We would have transformed them in their place; then they would have neither been able to go ahead nor to return.

Name: Yâ Sîn
Verse: And whomever We give long life, We cause him to regress in creation. Will they then not understand?

Name: Yâ Sîn
Verse: And We did not teach him poetry, nor is it seemly for him. It is just Remembrance and a Qur’ān that clarifies,

Name: Yâ Sîn
Verse: that he may warn whoever is alive, and that the Word may be fulfilled against the disbelievers.

Name: Yâ Sîn
Verse: Or, have they not seen that We have created for them of what Our hands worked cattle, so that they are their owners?

Name: Yâ Sîn
Verse: And We have subdued these [cattle] for them, so that some of them provide rides for them and some of them they eat.

Name: Yâ Sîn
Verse: And there are other benefits for them therein and drinks. Will they not then give thanks?

Name: Yâ Sîn
Verse: And they have taken besides God [other] gods that perhaps they might be helped.

Name: Yâ Sîn
Verse: They cannot help them and they are their host, ever-present.

Name: Yâ Sîn
Verse: So do not be grieved by their remarks. Assuredly We know what they conceal and what they proclaim.

Name: Yâ Sîn
Verse: Or has man not seen that We created him from a drop. Then lo! he is an open adversary.

Name: Yâ Sîn
Verse: And he strikes for Us a similitude and forgets [the manner of] his creation; he says, ‘Who will revive the bones when they are rot?’

Name: Yâ Sîn
Verse: Say: ‘He will revive them Who originated them the first time, and He is Knower of all creation,

Name: Yâ Sîn
Verse: He Who has made for you fire from the green tree, and, behold, from it you kindle’.

Name: Yâ Sîn
Verse: Is not He Who created the heavens and the earth able to create the like of them? And He is the Creator, the Knower.

Name: Yâ Sîn
Verse: His command when He wills a thing, is just to say to it ‘Be’, and it is.

Name: Yâ Sîn
Verse: So glory be to Him in Whose hand is the dominion of all things and to Whom you will be returned.

Name: Those Who Set The Ranks
Verse: By those who are ranged in ranks

Name: Those Who Set The Ranks
Verse: and the drivers who drive [away]

Name: Those Who Set The Ranks
Verse: and those who recite by way remembrance.

Name: Those Who Set The Ranks
Verse: Indeed your God is certainly One,

Name: Those Who Set The Ranks
Verse: Lord of the heavens and the earth and all that is between them, and Lord of the sun’s risings.

Name: Those Who Set The Ranks
Verse: We have indeed adorned the lowest heaven with an adornment, the stars,

Name: Those Who Set The Ranks
Verse: and to guard from every any rebellious devil.

Name: Those Who Set The Ranks
Verse: They cannot listen in on the High Council, for they are pelted from every side

Name: Those Who Set The Ranks
Verse: to repel [them], and theirs is an everlasting chastisement;

Name: Those Who Set The Ranks
Verse: except him who snatches a fragment, and who is then pursued by a piercing flame.

Name: Those Who Set The Ranks
Verse: So ask them: Are they stronger as a creation, or those [others] whom We created? Indeed We created them from a viscous clay.

Name: Those Who Set The Ranks
Verse: Nay, but you marvel, while they engage in ridicule,

Name: Those Who Set The Ranks
Verse: and [even] when they are reminded, they are not mindful,

Name: Those Who Set The Ranks
Verse: and when they see a sign, they make it an object of ridicule.

Name: Those Who Set The Ranks
Verse: And they say: ‘This is nothing but manifest sorcery.

Name: Those Who Set The Ranks
Verse: When we are dead and have become dust and bones, shall we indeed be resurrected?

Name: Those Who Set The Ranks
Verse: And our forefathers too?’

Name: Those Who Set The Ranks
Verse: Say: ‘Yes, and you will be utterly humiliated!’

Name: Those Who Set The Ranks
Verse: For it will be only a single cry and, lo! they will be watching.

Name: Those Who Set The Ranks
Verse: And they will say, ‘O woe to us!’ ‘This is the Day of Retribution’.

Name: Those Who Set The Ranks
Verse: ‘This is the Day of Judgement that you used to deny!’

Name: Those Who Set The Ranks
Verse: ‘Gather those who did wrong together with their mates and what they used to worship

Name: Those Who Set The Ranks
Verse: besides God and lead them to the path of Hell.

Name: Those Who Set The Ranks
Verse: But [first] stop them, for they must be questioned.

Name: Those Who Set The Ranks
Verse: “What is wrong with you that you do not help one another?”

Name: Those Who Set The Ranks
Verse: Nay, but today they offer complete submission.

Name: Those Who Set The Ranks
Verse: And some of them will turn to others, questioning each other.

Name: Those Who Set The Ranks
Verse: They will say: ‘Indeed you used to approach us from the right’.

Name: Those Who Set The Ranks
Verse: They say: ‘On the contrary! You were [simply] not believers.

Name: Those Who Set The Ranks
Verse: And we did not have any warrant over you. Nay, but you [yourselves] were a rebellious folk.

Name: Those Who Set The Ranks
Verse: So our Lord’s Words have become due against us. Indeed we shall taste [the doom];

Name: Those Who Set The Ranks
Verse: So we led you astray: Indeed we [ourselves] were astray’.

Name: Those Who Set The Ranks
Verse: So they on that day will share in the chastisement.

Name: Those Who Set The Ranks
Verse: Indeed so We deal with sinners.

Name: Those Who Set The Ranks
Verse: For truly it was they who, when it was said to them, ‘There is no god except God’, used to be scornful,

Name: Those Who Set The Ranks
Verse: and would say, ‘Are we to abandon our gods for a mad poet?’

Name: Those Who Set The Ranks
Verse: Nay, but he has brought [them] the truth and confirmed the [earlier] messengers.

Name: Those Who Set The Ranks
Verse: ‘You shall certainly taste the painful chastisement,

Name: Those Who Set The Ranks
Verse: and you will only be requited what you used to do’,

Name: Those Who Set The Ranks
Verse: Except for God’s sincere servants;

Name: Those Who Set The Ranks
Verse: For them there will be a distinct provision,

Name: Those Who Set The Ranks
Verse: fruits and they will honoured

Name: Those Who Set The Ranks
Verse: in the Gardens of Bliss,

Name: Those Who Set The Ranks
Verse: they are served from all round with a cup from a spring,

Name: Those Who Set The Ranks
Verse: white, delicious to the drinkers,

Name: Those Who Set The Ranks
Verse: wherein there is neither madness, nor will they be spent by it,

Name: Those Who Set The Ranks
Verse: and with them will be maidens of restrained glances with beautiful eyes,

Name: Those Who Set The Ranks
Verse: as if they were hidden eggs.

Name: Those Who Set The Ranks
Verse: Some of them will turn to others, questioning each other.

Name: Those Who Set The Ranks
Verse: One of them will say, ‘Indeed I had a comrade,

Name: Those Who Set The Ranks
Verse: who used to say, “Are you really among those who affirm as truth,

Name: Those Who Set The Ranks
Verse: He says, ‘Will you have a look?’

Name: Those Who Set The Ranks
Verse: Then he will take a look and he will catch sight of him in the centre of Hell.

Name: Those Who Set The Ranks
Verse: He will say, ‘By God! You very nearly destroyed me.

Name: Those Who Set The Ranks
Verse: And had it not been for the favour of my Lord, I [too] would have been of those arraigned’.

Name: Those Who Set The Ranks
Verse: Do we then not die [anymore],

Name: Those Who Set The Ranks
Verse: aside from our first death, and are we not to be chastised?’

Name: Those Who Set The Ranks
Verse: Truly this is indeed the mighty success.

Name: Those Who Set The Ranks
Verse: For the like of this let [all] the workers work.

Name: Those Who Set The Ranks
Verse: Is that a better hospitality or the Zaqqūm tree.

Name: Those Who Set The Ranks
Verse: We have indeed made it a trial for the wrongdoers?’

Name: Those Who Set The Ranks
Verse: Indeed it is a tree that comes forth from the very source of Hell.

Name: Those Who Set The Ranks
Verse: Its spathes are like the heads of devils.

Name: Those Who Set The Ranks
Verse: And indeed they will eat of it, and will fill their bellies from it.

Name: Those Who Set The Ranks
Verse: Then, lo!, on top of it they will have a brew of boiling water.

Name: Those Who Set The Ranks
Verse: Then indeed their return shall be to Hell-fire.

Name: Those Who Set The Ranks
Verse: Lo! they found their fathers to be astray,

Name: Those Who Set The Ranks
Verse: and so they are [also now] hurrying in their footsteps.

Name: Those Who Set The Ranks
Verse: And verily most of the ancients went astray before them,

Name: Those Who Set The Ranks
Verse: and We certainly had sent among them warners.

Name: Those Who Set The Ranks
Verse: So behold how was the consequence for them who were warned,

Name: Those Who Set The Ranks
Verse: And verily Noah called to Us, and how excellent were the Hearers of the prayer.

Name: Those Who Set The Ranks
Verse: And We delivered him and his family from the great distress,

Name: Those Who Set The Ranks
Verse: and made his descendants the survivors.

Name: Those Who Set The Ranks
Verse: And We left for him among posterity:

Name: Those Who Set The Ranks
Verse: ‘Peace be to Noah among the worlds!’

Name: Those Who Set The Ranks
Verse: Thus indeed We requite the virtuous.

Name: Those Who Set The Ranks
Verse: He was indeed one of Our faithful servants.

Name: Those Who Set The Ranks
Verse: Then We did drown the others.

Name: Those Who Set The Ranks
Verse: And truly of his adherents was Abraham.

Name: Those Who Set The Ranks
Verse: When he came to his Lord with a heart that was pure,

Name: Those Who Set The Ranks
Verse: when he said to his father and his folk, ‘What do you worship?

Name: Those Who Set The Ranks
Verse: Is it a calumny — gods other than God — that you desire?

Name: Those Who Set The Ranks
Verse: What then is your supposition regarding the Lord of the Worlds?’

Name: Those Who Set The Ranks
Verse: And he cast a glance at the stars

Name: Those Who Set The Ranks
Verse: and said, ‘Indeed I feel [I will be] sick’.

Name: Those Who Set The Ranks
Verse: So they went away, leaving him behind.

Name: Those Who Set The Ranks
Verse: Then he turned to their gods and said, ‘Will you not eat?

Name: Those Who Set The Ranks
Verse: What is wrong with you that you do not speak?’

Name: Those Who Set The Ranks
Verse: He then turned on them striking [them] with his right hand.

Name: Those Who Set The Ranks
Verse: So they came running towards him.

Name: Those Who Set The Ranks
Verse: He said, ‘Do you worship what you [yourselves] have carved,

Name: Those Who Set The Ranks
Verse: when God created you and whatever you make?’

Name: Those Who Set The Ranks
Verse: They said, ‘Build for him a structure, then cast him into the fierce fire’.

Name: Those Who Set The Ranks
Verse: So they sought to outwit him, but We made them the lowermost.

Name: Those Who Set The Ranks
Verse: And he said, ‘I shall indeed depart to my Lord, He will guide me.

Name: Those Who Set The Ranks
Verse: My Lord! Grant me of the righteous’.

Name: Those Who Set The Ranks
Verse: So We gave him the good tidings of a forbearing son.

Name: Those Who Set The Ranks
Verse: And when he was old enough to walk with him, he said, ‘O my dear son, I see in a dream that I shall sacrifice you. So see what you think’. He said, ‘O my father do whatever you have been commanded. You shall find me, God willing, of the steadfast’.

Name: Those Who Set The Ranks
Verse: And when they had both submitted, and he had laid him down on his forehead,

Name: Those Who Set The Ranks
Verse: We called to him, ‘O Abraham!

Name: Those Who Set The Ranks
Verse: Verily you have fulfilled the vision’. So do We reward those who are virtuous.

Name: Those Who Set The Ranks
Verse: Truly this was indeed a clear test’.

Name: Those Who Set The Ranks
Verse: Then We ransomed him with a mighty sacrifice.

Name: Those Who Set The Ranks
Verse: And We left for him among posterity:

Name: Those Who Set The Ranks
Verse: ‘Peace be to Abraham!’

Name: Those Who Set The Ranks
Verse: So do We reward those who are virtuous.

Name: Those Who Set The Ranks
Verse: Indeed he is one of Our faithful servants.

Name: Those Who Set The Ranks
Verse: And We gave him the good tidings of [the birth of] Isaac a prophet, one of the righteous.

Name: Those Who Set The Ranks
Verse: And We blessed him and Isaac. And among their descendants is he who is virtuous, and he who plainly wrongs his soul.

Name: Those Who Set The Ranks
Verse: And verily We favoured Moses and Aaron,

Name: Those Who Set The Ranks
Verse: and We delivered them and their people from the great distress.

Name: Those Who Set The Ranks
Verse: And We helped them so that they became the victors.

Name: Those Who Set The Ranks
Verse: And We gave them the enlightening scripture.

Name: Those Who Set The Ranks
Verse: And We guided them to the straight path,,

Name: Those Who Set The Ranks
Verse: and We left for them among posterity:

Name: Those Who Set The Ranks
Verse: ‘Peace be to Moses and Aaron!’

Name: Those Who Set The Ranks
Verse: So do We reward the virtuous.

Name: Those Who Set The Ranks
Verse: Indeed both were among Our faithful servants.

Name: Those Who Set The Ranks
Verse: And truly Elias was [also] one of the messengers.

Name: Those Who Set The Ranks
Verse: When he said to his people, ‘Will you not fear [God]?

Name: Those Who Set The Ranks
Verse: Do you call on Baal and abandon the Best of Creators,

Name: Those Who Set The Ranks
Verse: God, your Lord, and the Lord of your forefathers?’

Name: Those Who Set The Ranks
Verse: But they denied him. So they will indeed be arraigned

Name: Those Who Set The Ranks
Verse: — [all] except God’s delivered servants,

Name: Those Who Set The Ranks
Verse: and We left for him among posterity:

Name: Those Who Set The Ranks
Verse: ‘Peace be to Elias!’

Name: Those Who Set The Ranks
Verse: Indeed so do We reward the virtuous.

Name: Those Who Set The Ranks
Verse: Truly he is one of Our faithful servants.

Name: Those Who Set The Ranks
Verse: And indeed Lot was one of the messengers;

Name: Those Who Set The Ranks
Verse: when We delivered him together with all his family,

Name: Those Who Set The Ranks
Verse: except an old woman [who was] among those who stayed behind.

Name: Those Who Set The Ranks
Verse: Then We destroyed [all] the others.

Name: Those Who Set The Ranks
Verse: And indeed you pass by them, [both] in the morning,

Name: Those Who Set The Ranks
Verse: and at night: will you not then understand?

Name: Those Who Set The Ranks
Verse: And indeed Jonah was one of the messengers;

Name: Those Who Set The Ranks
Verse: when he fled to the laden ship.

Name: Those Who Set The Ranks
Verse: Then he drew lots and was of those rejected.

Name: Those Who Set The Ranks
Verse: Then the whale swallowed him while he was blameworthy.

Name: Those Who Set The Ranks
Verse: And had he not been one of those who glorify [God],

Name: Those Who Set The Ranks
Verse: he would have tarried in its belly until the day when they are raised.

Name: Those Who Set The Ranks
Verse: Then We cast him onto the barren land, and he was sick.

Name: Those Who Set The Ranks
Verse: And We made a gourd plant to grow above him.

Name: Those Who Set The Ranks
Verse: And We sent him to a [community of a] hundred thousand or more.

Name: Those Who Set The Ranks
Verse: And they believed. So We gave them comfort for a while.

Name: Those Who Set The Ranks
Verse: So ask them: Are daughters to be for your Lord, while sons are to be for them?

Name: Those Who Set The Ranks
Verse: Or did We create the angels females while they were witnesses?

Name: Those Who Set The Ranks
Verse: Lo! it is indeed out of their [own] mendacity that they say,

Name: Those Who Set The Ranks
Verse: ‘God has begotten’. And verily they are liars.

Name: Those Who Set The Ranks
Verse: Has He preferred daughters to sons?

Name: Those Who Set The Ranks
Verse: What is wrong with you? How do you judge?

Name: Those Who Set The Ranks
Verse: Will you not then remember?

Name: Those Who Set The Ranks
Verse: Or do you have a clear warrant?

Name: Those Who Set The Ranks
Verse: Then produce your scripture, if you are being truthful.

Name: Those Who Set The Ranks
Verse: And they have set up between Him and the jinn a kinship, while the jinn certainly know that they shall indeed be arraigned.

Name: Those Who Set The Ranks
Verse: Glory be to God above what they attribute

Name: Those Who Set The Ranks
Verse: — [all] except God’s devoted servants.

Name: Those Who Set The Ranks
Verse: For indeed you and what you worship

Name: Those Who Set The Ranks
Verse: — you cannot tempt thereto,

Name: Those Who Set The Ranks
Verse: except him who will burn in Hell.

Name: Those Who Set The Ranks
Verse: And there is not one of us, but has a known station.

Name: Those Who Set The Ranks
Verse: And indeed it is we who are the rangers.

Name: Those Who Set The Ranks
Verse: And indeed it is we who give glory.

Name: Those Who Set The Ranks
Verse: And indeed they used to say,

Name: Those Who Set The Ranks
Verse: ‘If we had but a reminder from the ancients,

Name: Those Who Set The Ranks
Verse: we would have surely been God’s devoted servants’.

Name: Those Who Set The Ranks
Verse: Yet they disbelieved in it, but they will come to know.

Name: Those Who Set The Ranks
Verse: And verily Our Word has gone beforehand in favour of Our servants, the messengers

Name: Those Who Set The Ranks
Verse: — assuredly they shall be helped,

Name: Those Who Set The Ranks
Verse: and assuredly Our hosts, they will indeed be the victors.

Name: Those Who Set The Ranks
Verse: So leave them for a while

Name: Those Who Set The Ranks
Verse: and watch them; for they will [soon] see.

Name: Those Who Set The Ranks
Verse: Do they seek to hasten Our chastisement?

Name: Those Who Set The Ranks
Verse: But when it descends in their courtyard, how awful will be the morning for those who were warned.

Name: Those Who Set The Ranks
Verse: So leave them for a while,

Name: Those Who Set The Ranks
Verse: and watch; for they will [soon] see.

Name: Those Who Set The Ranks
Verse: Glory be to your Lord, the Lord of Might, [exalted is He] above what they allege!

Name: Those Who Set The Ranks
Verse: And peace be to the messengers.

Name: Those Who Set The Ranks
Verse: And praise be to God, Lord of the Worlds.

Name: Sâd
Verse: Sād. By the Qur’ān bearing the Remembrance,

Name: Sâd
Verse: Nay, but those who disbelieve dwell in conceit and defiance.

Name: Sâd
Verse: How many a generation We have destroyed before them, and they cried out when it was no longer the time for escape.

Name: Sâd
Verse: And they marvel that a warner has come to them from among themselves. And those who disbelieve say, ‘This is a sorcerer, a liar.

Name: Sâd
Verse: Has he made the gods One God? Lo! that is indeed a curious thing’.

Name: Sâd
Verse: And the council from among them go about, saying, ‘Go!, and stand by your gods; lo! this is indeed a thing sought.

Name: Sâd
Verse: We never heard of this in the latter-day creed. This is surely [nothing] but an invention.

Name: Sâd
Verse: Has the Remembrance been revealed to him out of [all of] us’. Nay, but they are in doubt concerning My Remembrance. Nay, but they have not yet tasted My chastisement.

Name: Sâd
Verse: Or do they possess the treasuries of your Lord’s mercy, the Mighty, the Bestower?

Name: Sâd
Verse: Or do they possess the kingdom of the heavens and the earth and whatever is between them? Then let them ascend by the means.

Name: Sâd
Verse: A routed host [is all that they are], nothing more from among the factions.

Name: Sâd
Verse: Before them the people of Noah denied, and [so did those of] ‘ād and Pharaoh, he of the stakes

Name: Sâd
Verse: and Thamūd and the people of Lot and the dwellers in the wood — those were the factions.

Name: Sâd
Verse: Each one did not but deny the messengers. So My retribution was justified.

Name: Sâd
Verse: And these do not await but a single Cry for which there will be no revoking.

Name: Sâd
Verse: And they said, ‘Our Lord, hasten on for us the record of our deeds before the Day of Reckoning’.

Name: Sâd
Verse: Bear patiently what they say and remember Our servant David, the one of fortitude. Indeed he was a penitent [soul].

Name: Sâd
Verse: Truly We disposed the mountains to glorify [God] with him at evening and at sunrise.

Name: Sâd
Verse: And the birds, mustered [in flocks], each turning to him.

Name: Sâd
Verse: And We strengthened his Kingdom, and gave him wisdom and decisive speech.

Name: Sâd
Verse: And has there come to you the tale of the disputants, when they scaled the sanctuary?

Name: Sâd
Verse: When they entered upon David, and he was frightened by them. And they said, ‘Do not fear two disputants. One of us has infringed upon the [rights of the] other, so judge justly between us and do not transgress, and guide us to the right path’.

Name: Sâd
Verse: ‘Behold, this brother of mine has ninety-nine ewes, while I have a single ewe; yet he said, “Entrust it to me”, and he overcame me in speech’.

Name: Sâd
Verse: He said, ‘He has certainly wronged you by asking for your ewe that he may add it to his sheep. And indeed many associates infringe upon [the rights of] one another, except such as believe and perform righteous deeds, but few are they!’. And David thought that We had indeed tried him. So he sought forgiveness of his Lord and fell down bowing and repented.

Name: Sâd
Verse: So We forgave him that and indeed he has [a station of] nearness with Us and a fair return.

Name: Sâd
Verse: ‘O David! We have indeed made you a vicegerent on the earth; so judge justly between people and do not follow desire that it then lead you astray from the way of God. Truly those who go astray from the way of God — for them there will be a severe chastisement because of their forgetting the Day of Reckoning’.

Name: Sâd
Verse: And We did not create the heavens and the earth and all that is between them in vain. That is the supposition of those who disbelieve. So woe to the disbelievers from the Fire!

Name: Sâd
Verse: Or shall We treat those who believe and perform righteous deeds like those who cause corruption in the earth; or shall We treat the God-fearing like the profligate?

Name: Sâd
Verse: A Book that We have revealed to you, full of blessing, that they may contemplate its signs and that they may remember those people of pith.

Name: Sâd
Verse: And We bestowed on David, Solomon — what an excellent servant! Truly he was a penitent [soul].

Name: Sâd
Verse: When one evening there were displayed before him the prancing steeds.

Name: Sâd
Verse: He said, ‘Lo! I have loved the love of [worldly] good things over the remembrance of my Lord’, until it disappeared behind the [night’s] veil.

Name: Sâd
Verse: Bring them back to me! Then he set about slashing [their] legs and necks.

Name: Sâd
Verse: And We certainly tried Solomon. And We cast upon his throne a [lifeless] body. Then he repented.

Name: Sâd
Verse: He said, ‘My Lord! Forgive me and grant me a kingdom that shall not belong to anyone after me. Truly You are the Bestower’.

Name: Sâd
Verse: So We disposed for him the wind, which blew softly at his command wherever he intended.

Name: Sâd
Verse: And the devils [also We disposed], every builder, and diver,

Name: Sâd
Verse: and others too, bounded together in fetters.

Name: Sâd
Verse: ‘This is Our gift. So bestow or withhold without any reckoning’.

Name: Sâd
Verse: And indeed he has [a station of] nearness with Us and a fair resort.

Name: Sâd
Verse: And mention also Our servant Job, when he called out to his Lord, ‘Lo! Satan has afflicted me with hardship and suffering’.

Name: Sâd
Verse: ‘Stamp your foot. This is a cool bath and a drink’.

Name: Sâd
Verse: And We gave him [back] his family along with others like them, as a mercy from us, and a reminder to people of pith.

Name: Sâd
Verse: And [We said to him], ‘Take in your hand a bunch of twigs, and smite therewith, and do not break [your] oath’. Truly We found him to be steadfast. What an excellent servant! Indeed he was a penitent [soul].

Name: Sâd
Verse: And mention [also] Our servants Abraham, and Isaac and Jacob — men of fortitude and insight.

Name: Sâd
Verse: Assuredly We purified them with an exclusive [thought], the remembrance of the Abode.

Name: Sâd
Verse: And indeed in Our sight they are of the elect, the excellent.

Name: Sâd
Verse: And mention [also] Our servants Ishmael, and Elisha, and Dhū’l-Kifl. Each was among the excellent.

Name: Sâd
Verse: This is a remembrance; and indeed for the God-fearing, there will truly be a fair return —

Name: Sâd
Verse: Gardens of Eden whose gates are [flung] open for them;

Name: Sâd
Verse: reclining therein; therein they call for plenteous fruit and drink.

Name: Sâd
Verse: And with them [there] will be maidens of restrained glances of a like age.

Name: Sâd
Verse: ‘This is what you are promised for the Day of Reckoning.

Name: Sâd
Verse: This is indeed Our provision, which will never be exhausted’.

Name: Sâd
Verse: That [is so]; but for the insolent there will surely be an evil [place of] return —

Name: Sâd
Verse: Hell, which they will enter — an evil resting place!

Name: Sâd
Verse: This, let them then taste it: burning hot water, and pus,

Name: Sâd
Verse: and other kinds [of torment] resembling it in pairs.

Name: Sâd
Verse: ‘This is a horde about to plunge with you: No welcome [is there] for them [here]! They will indeed roast in the Fire’.

Name: Sâd
Verse: They say, ‘Nay, but for you [there is] no welcome! You prepared this for us. So what an evil abode!’.

Name: Sâd
Verse: They say, ‘Our Lord, whoever prepared this for us, give him double his chastisement in the Fire!’

Name: Sâd
Verse: And they say: ‘What is the matter with us that we do not see [here] men whom we used to count among the wicked?

Name: Sâd
Verse: Did we treat them mockingly? Or have [our] eyes missed them [here]?’

Name: Sâd
Verse: Assuredly that is true: the wrangling of the inhabitants of the Fire.

Name: Sâd
Verse: Say: ‘I am only a warner. And there is no god except God, the One, the All-Compelling;

Name: Sâd
Verse: Lord of the heavens and the earth and all that is between them, the Mighty, the [ever] Forgiving’.

Name: Sâd
Verse: Say: ‘It is a tremendous tiding

Name: Sâd
Verse: from which you are turning away.

Name: Sâd
Verse: I had no knowledge of the High Council when they disputed.

Name: Sâd
Verse: All that is revealed to me is that I am just a plain warner’.

Name: Sâd
Verse: When your Lord said to the angels, ‘Indeed I am about to create a human being out of clay.

Name: Sâd
Verse: So when I have proportioned him, and breathed in him My spirit, then fall down in prostration before him!’

Name: Sâd
Verse: Thereat the angels prostrated, all of them together,

Name: Sâd
Verse: except Iblīs; he was disdainful and he was one of the disbelievers.

Name: Sâd
Verse: He said, ‘O Iblīs! What prevents you from prostrating before that which I have created with My own hands? Are you being arrogant, or are you of the exalted?’

Name: Sâd
Verse: He said, ‘I am better than him. You created me from fire and You created him from clay’.

Name: Sâd
Verse: He said, ‘Then begone hence, for you are indeed accursed.

Name: Sâd
Verse: And indeed My curse shall be on you until the Day of Judgement’.

Name: Sâd
Verse: He said, ‘My Lord, then reprieve me until the day when they will be raised’.

Name: Sâd
Verse: He said, ‘Then you will indeed be among the reprieved

Name: Sâd
Verse: until the day of the known time’.

Name: Sâd
Verse: He said, ‘Now, by Your might, I shall surely pervert them all,

Name: Sâd
Verse: except those servants of Yours among them who will be saved’.

Name: Sâd
Verse: He said, ‘So the truth is — and the truth I [always] speak,

Name: Sâd
Verse: I shall assuredly fill Hell with you and with whoever of them follows you, all together’.

Name: Sâd
Verse: Say: ‘I do not ask of you, in return for this any reward; nor am I an impostor.

Name: Sâd
Verse: It is only a reminder for all worlds.

Name: Sâd
Verse: And you will assuredly come to know its tiding in [due] time’.

Name: The Troops
Verse: The revelation of the Book is from God, the Mighty, the Wise.

Name: The Troops
Verse: Indeed We have revealed to you the Book with the truth; so worship God, devoting your religion purely to Him.

Name: The Troops
Verse: Surely to God belongs pure religion. And those who take besides Him patrons, [say]: ‘We only worship them so that they may bring us near to God’. God will indeed judge between them concerning that about which they differ. Truly God does not guide one who is a liar, a disbeliever.

Name: The Troops
Verse: Had God wanted to take a son, He could have chosen from what He has created whatever He willed. Glory be to Him. He is God, the One, the All-Compelling.

Name: The Troops
Verse: He created the heavens and the earth with the truth. He turns the night into day, and turns the day into night, and He has disposed the sun and the moon, each running for an appointed term. Verily it is He Who is the Mighty, the [ever] Forgiving.

Name: The Troops
Verse: He created you from a single soul, then made from it its mate; and He sent down for you of the cattle, eight kinds. He creates you in your mothers’ wombs, creation after creation in a threefold darkness. That is God, your Lord. To Him belongs [all] sovereignty. There is no god except Him. Why then are you being turned away?

Name: The Troops
Verse: If you are ungrateful, indeed God is Independent of you, though He does not approve of ingratitude for His servants. And if you give thanks, He will approve of it for you. And no burdened soul shall bear the burden of another [soul]. Then to your Lord will be your return, whereat He will inform you of what you used to do. Indeed He is Knower of what is in the breasts.

Name: The Troops
Verse: And when distress befalls a person, he supplicates his Lord, turning to Him penitently. Then, when He bestows on him a grace from Himself, he forgets Him Whom he had supplicated before and sets up equals with God, that he may lead [others] astray from His way: ‘Revel in your ingratitude for a while. You shall indeed be among the inhabitants of the Fire’.

Name: The Troops
Verse: Or is he who devotes himself [in worship] in the watches of the night, prostrating and standing, apprehensive of the [eventuality of the] Hereafter, and hoping for the mercy of his Lord … ? Say: ‘Are those who know equal with those who do not know?’ Only people of pith remember.

Name: The Troops
Verse: Say: ‘O servants of Mine who believe! Fear your Lord. For those who are virtuous in this world, there will be good, and God’s earth is vast. Truly the steadfast will be paid their reward in full without any reckoning’.

Name: The Troops
Verse: Say: ‘Indeed I have been commanded to worship God devoting [my] religion purely to Him,

Name: The Troops
Verse: and I have been commanded to be the first of those who submit’.

Name: The Troops
Verse: Say: ‘Indeed, should I disobey my Lord, I fear the chastisement of a tremendous day’.

Name: The Troops
Verse: Say: ‘God [alone] I worship, devoting [my] religion purely to Him.

Name: The Troops
Verse: So worship whatever you wish besides Him’. Say: ‘Indeed the losers are those who [will] have lost their souls and their families on the Day of Resurrection. Truly that is the manifest loss!’

Name: The Troops
Verse: Above them they will have canopies of fire, and beneath them [they will have [similar] canopies. That is what God frightens His servants with, “So, O servants of Mine, fear Me!” ’

Name: The Troops
Verse: As for those who steer clear of the worship of false deities and turn penitently to God, there are good tidings for them. So give [such] good tidings to My servants,

Name: The Troops
Verse: who listen to the words [of God] and follow the best [sense] of it. Those, they are the ones whom God has guided; and those, they are the people of pith.

Name: The Troops
Verse: Can he against whom the word of chastisement has been fulfilled …; Will you deliver one who is in the Fire?

Name: The Troops
Verse: But as for those who fear their Lord, for them there will be lofty abodes with [other] lofty abodes built above them, with rivers flowing beneath them — a promise of God. God does not fail the tryst.

Name: The Troops
Verse: Have you not seen that God sends down water from the heaven, then conducts it as springs in the ground? Then with it He brings forth crops of diverse hues. Then they wither and you see them turning yellow. Then He turns them into chaff. Truly in that there is a reminder for people of pith.

Name: The Troops
Verse: Is he whose breast God has opened to Islam, so that he follows a light from his Lord [like he who disbelieves]? So woe to those whose hearts have been hardened against the remembrance of God. Such are in manifest error.

Name: The Troops
Verse: God has revealed the best of discourses, a Book, consimilar in coupled phrases — whereat quiver the skins of those who fear their Lord; then their skins and their hearts soften to the remembrance of God. That is God’s guidance, by which He guides whomever He will; and whomever God leads astray, for him there is no guide.

Name: The Troops
Verse: Is he who will be fending off with his face the awful chastisement on the Day of Resurrection [as he who does right]? And it will be said to the wrongdoers: ‘Taste [now] what you used to earn’.

Name: The Troops
Verse: Those who were before them denied, and so the chastisement came on them whence they were not aware.

Name: The Troops
Verse: So God made them taste disgrace in the life of this world. And the chastisement of the Hereafter will surely be greater, had they known.

Name: The Troops
Verse: And verily We have struck for mankind in this Qur’ān every [kind of] similitude, that perhaps they may remember

Name: The Troops
Verse: an Arabic Qur’ān without any deviation that perhaps they may guard themselves.

Name: The Troops
Verse: God strikes a similitude: a man shared by several [masters], quarrelling, and a man belonging exclusively to one man. Are the two equal in comparison? Praise be to God! Nay, but most of them do not know.

Name: The Troops
Verse: You will indeed die, and they [too] will indeed die.

Name: The Troops
Verse: Then you will indeed be contending before your Lord on the Day of Resurrection.

Name: The Troops
Verse: So who is a greater wrongdoer than he who imputes falsehood to God and [who] denies the truth when it reaches him? Is there not a [fitting] abode in Hell for the disbelievers?

Name: The Troops
Verse: And he who brings the truth and [those] who confirm it, those, they are the ones who guard themselves.

Name: The Troops
Verse: They shall have whatever they wish with their Lord. That is the reward of those who are virtuous,

Name: The Troops
Verse: so that God may absolve them of the worst of what they did, and pay them their reward by the best of what they used to do.

Name: The Troops
Verse: Does God not suffice [as defender of] His servant? Yet they would frighten you of those besides Him. And whomever God leads astray, for him there is no guide.

Name: The Troops
Verse: But whomever God guides, there is no one [able] to lead him astray. Is not God Mighty, a Lord of Retribution?

Name: The Troops
Verse: And if you ask them, ‘Who created the heavens and the earth?’ they will surely say, ‘God’. Say: ‘Have you considered then those on whom you call, besides God, if God should desire some harm to befall me, would they [be able to] remove the harm imposed by Him? Or if He should desire some mercy for me, would they [be able to] withhold His mercy?’ Say: ‘God is sufficient for me. In Him do [all] the trusting put their trust’.

Name: The Troops
Verse: Say: ‘O my people! Act according to your situation; I [too] am acting. For you will [come to] know

Name: The Troops
Verse: to whom will come a chastisement that will disgrace him and on whom there will descend a lasting chastisement’.

Name: The Troops
Verse: Truly We have revealed the Book to you for [the sake of] mankind with the truth. So whoever is guided, then it is for [the sake of] his own soul, and whoever goes astray, goes astray only to the detriment thereof. And you are not [meant to be] a guardian over them.

Name: The Troops
Verse: God takes the souls at the time of their death, and, those that have not died in their sleep. Then He retains those for whom He has ordained death and releases the others until an appointed term. Truly in that there are signs for a people who reflect.

Name: The Troops
Verse: Or have they taken besides God intercessors? Say: ‘What! even though they have no power whatever and are unable to comprehend?’

Name: The Troops
Verse: Say: ‘All intercession belongs [solely] to God. To Him belongs the kingdom of the heavens and the earth; then to Him you will be brought back’.

Name: The Troops
