Verse: And when God is mentioned alone, thereat shrink the hearts of those who do not believe in the Hereafter; but when those [others] besides Him are mentioned, behold, they rejoice!

Name: The Troops
Verse: Say: ‘O God! Originator of the heavens and the earth!, Knower of the Unseen and the visible, You will judge between Your servants concerning that wherein they used to differ’.

Name: The Troops
Verse: And [even] if the evildoers possessed all that is in the earth, and as much of it besides, they would surely offer it to ransom themselves from the terrible chastisement on the Day of Resurrection. And there will appear to them from God that which they had never reckoned.

Name: The Troops
Verse: And there will appear to them the evils of what they had earned, and they will be besieged by that which they used to deride.

Name: The Troops
Verse: So when some distress befalls man, he supplicates Us. Then, when We bestow on him a grace from Us, he says, ‘I was given it merely by force of knowledge’. Nay, but it is a trial. But most of them do not know.

Name: The Troops
Verse: Already the same was said by those who were before them. But what they used to earn did not avail them.

Name: The Troops
Verse: So the evils of what they earned smote them. And the evildoers among these shall also be smitten by the evils of what they earned, and they will not be able to thwart it.

Name: The Troops
Verse: Do they not know that God extends His provision for whomever He will, and restricts [it] [for whomever He will?] Truly in that there are signs for a people who believe.

Name: The Troops
Verse: Say [that God declares]: ‘O My servants who have been prodigal against their own souls, do not despair of God’s mercy. Truly God forgives all sins. Truly He is the Forgiving, the Merciful.

Name: The Troops
Verse: And turn [penitently] to your Lord and submit to Him, before the chastisement comes on you, whereupon you will not be helped.

Name: The Troops
Verse: And follow the best of what has been revealed to you from your Lord before the chastisement comes on you suddenly while you are unaware’,

Name: The Troops
Verse: before any soul should say, ‘Alas for me for what I have neglected of my duty to God. Indeed I was among those who ridiculed’,

Name: The Troops
Verse: or [before] that it should say, ‘If only God had guided me, I would have been among those who have feared’,

Name: The Troops
Verse: or [before] that it should say, when it sees the chastisement, ‘If only there had been a second chance, I would be among the virtuous’.

Name: The Troops
Verse: ‘Yes indeed! My signs came to you, but you denied them and were arrogant, and you were among the disbelievers’.

Name: The Troops
Verse: And on the Day of Resurrection you will see those who imputed lies to God with their faces blackened. Is there not in Hell a [fitting] abode for those who are [too] arrogant?

Name: The Troops
Verse: And God will deliver those who fear because of their triumph. No evil will touch them, nor will they grieve.

Name: The Troops
Verse: God is the Creator of all things and He is Guardian over all things.

Name: The Troops
Verse: To Him belong the keys of the heavens and the earth. And those who disbelieve in the signs of God, those, they are the losers.

Name: The Troops
Verse: Say: ‘Is it [something] other than God that you bid me to worship, O you who are ignorant?’

Name: The Troops
Verse: And certainly it has been revealed to you and to those before you [that] if you associate others [with God], your work shall surely fail and you shall surely be among the losers’.

Name: The Troops
Verse: Rather, worship God and be among the thankful.

Name: The Troops
Verse: And they do not esteem God as He should be esteemed. And the entire earth will be in His grasp on the Day of Resurrection, and the heavens will be rolled up in His Right Hand. Glory be to Him! And exalted be He above what they associate!

Name: The Troops
Verse: And the Trumpet will be blown, and whoever is in the heavens and whoever is in the earth will swoon, except whomever God wills. Then it will be blown again, and behold, they will rise up, looking on.

Name: The Troops
Verse: And the earth will shine with the light of its Lord, and the Book shall be set in place, and the prophets and witnesses will be brought. And judgement will be made between them with truth, and they will not be wronged.

Name: The Troops
Verse: And every soul will be paid in full for what it did, and He is best aware of what they do.

Name: The Troops
Verse: And those who disbelieve will be driven to Hell in troops until, when they reach it, its gates are opened and its keepers will say to them, ‘Did there not come to you [any] messengers from among yourselves, reciting to you the signs of your Lord, and warning you of the encounter of this day of yours?’ They will say, ‘Yes, indeed; but the word of chastisement against the disbelievers has been fulfilled’.

Name: The Troops
Verse: It will be said, ‘Enter the gates of Hell to abide therein. For evil [indeed] is the abode of the arrogant!’

Name: The Troops
Verse: And those who feared their Lord will be driven to Paradise in troops, until, when they reach it, and its gates are opened and its keepers will say to them, ‘Peace be to you! You are good! So enter it to abide [therein]’.

Name: The Troops
Verse: And they will say: ‘Praise be to God, Who has fulfilled His promise to us, and has made us inherit the land that we may settle in Paradise wherever we wish’. So how excellent is the reward of those who worked [hard]!

Name: The Troops
Verse: And you will see the angels encircling all round the Throne, glorifying with praise of their Lord, and judgement will be made between them with truth, and it will be said, ‘Praise be to God, the Lord of the Worlds!’

Name: The Believer
Verse: Hā mīm.

Name: The Believer
Verse: The revelation of the Book is from God, the Mighty, the Knower.

Name: The Believer
Verse: Forgiver of sins and Accepter of repentance, Severe in punishment, One of [abundant] bounty. There is no god except Him; to Him is the journeying.

Name: The Believer
Verse: None dispute the signs of God, except those who disbelieve, so do not be deceived by their bustle in the towns.

Name: The Believer
Verse: The people of Noah denied before them and [also] the factions, [who came] after them. And every community sought to seize their messenger, and they argued falsely [thinking] to rebut thereby the truth. Then I seized them; so how [fitting] was My punishment!

Name: The Believer
Verse: And thus was the word of your Lord fulfilled against those who disbelieve: that they shall be the inhabitants of the Fire.

Name: The Believer
Verse: Those who bear the Throne and those around it glorify with praise of their Lord, and they believe in Him, and they ask forgiveness for those who believe: ‘Our Lord, You embrace all things in [Your] mercy and knowledge. So forgive those who repent and follow Your way and shield them from the chastisement of Hell-fire.

Name: The Believer
Verse: Our Lord, and admit them into the Gardens of Eden that which You have promised them, along with whoever were righteous among their fathers and their wives and their descendants. Surely You are the One Who is the Mighty, the Wise.

Name: The Believer
Verse: And shield them from evil deeds for whomever You shield from evil deeds that day, verily him You will have had been merciful to; and that is indeed the supreme triumph’.

Name: The Believer
Verse: Indeed to those who disbelieve it will be proclaimed [to them]: ‘Surely God’s loathing is greater than your loathing of yourselves, as you were called to faith but you used to disbelieve’.

Name: The Believer
Verse: They will say, ‘Our Lord, You have caused us to die twice and You have given us life twice. We [now] confess our sins. Is there then any way to go out?’

Name: The Believer
Verse: That is because, when God was invoked alone, you would disbelieve; but if partners were ascribed to Him, you would believe. So the judgement belongs to God, the Exalted, the Great.

Name: The Believer
Verse: He it is Who shows you His signs and sends down from the heaven for you provision. Yet no one remembers, except him who returns penitently.

Name: The Believer
Verse: So supplicate God, devoting [your] religion purely to Him, however much the disbelievers be averse.

Name: The Believer
Verse: Exalter of ranks, Lord of the Throne, He casts the Spirit of His command upon whomever He will of His servants, that he may warn them of the Day of Encounter,

Name: The Believer
Verse: the day when they will emerge; nothing about them will be hidden from God. ‘To whom does Sovereignty belong today?’ ‘To God, the One, the All-compelling!’

Name: The Believer
Verse: Today every soul shall be requited for what it has earned; there will be no injustice today. Indeed God is swift at reckoning’.

Name: The Believer
Verse: And warn them of the Impending Day, when the hearts will reach the throats, choking with anguish. The evildoers will not have any intimate [friend], nor any intercessor who might be heeded.

Name: The Believer
Verse: He knows the treachery of the eyes and what the breasts hide.

Name: The Believer
Verse: And God decrees with truth, while those on whom they call besides Him do not decree by any means [at all]. Truly God is the Hearer, the Seer.

Name: The Believer
Verse: Have they not travelled in the land and beheld the nature of the consequence for those who were before them? They were more powerful than them in strength and in [their] vestiges on earth. Yet God seized them for their sins and they had none to shield them from God.

Name: The Believer
Verse: That was because their messengers used to bring them clear signs, but they disbelieved. So God seized them. Indeed He is Strong, Severe in punishment.

Name: The Believer
Verse: And verily We sent Moses with Our signs and a clear warrant

Name: The Believer
Verse: to Pharaoh and Hāmān and Korah, but they said: ‘A sorcerer, a [mere] liar!’

Name: The Believer
Verse: So when he brought them the truth from Us, they said, ‘Slay the sons of those who believe with him, and spare their women’. But the guile of the disbelievers is ever in error.

Name: The Believer
Verse: And Pharaoh said, ‘Let me slay Moses and let him call to his Lord. Indeed I fear that he may change your religion, or that he may cause corruption to appear in the land’.

Name: The Believer
Verse: And Moses said, ‘Indeed I seek refuge in my Lord and your Lord from every arrogant one who does not believe in the Day of Reckoning’.

Name: The Believer
Verse: Then said a believing man from among Pharaoh’s folk who had concealed his faith, ‘Will you slay a man for saying, “My Lord is God”, even though he has [also] brought you clear signs from your Lord? If he is lying, then his mendacity will be to his own detriment; but if he is truthful, then there will befall you some of that with which he is threatening you. Truly God does not guide one who is a prodigal, a liar.

Name: The Believer
Verse: O my people! Today the kingdom is yours: [you are] dominant, in the land. But who will help us against the might of God should it reach us?’ Pharaoh said, ‘I only point out to you what I see [to be best], and I am only guiding you to the path of rectitude’.

Name: The Believer
Verse: Then said he who believed, ‘O my people! Truly I fear for you [a day] like the day of the factions,

Name: The Believer
Verse: like the case of the people of Noah, and ‘ād, and Thamūd, and those [who came] after them, and God does not desire to wrong [any of] His servants.

Name: The Believer
Verse: And O my people! Truly I fear for you a day of [mutual] calling,

Name: The Believer
Verse: a day when you will turn back to flee, not having anyone to defend you from God, and whomever God leads astray, for him there is no guide.

Name: The Believer
Verse: And verily Joseph brought you, before clear signs, but you continued to be in doubt concerning what he had brought you until, when he died, you said: “God will never send any messenger after him”. So God leads astray one who is a prodigal, a skeptic’.

Name: The Believer
Verse: Those who dispute the signs of God without any warrant that has come to them — greatly hateful [is that] in the sight of God and in the sight of those who believe. So God sets a seal on the heart of every arrogant tyrant.

Name: The Believer
Verse: And Pharaoh said, ‘O Hāmān! Build for me a tower that perhaps I may reach the routes —

Name: The Believer
Verse: the routes of the heavens, and look upon the God of Moses; for I truly think that he is lying’. And that is how the evil [nature] of his conduct was made to seem fair to Pharaoh, and [that is how] he was barred from the [right] way. And Pharaoh’s guile ended only in ruin.

Name: The Believer
Verse: And he who believed, ‘O my people! Follow me; I will guide you to the way of rectitude.

Name: The Believer
Verse: Whoever commits an evil deed shall not be requited except with the like of it; but whoever acts righteously, whether male or female, and is a believer — such shall be admitted into Paradise wherein they will be provided without any reckoning.

Name: The Believer
Verse: And O my people! [Think] what makes me call you to deliverance when you call me to the Fire?

Name: The Believer
Verse: You call me to disbelieve in God and to associate with Him that whereof I have no knowledge, whereas I call you to the Mighty, the Forgiver.

Name: The Believer
Verse: No doubt that to which you call me has no call [that is heard] in this world or in the Hereafter, and indeed our return will be to God, and indeed the prodigal — it is they who will be the inhabitants of the Fire.

Name: The Believer
Verse: For you will [soon] remember what I have said to you. And I entrust my affair to God. Truly God is Seer of [His] servants’.

Name: The Believer
Verse: So God shielded him from the evils of what they had plotted, and there besieged the folk of Pharaoh a dreadful chastisement,

Name: The Believer
Verse: the Fire, to which they are exposed morning and evening. And on the day when the Hour comes: ‘Enter folk of Pharaoh the most awful chastisement!’

Name: The Believer
Verse: And when they will be arguing [with one another] in the Fire, and the weak will say to those who were arrogant, ‘Indeed we were your followers; so will you [now] avail us against any portion of the Fire?’

Name: The Believer
Verse: Those who were arrogant will say, ‘Indeed we are all [together] in it. God has indeed judged [fairly] between His servants’.

Name: The Believer
Verse: And those who are in the Fire will say to the keepers of Hell, ‘Call on your Lord that He relieve us of [at least] a day of the chastisement!’

Name: The Believer
Verse: They will say: ‘Did not your messengers bring you clear signs?’ They will say, ‘Yes indeed’. They will say, ‘Then supplicate [God]!’ But the supplications of the disbelievers can only be misguided.

Name: The Believer
Verse: Truly We shall help Our messengers and those who believe, in the life of this world and on the day when the witnesses rise up;

Name: The Believer
Verse: the day when their excuses will not benefit the evildoers, and theirs will be the curse, and theirs will be the ills of the [ultimate] abode.

Name: The Believer
Verse: And verily We gave Moses the guidance, and We made the Children of Israel heirs to the scripture,

Name: The Believer
Verse: as a guidance, and as a remembrance for people of pith.

Name: The Believer
Verse: So be patient. Surely God’s promise is true. And ask forgiveness for your sin, and glorify with praise of your Lord at night and in the early hours.

Name: The Believer
Verse: Truly those who dispute the signs of God without any warrant that has come to them — there is only vanity in their breasts which they will never attain [and satisfy]. So seek refuge with God. Surely He is the Hearer, the Seer.

Name: The Believer
Verse: Assuredly the creation of the heavens and the earth is greater than the creation of mankind; but most people do not know.

Name: The Believer
Verse: And the blind one and the seer are not equal; nor are [they equal] those who believe and perform righteous deeds and the evildoer. Little do they reflect.

Name: The Believer
Verse: Truly the Hour is coming; there is no doubt in it. But most people do not believe.

Name: The Believer
Verse: And your Lord has said, ‘Call on Me and I will respond to you. Surely those who disdain to worship Me shall enter Hell [utterly] humiliated’.

Name: The Believer
Verse: God it is Who made for you night that you may rest in it, and day for seeing. Surely God is a Lord of bounty to mankind, but most people are not thankful.

Name: The Believer
Verse: That then is God, your Lord, the Creator of all things; there is no god except Him. How then are you made to deviate?

Name: The Believer
Verse: So deviate those who used to deny the signs of God.

Name: The Believer
Verse: God it is Who made for you the earth as a [stable] abode and the heaven as a canopy. And He formed you and perfected your forms, and provided you with [all] the wholesome things. That then is God, your Lord, so blessed be God, the Lord of the Worlds.

Name: The Believer
Verse: He is the Living; there is no god except Him. So supplicate Him, devoting [your] religion purely to Him. Praise be to God, the Lord of the Worlds.

Name: The Believer
Verse: Say: ‘I have been forbidden to worship those on whom you call besides God, since there have come to me clear signs from my Lord; and I have been commanded to submit to the Lord of the Worlds’.

Name: The Believer
Verse: He it is Who created you from dust, then from a drop [of sperm], then from a blood-clot, then He brings you forth as infants, then that you may come of age, then that you may become aged, though there are some of you who die earlier, and that you may complete an appointed term that perhaps you might understand.

Name: The Believer
Verse: He it is Who gives life and brings death. So when He decides upon a matter, He only says to it ‘Be!’ and it is.

Name: The Believer
Verse: Have you not regarded those who dispute the signs of God how they are turned away?

Name: The Believer
Verse: Those who deny the Book, and that wherewith We have sent Our messengers. But they will come to know,

Name: The Believer
Verse: when [with] fetters around their necks and chains they are dragged.

Name: The Believer
Verse: into the boiling water, then in the Fire they are set aflame.

Name: The Believer
Verse: Then it will be said to them: ‘Where are those whom you used to make partners,

Name: The Believer
Verse: besides God?’ They will say, ‘They have forsaken us. Nay, but [actually] we were not invoking anything before’. So, God leads astray the disbelievers.

Name: The Believer
Verse: ‘That is because you used to exult in the earth without right and because you were insolent.

Name: The Believer
Verse: Enter the gates of Hell, to abide therein’. Evil then is the [ultimate] abode of the arrogant!

Name: The Believer
Verse: So be patient. Assuredly God’s promise is true. And if We show you a part of what We promise them, or We take you unto Us [in death], then [in any case] to Us they will be returned.

Name: The Believer
Verse: And verily We sent messengers before you. Of them are those whom We have recounted to you, and of them are those whom We have not recounted to you. And it was never [permitted] for any messenger to bring a sign except with God’s permission. Hence when God’s command comes, judgement is passed justly; and it is thence that the advocates of falsehood become losers.

Name: The Believer
Verse: God it is Who made for you cattle that you may ride some of them and eat of some.

Name: The Believer
Verse: And there are [other] uses for you in them, and that by them you may satisfy any need that is in your breasts, and on them and on the ships you are carried.

Name: The Believer
Verse: And He shows you His signs. So which of God’s signs do you reject?

Name: The Believer
Verse: Have they not travelled across the land to see the nature of the consequence for those before them? They were more powerful than them in might and in [their] vestiges on earth. But what they used to earn did not avail them.

Name: The Believer
Verse: And when their messengers brought them clear signs, they exulted in the knowledge they possessed, and there besieged them that which they used to deride.

Name: The Believer
Verse: Then, when they saw Our doom, they said, ‘We believe in God alone, and we disavow what we used to associate with Him’.

Name: The Believer
Verse: But their faith was of no benefit to them when they saw Our doom — God’s way, [a precedent] which has passed among His servants, and it is thence that the disbelievers will be losers.

Name: Fussilat ("They are Expounded")
Verse: Hā mīm.

Name: Fussilat ("They are Expounded")
Verse: A revelation from the Compassionate, the Merciful.

Name: Fussilat ("They are Expounded")
Verse: A Book whose signs have been set out in detail as an Arabic Qur’ān for a people who have knowledge,

Name: Fussilat ("They are Expounded")
Verse: And they say: ‘Our hearts are veiled from that to which you call us, and in our ears there is a deafness and between us and you there is a partition, so act; indeed we shall be acting!’

Name: Fussilat ("They are Expounded")
Verse: Say: ‘I am only a human being like you. It has been revealed to me [simply] that your God is One God. So be upright [in your conduct] before Him and seek forgiveness from Him. And woe to the idolaters,

Name: Fussilat ("They are Expounded")
Verse: who do not pay the alms and who are disbelievers in the Hereafter.

Name: Fussilat ("They are Expounded")
Verse: Indeed those who believe and perform righteous deeds shall have an enduring reward’.

Name: Fussilat ("They are Expounded")
Verse: Say: ‘Do you [really] disbelieve in Him Who created the earth in two days, and ascribe to Him associates? That is the Lord of [all] the Worlds.

Name: Fussilat ("They are Expounded")
Verse: And He set therein firm mountains [rising] above it, and blessed it, and ordained therein its [various means of] sustenance in four days — evenly for [all] enquirers.

Name: Fussilat ("They are Expounded")
Verse: Then He turned to the heaven when it was smoke, and He said to it and to the earth, “Come both of you willingly, or unwillingly!” They said, “We come willingly!”

Name: Fussilat ("They are Expounded")
Verse: Then He ordained them seven heavens in two days; and in each heaven He revealed its commandment’. And We adorned the lowest heaven with lamps, and [this was also] to guard them. That is the ordaining of the Mighty, the Knower.

Name: Fussilat ("They are Expounded")
Verse: But if they turn away, then say, ‘I warn you of a thunderbolt like the thunderbolt of ‘ād and Thamūd’.

Name: Fussilat ("They are Expounded")
Verse: When the messengers came to them from in front of them and from behind them, saying, ‘Worship none but God,’ they said, ‘Had our Lord willed, He would have surely sent down angels; therefore we indeed disbelieve in what you have been sent with!’

Name: Fussilat ("They are Expounded")
Verse: As for ‘ād, they acted arrogantly in the earth without right, and they said, ‘Who is more powerful than us in might?’ Did they not see that God, He Who created them, was more powerful than them in might? And they used to deny Our signs.

Name: Fussilat ("They are Expounded")
Verse: So We unleashed upon them a raging wind during [some] ill-fated days that We might make them taste the chastisement of disgrace in the life of this world; yet the chastisement of the Hereafter is indeed more disgraceful, and they will not be helped.

Name: Fussilat ("They are Expounded")
Verse: And as for Thamūd, We offered them guidance, but they preferred blindness to guidance. So the thunderbolt of the humiliating chastisement seized them on account of what they used to earn.

Name: Fussilat ("They are Expounded")
Verse: And We delivered those who believed and feared.

Name: Fussilat ("They are Expounded")
Verse: And the day when God’s enemies are gathered to the Fire, for they will be driven [thereto],

Name: Fussilat ("They are Expounded")
Verse: until, when they reach it, their hearing and their eyes and their skins will bear witness against them concerning what they used to do.

Name: Fussilat ("They are Expounded")
Verse: And they will say to their skins, ‘Why did you bear witness against us?’ They will say, ‘God made us speak, Who gave speech to all things. And He created you the first time, and to Him you will be returned.

Name: Fussilat ("They are Expounded")
Verse: And you did not use to conceal yourselves, lest your hearing or your eyes or your skins should bear witness against you; but you thought that God did not know most of what you did.

Name: Fussilat ("They are Expounded")
Verse: And that supposition of yours which you supposed of your Lord has ruined you. So you have become among the losers’.

Name: Fussilat ("They are Expounded")
Verse: So if they endure the Fire will [still] be their abode; and if they seek reconciliation, then they will not be among the reconciled.

Name: Fussilat ("They are Expounded")
Verse: And We have assigned them companions, who have adorned for them that which is before them, and that which is behind them. And the word became due against them, being among communities that passed away before them of jinn and mankind. Truly they were losers.

Name: Fussilat ("They are Expounded")
Verse: And those who disbelieve say, ‘Do not listen to this Qur’ān and hoot it down that perhaps you might prevail’.

Name: Fussilat ("They are Expounded")
Verse: But verily We will make those who disbelieve taste a severe chastisement, and We will verily requite them the worst of what they used to do.

Name: Fussilat ("They are Expounded")
Verse: That is the requital of God’s enemies — the Fire! Therein will be their everlasting abode as a requital for their denial of Our signs.

Name: Fussilat ("They are Expounded")
Verse: And those who disbelieve will say: ‘Our Lord, show us those who led us astray from among the jinn and mankind so that we may have them underneath our feet [to trample them], that they may be among the lowermost’.

Name: Fussilat ("They are Expounded")
Verse: Truly those who say, ‘Our Lord is God!’ and then remain upright, the angels descend upon them, [saying to them], ‘Do not fear, nor grieve, and rejoice in the good tidings of the paradise which you were promised.

Name: Fussilat ("They are Expounded")
Verse: We are your friends in the life of this world, and in the Hereafter, and therein you will have whatever your souls desire, and therein you will have whatever you request,

Name: Fussilat ("They are Expounded")
Verse: as a hospitality from One Forgiving, Merciful’.

Name: Fussilat ("They are Expounded")
Verse: And who speaks better [words] than him who summons [others] to God, and acts righteously and says, ‘Indeed I am one of those who submit [to God]’?

Name: Fussilat ("They are Expounded")
Verse: And they are not equal, the good deed and the evil deed. Repel with that which is better then, behold, he between whom and you there was enmity will be as though he were a dear friend.

Name: Fussilat ("They are Expounded")
Verse: But none is granted it, except those who are steadfast; and none is granted it except one [deserving] of a great reward.

Name: Fussilat ("They are Expounded")
Verse: And if some temptation from Satan should provoke you, then seek refuge in God. Truly He is the Hearer, the Knower.

Name: Fussilat ("They are Expounded")
Verse: And among His signs are the night and the day, and the sun and the moon. Do not prostrate to the sun and moon, but prostrate to God Who created them, if it is Him Whom you worship.

Name: Fussilat ("They are Expounded")
Verse: But if they disdain, still those who are with your Lord glorify Him night and day, and they tire not.

Name: Fussilat ("They are Expounded")
Verse: And among His signs is that you see the earth desolate, but when We send down water upon it, it stirs and swells. Truly He Who revives it is indeed the Reviver of the dead. Surely He has power over all things.

Name: Fussilat ("They are Expounded")
Verse: Indeed those who blaspheme Our signs are not hidden from Us. Is one who is cast into the Fire better [off], or one who arrives secure on the Day of Resurrection? Act as you wish; indeed He is Seer of what you do.

Name: Fussilat ("They are Expounded")
Verse: Truly those who disbelieve in the Remembrance when it comes to them [are not hidden from us], and truly it is an unassailable Book:

Name: Fussilat ("They are Expounded")
Verse: falsehood cannot approach it from before it or from behind it, [it is] a revelation from One Wise, Praised.

Name: Fussilat ("They are Expounded")
Verse: Nothing is said to you, except what has already been said to the messengers before you. Surely your Lord is One of forgiveness and [also] One of painful punishment.

Name: Fussilat ("They are Expounded")
Verse: And had We made it a non-Arabic Qur’ān, they would have said, ‘Why have its signs not been explained [clearly]? What! non-Arabic and an Arab?’ Say: ‘For those who believe it is guidance and a healing; but as for those who do not believe, there is a deafness in their ears, and they are blind to it. Those, they are [as if they were being] called from a distant place’.

Name: Fussilat ("They are Expounded")
Verse: And verily We gave Moses the Scripture, but differences arose concerning it; and were it not for a Word that had [already] preceded from your Lord, judgement would have been made between them; for indeed they are in grave doubt concerning it.

Name: Fussilat ("They are Expounded")
Verse: Whoever acts righteously, it is for [the good of] his own soul, and whoever does evil, it is to the detriment thereof. And your Lord is not [at all] a tyrant to His servants.

Name: Fussilat ("They are Expounded")
Verse: To Him devolves [all] knowledge of the Hour. And no fruit emerges from its sheath, and no female bears [child] or delivers except with His knowledge. And on the day when He will call out to them, ‘Where [then] are My associates?’ they will say, ‘We proclaim to You that there is no witness amongst us’.

Name: Fussilat ("They are Expounded")
Verse: And what they used to call on before has forsaken them and they suppose that there is no refuge for them.

Name: Fussilat ("They are Expounded")
Verse: Man never wearies of supplicating for good, but should any ill befall him, then he becomes despondent, despairing.

Name: Fussilat ("They are Expounded")
Verse: And if We let him taste mercy from Us after the harm that had befallen him, he will surely say, ‘This is my due! I do not think that the Hour will ever set in, and even if I am returned to my Lord, I will indeed have the best [reward] with Him’. But We will assuredly inform those who disbelieve of what they did, and assuredly We will make them taste a harsh chastisement.

Name: Fussilat ("They are Expounded")
Verse: And when We bestow graces upon man, he shows disregard and turns aside; but when ill befalls him, he makes prolonged supplications.

Name: Fussilat ("They are Expounded")
Verse: Say: ‘Consider [this]: if it is from God, and you disbelieve in it, who will be further astray than one who is in extreme defiance?’

Name: Fussilat ("They are Expounded")
Verse: We shall show them Our signs in the horizons and in their own souls until it becomes clear to them that it is the truth. Is it not sufficient that your Lord is witness to all things?

Name: Fussilat ("They are Expounded")
Verse: Nay, verily they are in doubt about the encounter with their Lord. Nay, verily He encompasses all things.

Name: Counsel
Verse: Hā mīm

Name: Counsel
Verse: ‘ayn sīn qāf.

Name: Counsel
Verse: Thus does He reveal to you and to those [who were] before you, God, the Mighty, the Wise.

Name: Counsel
Verse: To Him belongs whatever is in the heavens and whatever is in the earth, and He is the Exalted, the Tremendous.

Name: Counsel
Verse: The heavens are well-nigh rent asunder from above one another, and the angels glorify with praise of their Lord, and ask forgiveness for those on earth. Verily God is the Forgiving, the Merciful.

Name: Counsel
Verse: And those who have taken besides Him guardians, God is watchful over them; and you are not a guardian over them.

Name: Counsel
Verse: And thus have We revealed to you an Arabic Qur’ān, that you may warn the mother-town and those around it, and that you may warn of the Day of Gathering of which there is no doubt. A part will be in Paradise and a part will be in the Blaze.

Name: Counsel
Verse: And had God willed, He would have made them one community; but He admits whomever He will into His mercy, and the evildoers have neither guardian nor helper.

Name: Counsel
Verse: Or have they taken guardians besides Him? But God, He [alone] is the Guardian, and He revives the dead, and He has power over all things.

Name: Counsel
Verse: And whatever you may differ in, the verdict therein belongs to God. That then is God, my Lord; in Him I have put my trust, and to Him I turn penitently.

Name: Counsel
Verse: The Originator of the heavens and the earth. He has made for you, from your own selves, pairs, and [also] pairs of the cattle: He multiplies you by such [means]. There is nothing like Him. He is the Heare, the Seer.

Name: Counsel
Verse: To Him belong the keys of the heavens and the earth. He extends provision for whomever He will, and He restricts [it]. Truly He has knowledge of all things.

Name: Counsel
Verse: He has prescribed for you as a religion that which He enjoined upon Noah and that which We have revealed to you, and that which We enjoined upon Abraham, and Moses, and Jesus [declaring], ‘Establish religion and do not be divided in it’. Dreadful is for the idolaters that to which you summon them. God chooses for it whomever He will, and He guides to it whomever turns penitently.

Name: Counsel
Verse: And they did not become divided, except after the knowledge had come to them, out of [jealous] rivalry among themselves. And were it not for a Word that preceded from your Lord, until an appointed term, it would have [already] been judged between them. And indeed those who were made heirs to the Scripture after them are truly in grave doubt concerning him.

Name: Counsel
Verse: So to that then summon and be upright, just as you have been commanded, and do not follow them in their desires. And say: ‘I believe in whatever Book God has revealed. And I have been commanded to be just between you. God is our Lord and your Lord. Our deeds concern us and your deeds concern you. There is no argument between us and you. God will bring us together, and to Him is the [final] destination’.

Name: Counsel
Verse: And those who argue concerning God after His call has been answered, their argument stands refuted with their Lord, and [His] wrath shall be upon them, and there will be a severe chastisement for them.

Name: Counsel
Verse: God it is Who has revealed the Book with the truth as well as the Balance. And what do you know — perhaps the Hour is near!

Name: Counsel
Verse: Those who do not believe in it seek to hasten it, but those who believe are apprehensive of it and know that it is the truth. Nay, but verily those who are in doubt concerning the Hour are indeed in extreme error!

Name: Counsel
Verse: God is Gracious to His servants. He provides for whomever He will. And He is the Strong, the Mighty.

Name: Counsel
Verse: And whoever desires the harvest of the Hereafter, We will enhance for him his harvest; and whoever desires the harvest of this world, We will give him of it; but in the Hereafter he will have no share.

Name: Counsel
Verse: Or have they associates who have prescribed for them a religion which God has not given permission for? And were it not for a [prior] decisive word, it would have been judged between them. Truly the wrongdoers will have a painful chastisement.

Name: Counsel
Verse: You will see the wrongdoers apprehensive because of what they had earned; and it will surely befall them; but those who believe and perform righteous deeds will be in the lushest Gardens. They will have whatever they wish near their Lord; that is the great favour.

Name: Counsel
Verse: That is the good tidings which God gives to His servants who believe and perform righteous deeds. Say: ‘I do not ask of you any reward for it, except the affection for [my] kinsfolk. And whoever acquires a good deed, We shall enhance for him its goodness. Surely God is Forgiving, Appreciative.

Name: Counsel
Verse: Or do they say, ‘He has invented a lie against God?’ For if God will, He can seal your heart. And God will efface the falsehood and vindicate the truth with His words. Truly He is Knower of what is in the breasts.

Name: Counsel
Verse: And He it is Who accepts repentance from His servants, and pardons evil deeds, and knows what they do.

Name: Counsel
Verse: And He answers those who believe and perform righteous deeds, and He enhances them of His bounty. And as for the disbelievers, for them there will be a severe chastisement.

Name: Counsel
Verse: For were God to extend His provision to His servants, they would surely become covetous in the earth; but He sends down in the measure that He will. Surely He is Aware, Seer of His servants.

Name: Counsel
Verse: And He it is Who sends down the [saving] rain after they have despaired, and unfolds His mercy, and He is the [true] Patron, the Praised.

Name: Counsel
Verse: And of His signs is the creation of the heavens and the earth and whatever He has scattered in them in the way of creatures. And He is able to bring them together, whenever He will.

Name: Counsel
Verse: And whatever affliction may befall you is on account of what your [own] hands have earned. And He pardons much.

Name: Counsel
Verse: And you cannot escape on earth, and besides God you have neither protector nor helper.

Name: Counsel
Verse: And of His signs are the ships [that run] on the sea [appearing] like landmarks.

Name: Counsel
Verse: If He will He stills the wind, whereat they remain motionless on its surface. Surely in that there are signs for every steadfast, grateful [servant].

Name: Counsel
Verse: Or He wrecks them because of what they have earned. And He pardons much.

Name: Counsel
Verse: And that those who dispute concerning Our signs may know they have no refuge.

Name: Counsel
Verse: So whatever you have been given is [but] the enjoyment of the life of this world. But what is with God is better and more lasting for those who believe and put their trust in their Lord,

Name: Counsel
Verse: and those who avoid grave sins and indecencies and [who], when they are angry, forgive,

Name: Counsel
Verse: and those who answer their Lord, and whose courses of action are [a matter of] counsel between them, and who, of what We have bestowed on them, expend,

Name: Counsel
Verse: and those who, when they suffer aggression defend themselves:

Name: Counsel
Verse: For the requital of an evil deed is an evil deed like it. But whoever pardons and reconciles, his reward will be with God. Truly He does not like wrongdoers.

Name: Counsel
Verse: And whoever defends himself after he has been wronged, for such, there will be no course [of action] against them.

Name: Counsel
Verse: A course [of action] is only [open] against those who wrong people and seek [to commit] in the earth what is not right. For such there will be a painful chastisement.

Name: Counsel
Verse: But verily he who is patient and forgives — surely that is [true] constancy in [such] affairs.

Name: Counsel
Verse: And whomever God leads astray has no protector after Him. And you will see the wrongdoers, when they sight the chastisement, saying, ‘Is there any way to return?’

Name: Counsel
Verse: And you will see them being exposed to it, submissive by abasement, looking with a furtive glance. And those who believe will say, ‘Verily the [true] losers are those who have lost themselves and their families on the Day of Resurrection. Truly the wrongdoers will be in lasting chastisement.

Name: Counsel
Verse: And they have no guardians to help them besides God, and whomever God leads astray has no course [of action]’.

Name: Counsel
Verse: Answer your Lord before there comes a day for which there is no revoking from God. On that day you will have no refuge, and for you there will be no [way of] denying.

Name: Counsel
Verse: But if they are disregardful, We have not sent you as a keeper over them. Your duty is only to deliver the Message. And indeed when We let man taste from Us some mercy, he exults in it; but if some ill befalls them because of what their [own] hands have sent ahead, then lo! man is ungrateful.

Name: Counsel
Verse: To God belongs the kingdom of the heavens and the earth. He creates whatever He will; He gives to whomever He will females, and He gives to whomever He will males.

Name: Counsel
Verse: Or He combines them, males and females; and He makes whomever He will infertile. Surely He is Knower, Powerful.

Name: Counsel
Verse: And it is not [possible] for any human that God should speak to him except by revelation, or from behind a veil, or that He should send a messenger, and he then reveals with His permission whatever He will. Truly He is Exalted, Wise.

Name: Counsel
Verse: And thus, have We revealed to you a Spirit from Our command. You did not know what the Book was, nor faith; but We have made it a light by which We guide whomever We will of Our servants. And verily you guide to a straight path,

Name: Counsel
Verse: the path of God, to Whom belongs whatever is in the heavens and whatever is in the earth. Surely with God all matters end [their journey].

Name: Ornaments of Gold
Verse: Hā mīm.

Name: Ornaments of Gold
Verse: By the Book that clarifies.

Name: Ornaments of Gold
Verse: Lo! We have made it an Arabic Qur’ān that perhaps you may understand.

Name: Ornaments of Gold
Verse: And it is indeed in the Mother Book, [which is] with Us [and it is] indeed exalted.

Name: Ornaments of Gold
Verse: Shall We turn away from you the Remembrance, utterly because you are a profligate folk?

Name: Ornaments of Gold
Verse: And how many a prophet did We send among the ancients!

Name: Ornaments of Gold
Verse: And never did a prophet come to them but that they used to deride him.

Name: Ornaments of Gold
Verse: So We destroyed those who were mightier than them in prowess, and [already] there passed the example of the ancients.

Name: Ornaments of Gold
Verse: And if you ask them, ‘Who created the heavens and the earth?’ they will surely say, ‘The Mighty, the Knower created them’.

Name: Ornaments of Gold
Verse: He Who made the earth a cradle for you, and placed for you therein ways, that perhaps you may be guided,

Name: Ornaments of Gold
Verse: and Who sent down water from the heaven in measure, and We revived with it a dead land. Thus will you be brought forth,

Name: Ornaments of Gold
Verse: and Who created the pairs all of them, and made for you ships and cattle on which you ride,

Name: Ornaments of Gold
Verse: that you may sit upon their backs; and then remember your Lord’s grace when you are settled on them, and say, ‘Glory be to Him Who has disposed this for us, and we [by] ourselves were no match for it.

Name: Ornaments of Gold
Verse: And indeed it is to our Lord that we shall return’.

Name: Ornaments of Gold
Verse: And they assign to Him from among His own servants a part. Man is verily a manifest ingrate.

Name: Ornaments of Gold
Verse: Or He has adopted, from all that He has created daughters, and preferred you with sons?

Name: Ornaments of Gold
Verse: And when one of them is given the good tidings of that which he has attributed to the Compassionate One, his face becomes darkened, and he chokes inwardly.

Name: Ornaments of Gold
Verse: What! one that is brought up amid trinkets and is incoherent in a dispute?

Name: Ornaments of Gold
Verse: And they have made the angels, who are themselves servants of the Compassionate One, females. Did they witness their creation? Their testimony will be written down and they will be questioned.

Name: Ornaments of Gold
Verse: And they say, ‘Had the Compassionate One [so] willed, we would not have worshipped them’. They do not have any knowledge of that; and they are only surmising.

Name: Ornaments of Gold
Verse: Or have We brought them a scripture before, so that they are holding fast to it?

Name: Ornaments of Gold
Verse: Nay, but they say, ‘Lo! we found our fathers following a [certain] creed and we are indeed in their footsteps to be guided’.

Name: Ornaments of Gold
Verse: And thus We never sent a warner before you into any city without that its affluent folk said: ‘Lo! we found our fathers following a [certain] creed and [so] we are indeed following in their footsteps’.

Name: Ornaments of Gold
Verse: Say: ‘What! even if I bring you a better [means to] guidance than what you found your fathers following?’ They say, ‘Lo! we disbelieve in what you are sent with’.

Name: Ornaments of Gold
Verse: So We took vengeance on them; behold then how was the sequel for the deniers.

Name: Ornaments of Gold
Verse: And when Abraham said to his father and his people, ‘Surely I am innocent of that which you worship,

Name: Ornaments of Gold
Verse: except Him Who originated me; for He will indeed guide me’.

Name: Ornaments of Gold
Verse: And he made it a word enduring among his posterity that perhaps they might recant.

Name: Ornaments of Gold
Verse: Nay, but I have let these and their fathers enjoy [life] until there came to them the truth, and a messenger who makes [things] clear.

Name: Ornaments of Gold
Verse: But when the truth came to them, they said, ‘This is sorcery, and we are indeed disbelievers in it’.

Name: Ornaments of Gold
Verse: And they said, ‘If only this Qur’ān had been revealed to some great man from the two towns!’

Name: Ornaments of Gold
Verse: Is it they who apportion the mercy of your Lord? We have apportioned among them their livelihood in the life of this world, and raised some of them above others by degrees, so that some of them may take others in service, and the mercy of your Lord is better than what they amass.

Name: Ornaments of Gold
Verse: And were it not [for the danger] that mankind would be one community, We would have made, for those who disbelieve in the Compassionate One, roofs of silver for their houses and stairs by which they ascend,

Name: Ornaments of Gold
Verse: and doors for their houses, and couches on which they recline,

Name: Ornaments of Gold
Verse: and ornaments. Yet surely all that would be nothing but the [transient] enjoyment of the life of this world, and the Hereafter with your Lord is for the God-fearing.

Name: Ornaments of Gold
Verse: And whoever withdraws from the Remembrance of the Compassionate One, We assign for him a devil and he becomes his companion.

Name: Ornaments of Gold
Verse: And indeed they bar them from the way, while they suppose that they are [rightly] guided,

Name: Ornaments of Gold
Verse: until when he comes to Us, he says: ‘O would that there were between me and you the distance of the two easts!’ — What an evil companion then!

Name: Ornaments of Gold
Verse: And it will not benefit you this day, given that you did wrong that you will be sharing in the chastisement.

Name: Ornaments of Gold
Verse: Can you, then, make the deaf hear, or can you guide the blind and one who is in manifest error?

Name: Ornaments of Gold
Verse: So if We take you away, then We will take vengeance on them,

Name: Ornaments of Gold
Verse: or We show you that which We have promised them, for surely We have power over them.

Name: Ornaments of Gold
Verse: So hold fast to that which has been revealed to you; surely you are on a straight path.

Name: Ornaments of Gold
Verse: And it is indeed a Reminder for you and for your people. And you will [eventually] be questioned.

Name: Ornaments of Gold
Verse: And ask those of Our messengers whom We sent before you: Did We [ever] appoint, besides the Compassionate One, gods to be worshipped?

Name: Ornaments of Gold
Verse: And verily We sent Moses with Our signs to Pharaoh and his council, and he said, ‘I am indeed the messenger of the Lord of the Worlds’.

Name: Ornaments of Gold
Verse: But when he brought them Our signs, behold! they laughed at them.

Name: Ornaments of Gold
Verse: And We never showed them a sign, but it was greater than the one before it. And We seized them with chastisement, that perhaps they might recant.

Name: Ornaments of Gold
Verse: And they said, ‘O sorcerer! supplicate your Lord for us by the covenant that He has made with you. Assuredly we will be guided’.

Name: Ornaments of Gold
Verse: But as soon as We relieved them from the chastisement, behold! they had broken their pledge.

Name: Ornaments of Gold
Verse: And Pharaoh proclaimed among his people, ‘O my people, does not the kingdom of Egypt belong to me, and these rivers flowing beneath me? Do you not perceive?

Name: Ornaments of Gold
Verse: Or am I not better than this one, who is contemptible, and who can scarcely speak clearly?

Name: Ornaments of Gold
Verse: Why then have bracelets of gold not been cast on him or the angels not come with him one after the other?’

Name: Ornaments of Gold
Verse: Thus did he persuade his people and they obeyed him. They were truly an immoral folk.

Name: Ornaments of Gold
Verse: So when they had angered Us, We took vengeance on them and drowned them all.

Name: Ornaments of Gold
Verse: And We made them a thing past, and an example for others.

Name: Ornaments of Gold
Verse: And when the son of Mary is cited as an example, behold! your people laugh at it.

Name: Ornaments of Gold
Verse: And they say, ‘Are our gods better or he?’ They only cite this to you for the sake of contention. Nay, but they are a contentious lot.

Name: Ornaments of Gold
Verse: He is only a servant [of Ours] on whom We bestowed favour, and We made him an exemplar for the Children of Israel.

Name: Ornaments of Gold
Verse: And had We willed, We would have appointed among you angels to be [your] successors in the earth.

Name: Ornaments of Gold
Verse: And indeed he is a portent of the Hour so do not doubt it but: ‘Follow me. This is a straight path’.

Name: Ornaments of Gold
Verse: And do not let Satan bar you. Indeed he is a manifest enemy of yours.

Name: Ornaments of Gold
Verse: And when Jesus came with the clear signs, he said, ‘Verily I have brought you wisdom, and [I have come] to make clear to you some of what you are at variance over. So fear God and obey me.

Name: Ornaments of Gold
Verse: Assuredly God is my Lord and your Lord; so worship Him — that is a straight path’.

Name: Ornaments of Gold
Verse: But the factions differed among themselves. So woe to those who do wrong from the chastisement of a painful day.

Name: Ornaments of Gold
Verse: Are they awaiting anything, but that Hour should come upon them suddenly, while they are unaware?

Name: Ornaments of Gold
Verse: Friends will, on that day, be foes of one another, except for the God-fearing.

Name: Ornaments of Gold
Verse: ‘O My servants, there is no fear for you this day, nor will you grieve,

Name: Ornaments of Gold
Verse: those who believed in Our signs and had submitted themselves [to Me].

Name: Ornaments of Gold
Verse: Enter Paradise, you and your spouses to be made joyful.

Name: Ornaments of Gold
Verse: They will be served from all around with [large] dishes of gold and goblets and therein will be whatever souls desire and eyes delight in, and you will abide in it [forever].

Name: Ornaments of Gold
Verse: And that is the Paradise which you have been given to inherit [as the reward] for what you used to do.

Name: Ornaments of Gold
Verse: Therein are abundant fruits for you, from which you will eat’.

Name: Ornaments of Gold
Verse: Indeed the guilty will abide [forever] in the chastisement of Hell —

Name: Ornaments of Gold
Verse: it will not be lightened for them and they will be [utterly] despondent in it.

Name: Ornaments of Gold
Verse: And We never wronged them, but they themselves were the wrongdoers.

Name: Ornaments of Gold
Verse: And they will call out, ‘O Mālik, let your Lord finish us off!’ He will say, ‘You will surely remain!’

Name: Ornaments of Gold
Verse: ‘Verily We brought you the truth, but most of you were averse to the truth’.

Name: Ornaments of Gold
Verse: Or have they contrived some matter? For We [too] are indeed contriving.

Name: Ornaments of Gold
Verse: Or do they reckon that We do not hear their secret thoughts and their conspiring? Yes indeed! and Our messengers are with them keeping a record.

Name: Ornaments of Gold
Verse: Say: ‘If the Compassionate One had a son, I would have been first among the worshippers.

Name: Ornaments of Gold
Verse: Glory be to the Lord of the heavens and the earth, the Lord of the Throne above what they allege!’

Name: Ornaments of Gold
Verse: So leave them to indulge and play, until they encounter that day of theirs which they are promised.

Name: Ornaments of Gold
Verse: And He it is Who in the heaven is God, and in the earth is God; and He is the Wise, the Knower.

Name: Ornaments of Gold
Verse: And Blessed be He to Whom belongs the kingdom of the heavens and the earth and all that is between them; and with Him is the knowledge of the Hour, and to Him they will [all] be returned.

Name: Ornaments of Gold
Verse: And those whom they call on besides Him have no power of intercession, except those who bear witness to the truth with [full] knowledge.

Name: Ornaments of Gold
Verse: And if you ask them who created them, they will surely say, ‘God’. How can they then deviate?

Name: Ornaments of Gold
Verse: And [as] for his saying: ‘O my Lord! These are indeed a people who have no faith’.

Name: Ornaments of Gold
Verse: Then disregard them and say, ‘Peace!’ For they will [soon] come to know.

Name: Smoke
Verse: Hā mīm.

Name: Smoke
Verse: By the Book that clarifies.

Name: Smoke
Verse: Indeed We revealed it on a blessed night. Indeed We have been warning.

Name: Smoke
Verse: In it every definitive matter is distinguished.

Name: Smoke
Verse: As an ordinance from Us. Indeed We have been sending from your Lord,

Name: Smoke
Verse: as a mercy. Surely He is the Hearer, the Knower.

Name: Smoke
Verse: Lord of the heavens and the earth and all that is between them if you should be certain.

Name: Smoke
Verse: There is no god except Him. He gives life and brings death. Your Lord and the Lord of your forefathers.

Name: Smoke
Verse: Nay, but they linger in doubt, playing.

Name: Smoke
Verse: So watch out for the day when the heaven will produce a visible smoke.

Name: Smoke
Verse: that will envelop the people: ‘This is a painful chastisement!

Name: Smoke
Verse: Our Lord, relieve us from the chastisement; indeed we have believed’.

Name: Smoke
Verse: How can there be a reminder for them, when already there has come to them a manifest Messenger,

Name: Smoke
Verse: but they turned away from him and said, ‘He has been taught; [he is] a madman!’

Name: Smoke
Verse: ‘Indeed We will remove the chastisement a little. [But] you will indeed revert!’

Name: Smoke
Verse: The day when We shall assault with the most mighty assault; [then] indeed We shall take vengeance.

Name: Smoke
Verse: And certainly We tried before them the people of Pharaoh, when a messenger came to them, who was honoured,

Name: Smoke
Verse: and, ‘Do not rebel against God. Lo! I bring you a clear warrant’.

Name: Smoke
Verse: ‘And truly I seek refuge in my Lord and your Lord, lest you should stone me.

Name: Smoke
Verse: And if you do not believe me, then stay away from me’.

Name: Smoke
Verse: So he called to his Lord, saying, ‘These are indeed a guilty lot!’

Name: Smoke
Verse: ‘Then set out with My servants by night; for you will assuredly be pursued.

Name: Smoke
Verse: And leave the sea behind at rest: indeed they will be a drowned host’.

Name: Smoke
Verse: How many gardens and fountains did they leave behind,

Name: Smoke
Verse: as well as sown fields and many a glorious residence,

Name: Smoke
Verse: and the bounty in which they rejoiced!

Name: Smoke
Verse: So [it was] and We made these an inheritance for another people.

Name: Smoke
Verse: So neither the heaven nor the earth wept for them; nor were they reprieved.

Name: Smoke
Verse: And verily We delivered the Children of Israel from the humiliating chastisement,

Name: Smoke
Verse: from Pharaoh. Truly he was a tyrant of the wanton ones.

Name: Smoke
Verse: And verily We chose them with a knowledge over [all] the worlds.

Name: Smoke
Verse: And We gave them signs in which there was a manifest trial.

Name: Smoke
Verse: Indeed these ones say,

Name: Smoke
Verse: ‘It is nothing more than our first death, and we shall not be resurrected.

Name: Smoke
Verse: Bring us then our fathers, if you are being truthful’.

Name: Smoke
Verse: Are they better, or the people of Tubba’ and those before them? We destroyed [them]; indeed they were criminals.

Name: Smoke
Verse: And We did not create the heavens and the earth and all that is between them, [intending] to play.

Name: Smoke
Verse: We did not create them, except with the truth; but most of them do not know.

Name: Smoke
Verse: Assuredly the Day of Decision will be the tryst for all of them,

Name: Smoke
Verse: the day when a friend will not avail a friend anything, nor will they be helped,

Name: Smoke
Verse: except for him on whom God has mercy. He is indeed the Mighty, the Merciful.

Name: Smoke
Verse: Lo! the tree of Zaqqūm

Name: Smoke
Verse: will be the food of the sinful.

Name: Smoke
Verse: Like molten copper it will boil inside the bellies,

Name: Smoke
Verse: as the boiling of boiling water.

Name: Smoke
Verse: ‘Seize him and drag him to the midst of Hell-fire.

Name: Smoke
Verse: Then pour over his head the torture of boiling water!’

Name: Smoke
Verse: ‘Taste! Indeed you are the mighty, the noble one!

Name: Smoke
Verse: This is indeed that which you used to doubt’.

Name: Smoke
Verse: Assuredly the God-fearing will be in a secure place,

Name: Smoke
Verse: amid gardens and springs,

Name: Smoke
Verse: dressed in fine silk and [heavy] silk brocade, sitting face to face.

Name: Smoke
Verse: So [shall it be]; and We shall pair them with houris of beautiful eyes.

Name: Smoke
Verse: They will call therein every fruit, [remaining] secure.

Name: Smoke
Verse: They will not taste death therein, other than the first death. And He will shield them from the chastisement of Hell-fire —

Name: Smoke
Verse: a bounty from your Lord. That is the supreme triumph.

Name: Smoke
Verse: For We have made it easy in your tongue that perhaps they may remember.

Name: Smoke
Verse: So be on the look out. Indeed they [too] are on the look out.

Name: Crouching
Verse: Hā mīm.

Name: Crouching
Verse: The revelation of the Book is from God, the Mighty, the Wise.

Name: Crouching
Verse: Truly in the heavens and the earth there are signs for believers.

Name: Crouching
Verse: And in your creation, and what He has scattered of animals, there are signs for a people who are certain;

Name: Crouching
Verse: and the alternation of night and day, and what God sends down from the heaven [in the way] of provision with which He revives the earth after it is dead, and the circulation of the winds, there are signs for a people who understand.

Name: Crouching
Verse: These are the signs of God which We recite to you with truth. So in what [kind of] discourse then, after God and His signs will they believe?

Name: Crouching
Verse: Woe to every sinful liar,

Name: Crouching
Verse: who hears the signs of God being recited to him, then persists arrogantly, as if he had not heard them. So give him tidings of a painful chastisement.

Name: Crouching
Verse: And should he come to know anything of Our signs, he takes them in mockery. For such there is a degrading chastisement.

Name: Crouching
Verse: Beyond them is Hell, and that which they have earned will not avail them in any way, nor those whom they took besides God as patrons. And for them there will be a great chastisement.

Name: Crouching
Verse: This is a guidance, and those who disbelieve in the signs of their Lord, for them there will be a torture of a painful chastisement.

Name: Crouching
Verse: God it is Who disposed for you the sea so that the ships may sail upon it by His command, and that you may seek of His bounty, and that perhaps you may give thanks.

Name: Crouching
Verse: And He has disposed for you whatever is in the heavens, and whatever is in the earth, all being from Him. Surely in that there are signs for a people who reflect.

Name: Crouching
Verse: Tell those who believe to forgive those who do not anticipate the days of God that He may requite a people for what they used to earn.

Name: Crouching
Verse: Whoever acts righteously, it is for [the benefit of] his own soul, and whoever does evil, it is to the detriment thereof; then to your Lord you will be returned.

Name: Crouching
Verse: And verily We gave the Children of Israel the Scripture, and [the means of] judgement, and prophethood, and We provided them with the good things, and We favoured them above [all] worlds.

Name: Crouching
Verse: And We gave them clear illustrations of the commandment. And they did not differ, except after the knowledge had come to them, out of rivalry among themselves. Surely your Lord will judge between them on the Day of Resurrection concerning that in which they used to differ.

Name: Crouching
Verse: Then We set you upon a [clear] course of the commandment; so follow it, and do not follow the desires of those who do not know.

Name: Crouching
Verse: Assuredly they will not avail you in any way against God. And assuredly the wrongdoers are allies of one another; but God is the ally [only] of the God-fearing.

Name: Crouching
Verse: This is [a set of] insights for mankind, and guidance and mercy for a people who have certainty.

Name: Crouching
Verse: Or do those who have perpetrated evil acts suppose that We shall treat them as those who believe and perform righteous deeds, equally in their life and in their death? How evil is that judgement which they make!

Name: Crouching
Verse: And God created the heavens and the earth with the truth and so that every soul may be requited for what it has earned, and they will not be wronged.

Name: Crouching
Verse: Have you then seen him who has taken as his god his [own] desire, and whom God has led astray knowingly, and set a seal upon his hearing and his heart, and laid a covering over his sight? So who will guide him after God? Will you not then remember?

Name: Crouching
Verse: And they say, ‘There is only our life in this world. We die and we live, and nothing but time destroys us’. Of that they have no knowledge; they are only making conjectures.

Name: Crouching
Verse: And when Our signs, are recited to them, being clear signs, their only argument is to say, ‘Bring us our fathers, if you are being truthful’.

Name: Crouching
Verse: Say: ‘God [is the One Who] gives you life, then makes you die, then gathers you to the Day of Resurrection, in which there is no doubt; but most people do not know’.

Name: Crouching
Verse: And to God belongs the kingdom of the heavens and the earth. And on the day when the Hour sets in on that day the followers of falsehood will be losers.

Name: Crouching
Verse: And you will see every community. Every community will be summoned to its record: ‘Today you will be requited for what you used to do.

Name: Crouching
Verse: This is Our book, which pronounces against you with truth. Indeed We used to write down what you used to do’.

Name: Crouching
Verse: So as for those who believed and performed righteous deeds, their Lord will admit them into His mercy. That is the manifest triumph.

Name: Crouching
Verse: But as for those who disbelieved: ‘Were not My signs recited to you, but you were disdainful and were a guilty lot?

Name: Crouching
Verse: And when it was said: “God’s promise is indeed true, and there is no doubt about the Hour”, you said, “We do not know what the Hour is. We only make conjectures and we are by no means certain” ’.

Name: Crouching
Verse: And there will appear before them the evils of what they did, and they will be besieged by what they used to deride.

Name: Crouching
Verse: And it will be said: ‘Today We will forget you, just as you forgot the encounter of this day of yours, and your abode will be the Fire, and you will not have any helpers.

Name: Crouching
Verse: That is because you took God’s signs in mockery, and the life of this world deceived you’. So today they will not be brought out of it, nor will they asked to make amends.

Name: Crouching
Verse: So to God belongs [all] praise; Lord of the heavens and Lord of the earth, the Lord of the Worlds.

Name: Crouching
Verse: And to Him belongs [all] grandeur in the heavens and the earth, and He is the Mighty, the Wise.

Name: The Wind-Curved Sandhills
Verse: Hā mīm.

Name: The Wind-Curved Sandhills
Verse: The revelation of the Book is from God, the Mighty, the Wise.

Name: The Wind-Curved Sandhills
Verse: We have not created the heavens and the earth and all that is between them except in truth, and for an appointed term. Yet those who disbelieve are disregardful of what they are warned.

Name: The Wind-Curved Sandhills
Verse: Say: ‘Have you considered what you invoke besides God? Show me what they have created of the earth. Or do they have any share in the heavens? Bring me a scripture before this or some vestige of knowledge if you are truthful’.

Name: The Wind-Curved Sandhills
Verse: And who is further astray than him who invokes such as would not respond to him [even] until the Day of Resurrection and who are heedless of their supplication?

Name: The Wind-Curved Sandhills
Verse: And when mankind are gathered, they will be enemies to them and they will deny their worship.

Name: The Wind-Curved Sandhills
Verse: And when Our signs are recited to them, being clear signs, those who disbelieve say of the truth when it comes to them, ‘This is plain sorcery!’

Name: The Wind-Curved Sandhills
Verse: Or do they say, ‘He has invented it?’ Say: ‘If I have invented it, still you would have no power to avail me against God in any way. He knows best what you delve into [of gossip] concerning it. He suffices as a witness between me and you. And He is the Forgiving, the Merciful’.

Name: The Wind-Curved Sandhills
Verse: Say: ‘I am not a novelty among the messengers. Nor do I know what will be done with me or with you. I only follow what is revealed to me. And I am only a plain warner’.

Name: The Wind-Curved Sandhills
Verse: Say: ‘Have you considered? if it is from God and you disbelieve in it, and a witness from the Children of Israel has [already] testified to the like of it, and he has believed [in it], while you act with arrogance …’. Truly God does not guide wrongdoing folk’.

Name: The Wind-Curved Sandhills
Verse: And those who disbelieve say of those who believe: ‘Had it been [anything] good, they would not have attained it before us’. And since they will not be guided by it, they say, ‘This is an ancient lie!’

Name: The Wind-Curved Sandhills
Verse: Yet before it, [there was] the Book of Moses, as a guidepost and a mercy, and this is a Book that confirms in the Arabic tongue to warn those who do wrong, and [as] good tidings for the virtuous.

Name: The Wind-Curved Sandhills
Verse: Assuredly those who say, ‘Our Lord is God’ and then remain upright, no fear will befall them, nor will they grieve.

Name: The Wind-Curved Sandhills
Verse: Those will be the inhabitants of Paradise, abiding therein as a reward for what they used to do.

Name: The Wind-Curved Sandhills
Verse: And We have enjoined man to be kind to his parents. His mother carries him in travail, and gives birth to him in travail, and his gestation and his weaning take thirty months. So that when he is mature and reaches forty years he says, ‘My Lord! Inspire me to give thanks for Your favour with which You have favoured me and my parents, and that I may act righteously in a way that will please You, and invest my seed with righteousness. Indeed I repent to You and I am truly of those who submit [to You]’.

Name: The Wind-Curved Sandhills
Verse: Those are they from whom We accept the best of what they do, and overlook their misdeeds, [as they stand] among the inhabitants of Paradise — [this is] the true promise which they were promised.

Name: The Wind-Curved Sandhills
Verse: As for him who says to his parents: ‘Fie on you both. Do you threaten me that I shall be raised, when already generations have passed away before me?’ And they call on God for succour, ‘Woe to you. Believe! Surely God’s promise is true’. But he says, ‘This is nothing but the fables of the ancients’.

Name: The Wind-Curved Sandhills
Verse: Such are the ones against whom the Word is due concerning communities of jinn and humans that have passed away before them. Truly they are losers.

Name: The Wind-Curved Sandhills
Verse: And for each one there will be degrees [of status], according to what they have done, and that He may recompense them fully for their deeds, and they will not be wronged.

Name: The Wind-Curved Sandhills
Verse: And on the day when those who disbelieve are exposed to the Fire: ‘You squandered your good things during your life of the world and enjoyed them. So today you will be requited with the chastisement of humiliation in return for acting arrogantly in the earth without right and in return for that regarding which you used to act immorally’.

Name: The Wind-Curved Sandhills
Verse: And mention the brother of ‘ād when he warned his people at Ahqāf and already warners had passed away before him and after him, saying, ‘Do not worship anyone but God. Truly I fear for you the chastisement of a dreadful day’.

Name: The Wind-Curved Sandhills
Verse: They said, ‘Have you come to divert us from our gods? Then bring us what you threaten us with, if you are of the truthful’.

Name: The Wind-Curved Sandhills
Verse: He said, ‘The knowledge is with God only, and I am [merely] conveying to you what I have been sent with. But I see that you are an ignorant lot’.

Name: The Wind-Curved Sandhills
Verse: Then, when they saw it as a sudden cloud heading towards their valleys, they said, ‘This is a cloud that will bring us rain!’ Nay, but it is what you sought to hasten a hurricane containing a painful chastisement,

Name: The Wind-Curved Sandhills
Verse: destroying everything by the command of its Lord. So they became such that nothing could be seen except their dwellings. Thu do We requite guilty folk.

Name: The Wind-Curved Sandhills
Verse: And verily We had empowered them in ways in which We have not empowered you, and We had vested them with ears and eyes and hearts. But their ears and their eyes and their hearts did not avail them in any way since they used to deny the signs of God, and they were besieged by what they used to deride.

Name: The Wind-Curved Sandhills
Verse: And We certainly destroyed the towns [that were] around you, and We dispensed the signs so that perhaps they might return.

Name: The Wind-Curved Sandhills
Verse: So why did they not help them, those whom they had chosen besides God, as [a means of] nearness, to be gods? Nay, but they forsook them and that was their lie and what they used to invent.

Name: The Wind-Curved Sandhills
Verse: And when We sent a company of jinn your way to listen to the Qur’ān and, when they were in its presence, they said: ‘Listen carefully!’ Then, when it was finished, they went back to their people to warn [them].

Name: The Wind-Curved Sandhills
Verse: They said, ‘O our people! Indeed we have heard a Book which has been revealed after Moses, confirming what was before it. It guides to the truth and to a straight way.

Name: The Wind-Curved Sandhills
Verse: O our people! Respond to God’s summoner, and believe in him, and He will forgive you some of your sins and shelter you from a painful chastisement.

Name: The Wind-Curved Sandhills
Verse: And whoever does not respond to God’s summoner cannot thwart God on earth, and he will not have, besides Him, any protectors — those are in manifest error’.

Name: The Wind-Curved Sandhills
Verse: Have they not seen that God, Who created the heavens and the earth and [Who] was not wearied by their creation, is able to give life to the dead? Yes, indeed. Indeed He has is able to do all things.

Name: The Wind-Curved Sandhills
Verse: And on the day when those who disbelieve are exposed to the Fire: ‘Is not this the truth?’ They will say, ‘Yes, by our Lord!’ He will say, ‘Then taste the chastisement for what you used to disbelieve [in]’.

Name: The Wind-Curved Sandhills
Verse: So endure [with patience] just as the resolute from among the messengers endured [with patience]. And do not seek to hasten [it] for them. It shall seem for them, on the day when they see what they are promised, as though they had tarried, only an hour of a day. A communication. So shall any be destroyed, but the immoral folk?

Name: Muhammad
Verse: Those who disbelieve and bar from the way of God, He will leave their works to waste.

Name: Muhammad
Verse: But those who believe and perform righteous deeds and believe in what has been revealed to Muhammad — and it is the truth from their Lord — He will absolve them of their misdeeds and rightly dispose their mind.

Name: Muhammad
Verse: That is because those who disbelieve follow falsehood, and because those who believe follow the truth from their Lord. Thus, does God strike for mankind similitudes of themselves.

Name: Muhammad
Verse: So when you encounter [in battle] those who disbelieve, then [attack them with] a striking of the necks. Then, when you have made thoroughly decimated them, bind. Thereafter either [set them free] by grace or by ransom, until the war lay down its burdens. So [shall it be]. And had God wished, He could have [Himself] taken vengeance on them, but that He may test some of you by means of others. And those who are slain in the way of God, He will not let their works go to waste.

Name: Muhammad
Verse: He will guide them and rightly dispose their minds.

Name: Muhammad
Verse: And He will admit them into Paradise, which He has made known to them.

Name: Muhammad
Verse: O you who believe! If you help God, He will help you and make your foothold firm.

Name: Muhammad
Verse: And as for those who disbelieve, wretchedness shall be their lot. And He will make their works go to waste.

Name: Muhammad
Verse: That is because they are averse to what God has revealed, so He has made their works fail.

Name: Muhammad
Verse: Have they not travelled in the land to see the nature of the consequence for those who were before them? God destroyed them; and [a fate] the like thereof will be for the disbelievers.

Name: Muhammad
Verse: That is because God is Patron of those who believe and because the disbelievers have no patron.

Name: Muhammad
Verse: God will surely admit those who believe and perform righteous deeds into gardens underneath which rivers flow. As for those who disbelieve, they take their enjoyment and eat as the cattle eat; and the Fire will be their habitation.

Name: Muhammad
Verse: And how many a town mightier in power than your town, which expelled you, have We destroyed, and they had none to help them.

Name: Muhammad
Verse: Is he who follows a clear sign from his Lord like those whose evil deeds have been adorned for them, and who follow their desires?

Name: Muhammad
Verse: A similitude of the Garden promised to the God-fearing: therein are rivers of unstaling water, and rivers of milk unchanging in flavour, and rivers of wine delicious to the drinkers, and [also] rivers of purified honey; and there will be for them therein every fruit and forgiveness from their Lord. [Is such a one] like him who abides in the Fire? And they will be given to drink boiling water which rips apart their bowels.

Name: Muhammad
Verse: And there are some among them who listen to you, until, when they go forth from you, they say to those who have been given knowledge: ‘What was he saying just now?’ Those are the ones on whose hearts God has set a seal and who follow their own desires.

Name: Muhammad
Verse: But those who are [rightly] guided, He enhances their guidance and invests them with fear [of Him].

Name: Muhammad
Verse: Do they, then, await anything except that the Hour should come upon them suddenly? For already its portents have come. So, when it has come upon them, for what [benefit] will their reminder be?

Name: Muhammad
Verse: Know, then, that there is no god except God, and ask forgiveness for your sin and for the believing men and believing women. And God knows your going to and fro and your place of rest.

Name: Muhammad
Verse: And those who believe say: ‘Why has a sūra not been revealed?’ But when a definitive sūra is revealed, and fighting is mentioned in it, you see those in whose hearts is a sickness, looking at you with the look of someone fainting at [the point of] death. Yet more fitting for them

Name: Muhammad
Verse: would be [to offer] obedience and honourable words. Then, when the matter has been resolved upon if they are loyal to God, it will be better for them.

Name: Muhammad
Verse: May it not be [the case] with you that if you were to turn away, you would then cause corruption in the land and sever your kinship ties?

Name: Muhammad
Verse: Those are the ones whom God has cursed, so made them deaf and blinded their eyes.

Name: Muhammad
Verse: Do they not contemplate the Qur’ān? Or is it that there are locks on, [their] hearts?

Name: Muhammad
Verse: Truly those who have turned their backs after the guidance has become clear to them, Satan has seduced them and has given them [false] hopes.

Name: Muhammad
Verse: That is because they said to those who were averse to what God revealed: ‘We will obey you in some matters’; and God knows their secrets.

Name: Muhammad
Verse: Then how will it be when the angels take them away, beating their faces and their backs?

Name: Muhammad
Verse: That is because they followed what angers God, and [because] they were averse to what pleases Him. Therefore He has made their works fail.

Name: Muhammad
Verse: Or did those in whose hearts is a sickness suppose that God would not expose their rancour?

Name: Muhammad
Verse: And if We will, We could show them to you, then you would recognise them by their mark. And you will certainly recognise them by [their] tone of speech, and God knows your deeds.

Name: Muhammad
Verse: And We will assuredly try you until We know those of you who struggle [for God’s cause] and those who are steadfast, and We will appraise your record.

Name: Muhammad
Verse: Indeed those who disbelieve and bar from way of God, and defy the Messenger after the guidance has become clear to them, they will not hurt God in any way, and He will make their works fail.

Name: Muhammad
Verse: O you who believe! Obey God and obey the Messenger, and do not render your own works void.

Name: Muhammad
Verse: Indeed those who disbelieve and bar from the way of God, and then die as disbelievers, God will never forgive them.

Name: Muhammad
Verse: So do not falter, and [do not] call for peace when you have the upper hand, and God is with you, and He will not stint you in [the reward for] your works.

Name: Muhammad
Verse: The life of this world is merely play and diversion; but if you believe and are wary, He will give you your rewards, and will not ask you your wealth [in return].

Name: Muhammad
Verse: If He were to ask you for it, and press you, you would be niggardly, and this would expose your rancour.

Name: Muhammad
